events.id: Advanced Yoga Class - Level 5-Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Advanced Yoga Class - Level 5
events.venue: Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
These classes are for anyone who has done yoga before and is ready for more advanced yoga postures, done with deeper inner focus and concentration.
The Level 5 asanas and practices are advanced, and thus require a more concentrated and slow practice, with this the influence deepens.
Each asana has a regulatory effect on the organs and glandular systems, the effects unfold during the asana and also during the short relaxation between each asana.
This level includes the practice of the Bhastrika - Pranayama.
Thursdays: 6 - 7.30pm Drop in: $22 or 10 class card or holders of the Monthly passes

events.id: Expressive Watercolour - 5 Week Course-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Expressive Watercolour - 5 Week Course
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
Watercolour is special because of the fluid properties that produce spontaneous and unique results.
The inability to anticipate exactly what the paint will do makes watercolour an exciting medium to work with.
- Learn about transparent colour mixing to create luminosity in your paintings.
- Study the relationship between line and colour and the different ways they can be combined to find a personal style.
Evenings: Thursdays, 6-8 pm 14 August - 11 September.

events.id: FloriDivas: A Drag Dining Spectacular 2025 (VISA Wellington On A Plate)-The Bakehouse, 161 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: FloriDivas: A Drag Dining Spectacular 2025 (VISA Wellington On A Plate)
events.venue: The Bakehouse, 161 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Experience a drag dining spectacle as you step into a world of glamour, glitz and gastronomy, for a cabaret of feasting and fun! Award-winning drag king Hugo Grrrl leads a cast of fierce performers in this dinner extravaganza at the iconic Floriditas. Expect decadence, fun, and a little innuendo – as well as an elegant four-course feast showcasing the best of New Zealand’s seasonal produce.
Starring!
* Slay West - beloved local star of Takatāpui trio The Tiwhas
* Foxy Cleopatra - dame, diva, delight
* Hugo Grrrl - drag king daddy and winner of House of Drag S1.
Doors open at 6.00pm. First show at 6.30pm.
Two nights only! Pre-booking essential. Book now on iTicket.
Part of VISA Wellington On A Plate.

events.id: Happily Never After-Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Sir Jon Trimmer Theatre, 34a Raumati Rd, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Happily Never After
events.venue: Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Sir Jon Trimmer Theatre, 34a Raumati Rd, Paraparaumu
events.description:
Kapiti College presents a drama production that is completely student-directed and student-led!
Happily Never After?
is a bold, original retelling of classic fairy tales—flipping the script on outdated stereotypes, exploring real teen issues, and reimagining what “happily ever after” really means.
This heartfelt and hilarious production tackles friendship, heartbreak, identity, and growing up, all through the lens of iconic characters like Ariel, Aladdin, Cinderella, and more.
With clever storytelling and powerful performances, our young cast and creative team shine in this unforgettable night of theatre.

events.id: Mid-Winter wine degustation-93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Mid-Winter wine degustation
events.venue: 93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To help cheer the mid-winter blues, Smoked & Pickled and Vogelmorn UPSTAIRS invite you to their Mid-winter Wine Degustation in the relaxed atmosphere of the Vogelmorn bowling club.
Avoid the craziness (and prices) of WOAP and join us for a casual evening of drinking, eating and mingling around all things wine and food.
You will be introduce to a selection of wine curated by Timothy Russel from Russel Grant and North End paired with a Buffet imagined by Craig and Alice at Smoked & Pickled.
$60 per person
$10 will be donated to Ridgway school PTA
Book now at smokednpickled@gmail.com
Limited space available so get in quick.

events.id: Moon Open Decks - hosted by Gandoof-167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Moon Open Decks - hosted by Gandoof
events.venue: 167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Moon Open Decks! DJs & producers of all experience levels are welcome to come & share their tunes
We'll be using an XDJ-RR on Moon's house soundsystem, so bring your tracks on a USB (ideally processed in rekordbox, aiff/wav or mp3), bring some friends, maybe make some new ones, or just come down for a boogie! It's always a fun, eclectic mix of genres. Free entry!
Gandoof is a Wellington-based DJ known for deep, genre-blending sets that move bodies and minds. Gandoof creates a welcoming space for new and seasoned selectors to share their sound. Whether it’s dubstep, techno, or beyond, Gandoof brings the vibe.

events.id: Return Season! The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield's Queer Writing-25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Return Season! The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield's Queer Writing
events.venue: 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Back after a sold-out season during the 2025 Wellington Pride Festival!
"She enthrals me, enslaves me – and her personal self – her body absolute – is my worship."
Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga, Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, and Vixen Temple present The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield’s Queer Writing, an immersive theatrical experience in one of Aotearoa’s leading historic house museums.
Join performance artist Vixen Temple and historian Kerryn Pollock of Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga on a journey through Mansfield’s sensual diary entries and sapphic-coded short stories, moving through the rooms in the home of her birth, Katherine Mansfield House & Garden in Thorndon. Live musical accompaniment will be performed by Ms Weeds.
All details and booking via www.katherinemansfield.com

events.id: The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield's Queer Writing-Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield's Queer Writing
events.venue: Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington
events.description:
Back after a sold-out season during the 2025 Wellington Pride Festival!
Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga, Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, and Vixen Temple present The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield’s Queer Writing, an immersive theatrical experience in one of Aotearoa’s leading historic house museums.
The Wednesday performance will be followed by a Q&A session.
Born in Wellington, she lived permanently in England and Europe from 1908 until her untimely death from tuberculosis in 1923.
She became a central figure in literary modernism alongside contemporaries such as Virginia Woolf and DH Lawrence.

events.id: Wellingtaru's 10th Anniversary-264A Cuba St, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Wellingtaru's 10th Anniversary
events.venue: 264A Cuba St, Wellington
events.long_description:
SECOND THURSDAY!!
Hard to believe it's been 10 years since the first Wellingtaru but here we are! Come reminisce if you've joined us in the past or pop in for your first time to find out why we keep turning up after a decade.
Many thanks to our friends at Heyday for hosting us and a fond shout out to our first home of many years, Fork & Brewer.
(second Thursday due to conflicting event schedules at Heyday) https://www.meetup.com/wellingtaru/events/310288128/
If you can, please RSVP, it's free and helps us give Heyday a heads up for their staffing.

events.id: Breathwork: A Journey into Embodied Memory & Inner Truth-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Breathwork: A Journey into Embodied Memory & Inner Truth
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Breathwork: A Journey into Embodied Memory & Inner Truth
Deep Soma Remembering is a breath-led journey into those quiet places within—where emotional density softens, ancestral wisdom rises, and your own inner rhythm becomes unmistakably clear.
This session is for anyone who feels “off” even when everything looks “fine.” For those navigating transition, fatigue, emotional overwhelm, or simply sensing that their body is speaking—and they’re finally ready to listen.
Plus - there is an amazing plant-based dinner included in your ticket!
Core Intention
To reconnect with the intelligence of the soma—the living, sensing body—as a gateway to emotional clarity, ancestral remembrance, and spiritual presence.
What to Expect
Guided Elebreath
session (conscious, rhythmic breathing and somatic presence)
Embodiment practices to awaken sensory awareness and deepen body connection
Intuitive visualization cues and energetic attunement
Gentle music and sacred space to support emotional and energetic release
Closing prompts for reflection and emotional integration
You’ll be gently guided back into your own inner landscape—where truth lives, tension releases, and the nervous system finds a place to land.
Contraindications
This session involves intentional breath modulation, somatic awareness, and nervous system stimulation. Please consult a medical professional or get in contact if any of the following apply:
Pregnancy (2nd or 3rd trimester especially)
History of cardiovascular issues, stroke, or high blood pressure
Epilepsy or severe respiratory conditions
Diagnosed PTSD, schizophrenia, or other unmanaged mental health conditions
Currently taking medications that affect heart rate or nervous system regulation
All participants will be guided to listen to their body’s cues. You may choose to simply receive the energetic field and breathe gently if needed. Your safety, sovereignty, and comfort come first.
Integration Support After Breathwork
Breathwork opens the door—but integration is what sustains the shift. After your session, you may feel light, raw, expanded, emotional, or deeply calm. All responses are valid.
We suggest:
Drinking plenty of water
Taking time to rest and reflect
Journaling or voice noting any insights that arise
Spending time in nature or grounding practices (e.g., bare feet on grass, epsom salt baths)
Avoiding overstimulation or intense conversations immediately after
Free Integration Resource Kit
As part of your experience, you’ll receive access to a free post-session integration kit via my private Circle community, which includes:
A grounding breathwork audio to support your nervous system reset
A curated Spotify playlist for emotional flow
Reflective journaling prompts to deepen embodiment and remembrance


Meet Lynn, your host
Lynn supports visionaries, wellness practitioners, and individuals navigating life transitions to return to the intelligence of their bodies — so they can live, lead, and create from a grounded, soul-aligned state.
As the founder of Elebreath
, her work bridges somatic breathwork, nervous system regulation, and energetic mastery with intuitive embodiment and deep manifestation practices.
Through her signature method, the Soulful Living Blueprint, she guides clients through:
– Somatic breathwork & nervous system healing
– Embodiment and activation coaching
– Soul-rooted manifestation practices
– Holistic wellness integration
– Business systems automation & aligned scaling
................................................................................................
Booking for Thursday is recommended!
For more details and to book please go here--
https://bit.ly/eventTickets
...............................................................................................
Make Thursdays your night to connect and take a break from your week. Events range from creative workshops, wellness courses to entertaining experiences. All within a down-to-earth and welcoming space. Each event wraps up with a plant-based dinner and dessert.
...............................................................................................
Bhakti Lounge
1/175 Vivian Street
Wellington

events.id: Transforming Self-Sabotage: FasterEFT Techniques for Effective Change-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Transforming Self-Sabotage: FasterEFT Techniques for Effective Change
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Transforming Self-Sabotage: FasterEFT Techniques for Effective Change
A FasterEFT-Informed Workshop
Explore the emotional and physiological roots of self-sabotage and how to break the cycle.
In this engaging and practical workshop, you’ll delve into how self-sabotage shows up in different areas of your life. Through a blend of insight, guided reflection, and FasterEFT-based techniques, you'll begin to free yourself from the internal patterns that keep you stuck.
You’ll walk away with a personalised action plan to support real, lasting change.
This workshop will help you:
•⁠ ⁠Identify your personal self-sabotage patterns and triggers
•⁠ ⁠Understand how these patterns affect different areas of your life
•⁠ ⁠Recognize the emotional and physiological roots of self-sabotage
•⁠ ⁠Learn practical FasterEFT techniques to change sabotaging behaviours
•⁠ ⁠Understand the connection between trauma responses and self-sabotaging behaviours
Your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert – come for the insight, stay for the meal shared with like-minded others.


Meet Krishnaloka, your host
Krishnaloka is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.

events.id: Cringeworthy: The 90's-1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Cringeworthy: The 90's
events.venue: 1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Cringeworthy – 90s!
A high-octane explosion of ‘90s nostalgia!
Written and devised by Andrea Sanders
Produced by Beatgirl Productions
Starring Andrea Sanders, Devon Neiman, Jared Pallesen and Emma Katene
Following the success of Cringeworthy ’60s, ’70s and ’80s, this show pays homage to NZ music and culture in the last decade of the 20th century. Expect a ‘rad’ mix of local and international hits delivered with snappy dance moves, scintillating vocals and a generous dollop of cheesy comedy.
The 90s was a decade bursting with diverse musical genres, from boy bands and girl groups to MMMBop and hip hop, the swing revival (Mambo No. 5), country (Achy Breaky Heart), The Macarena and re-releases of iconic hits such as To Sir With Love, Silly Love Songs, Unchained Melody and Get Down on It (can you dig it??).
On the local scene, legends such as Crowded House, Dave Dobbyn, The Exponents, Margaret Urlich, Supergroove, True Bliss, Ardijah, South Side of Bombay and The Chills gave us heavenly pop hits that have become Kiwi classics.
In some ‘fly’ outfits, Cringeworthy – the ’90s packages the hits of the decade (including Can’t Touch This, Weather With You, Love Shack and How Bizarre) with some unforgettable fashion trends including flannel shirts, baggy jeans, tracksuits and chokers. These energetic styles are woven together with a witty narrative reflecting the lifestyle, news events and culture of the time – smelling like Teen Spirit!
What’s the time Mr Wolf? Time to grab your ticket to ride this retro rollercoaster! Nostalgia invites you to relive a decade that still resonates today. Get ready to party like its 1999!

It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

agenda:
- 6:30 PM - 7 PM: arrivals and casual chats

- 7 PM: intro circle

- show and tells

- collabs and jams
---
want to join others in each doing our own thing? ever dream about a future where technology, nature, and society mutually support each other in harmony?
introducing art~hack wellington's weekly jam: a safe space to discover, create, and share creative solarpunk energies with other (shy & introverted) humans.
every thursday we share a mostly unstructured evening of make-believe, of hanging-out-and-ignoring-each-other, of intertwingling. bring whatever is your thing! maybe a side project, maybe a beat in your head, maybe a conversation, maybe some electronics, maybe a notebook, maybe a costume, your art can be anything.
if you're new and/or need to be let in the front door, call the number on the door or send a private message to the event host.

events.venue: 6a Pascoe Ave, Porirua
events.long_description:
Hi everyone! Just letting you all know that next Thursday 14th August will be the Paremata Residents Association AGM
We are hosting the event at Mana Cruising Club (Ngati Toa Domain) and it gets underway at 7:00pm.
We have a guest speaker from Wellington Water (Steve Hutchison, Chief Advisor Wastewater) who will discuss the water network in our area, and give us insight into planned activities and future plans.
We also will run through the usual formalities required for associations (minutes, financial reports etc) and will try our best to not let it be to boring *insert sleeping emoji*
If anyone is keen on joining the committee team, you're welcome to put your name forward on the evening. Or send an email or Facebook message and let us know if you are interested.
The association needs good and willing people to help represent the local community and make our area a great place to live
See you on the night!

events.long_description:
Dave Lintott – Sports photography
Dave Lintott has been a professional photographer for over 35 years and runs a news photo agency and event photography business in Wellington. Sports photography is a big part of his work.
Dave will talk to us about sports photography, showing us some of his photographs and telling us what's involved in getting the images and how he does his work. He will also give us some tips and guidance on photographing sport, to help us to make our own good sports photographs.
You can see some of Dave's work at https://davelintott.photoshelter.com/gallery-list
August 14th - Tararua Tramping Club, Doors Open at 7pm
If you're curious about the Wellington Photographic Society, you're welcome to attend two meetings for free before deciding whether to join. It's a great way to meet the community and see what we're all about!
https://wps.wps.org.nz/

events.name: Free First Home Buyers Evening | 14th August 2025 | Motueka
events.venue: Wallace Street Motueka, Tasman Region
events.description:
Are you thinking about buying your first home?
Join Alice Ridgen, Mortgage Mentor from NZHL Nelson Bays, for an informative evening focused on helping first home buyers navigate the property market with confidence.
Alice will share her expert insights into the current local market and highlight how receiving the right advice at the right time can make a meaningful difference in your home-buying journey.
The seminar will cover essential financial considerations, including budgeting, deposit planning, and understanding your borrowing capacity, to help you best prepare effectively for your first home purchase.
Whether you're just starting to think about buying or you're ready to take the next step, this is a valuable opportunity to gain practical knowledge, ask questions, and receive guidance from an experienced mortgage expert.

Join us every Thursday night at Eva Pub for an unforgettable celebration of Wellington's vibrant music scene!
With an electrifying array of local talent and plenty of opportunities for you to shine, there's no better place to experience the magic of live music than your favorite local hangout.
When: Every Thursday

Supportive Atmosphere: Hosted every week, our Open Mic Night is more than just an event; it's a community. Our friendly host will help you settle in, assist with setup, and organize the sets to ensure a seamless and enjoyable experience.
Community of Creatives: Experience the warmth of a community that appreciates and supports local and new performances. Whether you're a regular or a first-timer, our stage welcomes you with open arms.

events.id: Belly dance taster class #1 (14 August)-205 Main Rd, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Belly dance taster class #1 (14 August)
events.venue: 205 Main Rd, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Curious about Belly Dance? Try a Taster Class in Tawa!
Join Rosina June for a special introductory class - perfect for complete beginners or anyone wanting to reconnect with their body through movement. We’ll explore the foundational movements of belly dance, learn a simple combo, and have fun doing it.
You’ll move to some great music - from classic belly dance rhythms to modern fusion - and get a feel for the uplifting energy of this beautiful dance form
No experience needed
No fancy gear required
Just bring your hips and a sense of curiosity!
Rainbow community welcome - this is a queer-friendly space where everyone is encouraged to dance freely and authentically.
What to wear: comfortable clothes you can move in (yoga or gym wear is perfect)
This is the first of two taster sessions designed to help you get a feel for the class vibe before our regular term begins
Come along, bring a friend, and give it a go for $10

How to Book Your Spot for the Taster Class

You’ve got two easy ways to grab your ticket:
Quick Buy (fast and simple)
* Perfect if you just want to get your ticket and go.
* Click the link, choose your class, pay, and you’re done.
Gym Catch sign-up (best for ongoing classes)
* Create a quick login (just once).
* This will be your hub for booking tickets to future classes.
* Great if you know you’ll be dancing with me again.
Both options are in my Linktree https://linktr.ee/rosinajune

A message from Rosina

17 years ago I discovered belly dance and it changed my life! Its been a wonderful journey of learning, fun and creativity and has taken me to some pretty amazing places and people, I'm excited to share my love of belly dance in my upcoming classes. Will I see you there?

events.name: Mamma Mia!
events.venue: St James Theatre, 77-87 Courtenay Place, Wellington
events.description:
Get ready to say “I Do, I Do, I Do, I Do, I Do!” to the smash-hit jukebox musical based on the songs of Swedish super-group ABBA.
This sunny, funny, international phenomenon unfolds on a Greek island paradise when, on the eve of her wedding, a young woman’s quest to discover the identity of her father brings three men from her mother's past back to the island they last visited 20 years ago.
With music & lyrics by Benny Andersson & Björn Ulvaeus, Mamma Mia!
is written by Catherine Johnson and features non-stop laughs and explosive dance numbers, set to ABBA's hit songs including Super Trouper, Dancing Queen, Knowing Me, Knowing You; Take a Chance on Me, Thank You for the Music, Money, Money, Money; The Winner Takes It All and SOS.
became the 8th longest running show in Broadway history where it played a record-breaking run for 14 years.

events.id: Arizona Flashback-Two Grey, 2 Grey St-WOAP
events.name: Arizona Flashback
events.venue: Two Grey, 2 Grey St
events.long_description:
Dust off the denim, dig out the flip phones and get ready to rewind time. Two Grey is bringing back Arizona Bar & Grill for a limited-time pop-up.

Welcome to The Arizona Flashback, a throwback to the late '90s and early 2000s that revives the flavours, energy and atmosphere of the iconic Arizona Bar & Grill. Known as a go-to spot for after-work drinks, late-night bites, birthday celebrations and casual catch-ups, Arizona was a place where people came together over great food and good times.

Now, its beloved Southwestern-style dishes and all-day menu return — not just as a delicious nod to the past, but as a celebration of shared moments, laughter and connection.

Immerse yourself in the full Y2K dining experience, complete with retro beats, neon lights and the return of Arizona’s famous Spin the Wheel game for a dash of playful nostalgia.

Two Grey is bringing back Arizona Bar & Grill for a limited-time pop-up.

events.long_description:
Upper Hutt locals Tim and Mia Tracey are bringing their first born, Pickle & Pie, to Upper Hutt for one week only.

Taking over the Dough Bakery space in the Whirinaki building, the Pickle & Pie team will be serving up all the classic staples they’re known for: pastrami, lox salmon, latkes, matzo ball soup, and of course, pickles and pies.

events.id: Sconnoisseur-Pravda Café and Grill, 107 Customhouse Qy-WOAP
events.name: Sconnoisseur
events.venue: Pravda Café and Grill, 107 Customhouse Qy
events.long_description:
Get ready to master the art of making Wellington's iconic cheese scones at Pravda Café. Widely regarded as the home of the city's best cheese scones, Pravda's creations are so beloved, they often sell out before you can blink. Now, you can learn the secrets behind their mouthwatering scones firsthand.

In this hands-on workshop, you’ll be guided through mixing and preparing your own batch of Pravda’s famous cheese scones. Once your dough is ready, you'll hand them off to be baked to crispy flaky perfection. While they cook, relax with a cup of tea or coffee, and once your scones are ready, you’ll enjoy the fruits of your labour fresh from the oven.

The best part? You’ll get to take home the coveted recipe, allowing you to recreate these legendary scones in your own kitchen whenever you want. This is a perfect opportunity to learn a piece of Wellington’s culinary history and enjoy a deliciously rewarding experience.

In this hands-on workshop, you’ll be guided through mixing and preparing your own batch of Pravda’s famous cheese scones.
This is a perfect opportunity to learn a piece of Wellington’s culinary history and enjoy a deliciously rewarding experience.

Interislander is docking onshore to bring burger lovers something truly special — The Love Ferry a spicy beef and pork patty with melted Kāpiti brie, caramelised onions, roasted red peppers, rocket, truffle aioli, crispy Harringtons bacon and pickled jalapeños in a Poneke Bakery red brioche bun, with smoked paprika and sea salt sprinkled fries.

events.id: Club Tropicana-Beach Babylon, 232 Oriental Pde-WOAP
events.name: Club Tropicana
events.venue: Beach Babylon, 232 Oriental Pde
events.long_description:
This August, Beach Babylon becomes Club Tropicana, a retro, romantic escape inspired by 1960s tropical honeymoons, classic tiki bars and vintage beach glamour. Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington. No passport required.

The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair. Start with coconut prawns and banana blossom kokoda, then dive into mains like mango glazed  pork rib rack or the tropical tofu paneer curry. Save room for dessert: pineapple upside-down pudding or a coconut rum fondue to bring the tropical fantasy to a sweet finale. Behind the bar, the tiki and kava-spiked cocktails flow freely, from Blue Hawaiian’s to retro rum punches, all dressed to impress with flamingo stirrers, umbrellas and tropical garnishes.

A golden-age soundtrack sets the mood, featuring the smooth calypso of Harry Belafonte, beachy vibes from The Beach Boys, and sun-drenched classics by Astrud Gilberto.

Club Tropicana is a winter getaway, fun and fabulously over the top.
events.description:
This August, Beach Babylon becomes Club Tropicana, a retro, romantic escape inspired by 1960s tropical honeymoons, classic tiki bars and vintage beach glamour.
Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington.
No passport required.
The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair.
Start with coconut prawns and banana blossom kokoda, then dive into mains like mango glazed  pork rib rack or the tropical tofu paneer curry.

events.name: The Enchanted Ale Quarter
events.venue: Little Beer Quarter, 6 Edward St
events.long_description:
Enter the magical realm of The Enchanted Ale Quarter, a fairytale-inspired pop-up tavern where whimsy, wonder and craft beer collide.

Step into a storybook setting, with twinkling lights, woodland decor, and forest-fantasy touches around every corner. Feast on gnome and fairy-themed comfort food like the solstice salad, loaded forest fries, sirens & ships fish & chips, and a decadent dark forest brownie, all paired with enchanted brews and mythical tipples.

Cosy, curious, and otherworldly, The Enchanted Ale Quarter brings a little magic to Wellington’s winter nights. Dust off your wings and join us for a pint, some sustenance or a potion, no quest required.

events.name: Academy Prize for Visual Art
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre
events.description:
A huge exhibition of national artists will be on display at Tākina in August.
Artists from every corner of New Zealand will be vying for a $25,000 grand prize.
The Wellington Sculpture Trust will mount a display celebrating 42 years creating and promoting public art in the city.
Finally, nine South Island artists sharing Netherlands heritage exhibit an irreverent show through a multicultural creative lens.
NZAFA President Wayne Newman says “Tākina is Wellington’s new heart of creativity, and we’re delighted to fill it with the vision, energy, and diversity of New Zealand art.

events.id: Explorers — The Age of Discovery with James May-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Explorers — The Age of Discovery with James May
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Learn about famous and not-so-famous explorers from Ice Age migrations through to space travel.
In ‘Explorers — The Age of Discovery with James May’, the lives of great voyagers come to life on stage.
James May will unravel breathtaking tales.
He covers people like Leif Erikson, John Cabot, James Cook’s navigator Tupaia, Stanley and Livingstone, and Gertrude Bell.
He’s also known for his charisma live on stage and on screen.

events.id: Mamma Mia!-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Mamma Mia!
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Gimme, gimme, gimme a night of song and dance.
Mamma Mia is the ultimate feel-good show.
The stage musical has been wowing audiences since 1999.
It’s due to wow Wellington audiences in 2025.
Get ready to tap your toe to some of ABBA’s most famous songs.

events.id: Visa Wellington On a Plate--Wellington NZ
events.name: Visa Wellington On a Plate
events.description:
New Zealand’s favourite foodie fest is back.
For the whole month of August, Visa Wellington On a Plate (VWOAP) brings culinary delights to hospitality venues across the city and region.
Expect everything from creative events, delicious pop-up restaurants, and the beloved Burger Wellington.
This year, the festival theme is ‘Food is love’.
It's a tribute to the joy of connecting over kai and the capital’s vibrant, resilient hospitality scene.

events.id: Whānau Mārama New Zealand International Film Festival--Wellington NZ
events.name: Whānau Mārama New Zealand International Film Festival
events.description:
Lights, camera, action — the largest film festival in the country is back.
Celebrating 57 years, the Whānau Mārama New Zealand International Film Festival is gearing up for 10 action-packed days in August.
The annual festival presents over 150 feature films, short films, and documentaries.
There’s always a huge and diverse selection of films to choose from.
“These films speak powerfully to the moment we are living in.

events.id: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Orchestra Wellington is New Zealand’s oldest professional regional orchestra.
Its busy concert series includes music from classical, romantic, and contemporary periods.
You’ll also see it regularly performing with the Orpheus Choir, Royal New Zealand Ballet, and New Zealand Opera.
The programme includes masterpieces that symbolise the artist’s struggle and resilience under repression and political control.
Coupled with works from other composers, the concerts feature local and international soloists.

events.id: Come Together 2025-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Come Together 2025
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Recreating three entire classic rock albums live is no easy feat.
The crew from Come Together are up for the task — they have been doing it for five years.
The group of famous New Zealand musicians has organised a stellar lineup for 2025.
First up they aim to capture the raw emotion of Neil Young’s album ‘Live Rust’.
Later in the year, they’ll tackle the atmospheric complexity of Pink Floyd’s ‘Dark Side of the Moon’, followed by the thunderous power of Led Zeppelin’s album ‘Led Zeppelin II’.

events.id: New Zealand Symphony Orchestra 2025 Season-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: New Zealand Symphony Orchestra 2025 Season
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
The NZSO’s reputation for artistic excellence attracts many of the world’s leading musicians, conductors, and soloists.
In 2025 American mezzo-soprano and multi-Grammy Award winner Joyce DiDonato leads the star-studded international list.
At 26, British saxophonist Jess Gillam is the youngest soloist to perform with the NZSO.
Japanese conductor Masaaki Suzuki lends his skills to interpret Baroque works.
Wellington shows are hosted in the Michael Fowler Centre, home of the NZSO.

events.id: Circa Theatre 2025 Season-Circa Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Circa Theatre 2025 Season
events.venue: Circa Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Inside Circa Theatre’s waterfront venue, you’ll find two performance spaces.
Both offer a smorgasbord of professional theatre throughout the year.
Playwrights from international heavy hitters to brilliant Kiwi voices are represented.
It also includes programming from comedies and cabarets to contemporary dance and pantomime.
Called ‘Velarium’, it undulates in the wind mirroring the water in the harbour.

events.id: Royal New Zealand Ballet 2025 Season-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Royal New Zealand Ballet 2025 Season
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
The Royal New Zealand Ballet (RNZB) pushes boundaries with its 2025 programme.
Diverse and captivating works reflect the vision and influence of artistic director Ty King-Wall.

events.id: Santa Cipolla-Cicio Cacio Osteria, 167 Riddiford St-WOAP
events.name: Santa Cipolla
events.venue: Cicio Cacio Osteria, 167 Riddiford St
events.long_description:
“Holy Onion”. For the entire month, Cicio Cacio Osteria is getting brave and bold, celebrating the magic of vegetables in all their glory, especially the santa cipolla (aka the holy onion). 
Vegetables bring colour, life and joy. In Italy, they mark the rhythm of the seasons, stir up cherished memories and signal the excitement of fresh beginnings. Come along and experience vibrant flavours with playful snacks, fun street food, freshly baked breads, handmade pasta and a brand new range of dishes that celebrate the beauty, bounty and simplicity of Italian cuisine.

Come along and experience vibrant flavours with playful snacks, fun street food, freshly baked breads, handmade pasta and a brand new range of dishes that celebrate the beauty, bounty and simplicity of Italian cuisine.

events.id: Cheesy Lovers-Le Marché Français, 262 Thorndon Quay-WOAP
events.name: Cheesy Lovers
events.venue: Le Marché Français, 262 Thorndon Quay
events.long_description:
Calling all cheese lovers! Whether you're planning a romantic date, a fun night with a friend, or a family treat, Cheesy Lovers is the perfect hands-on experience for two — your chance to craft, taste, and share the magic of artisan cheese together.

Begin the evening by exploring the art of fresh cheese-making — a simple yet rewarding process that will have you creating your own delicate cheese from scratch. Our experts will guide you through each step, from curdling the milk to shaping and seasoning your fresh creation.

Start your journey by making two fresh cheeses from scratch, guided by our expert cheesemongers. You and your partner will work as a team to curdle, shape, and season your own cheeses, learning the art of fresh cheese-making step by step.

Then, put your creativity to the test by building a cheese platter for two. Using a curated selection of artisan cheeses, you’ll design a board that balances textures, flavours, and perfect pairings. An array of charcuterie, fruits, nuts, and condiments will be provided, along with expert tips on plating and pairing to ensure your board is as stunning as it is delicious.

This intimate, hands-on experience is designed for anyone who loves good food, great company, and, of course, cheese!
events.description:
Calling all cheese lovers!
Whether you're planning a romantic date, a fun night with a friend, or a family treat, Cheesy Lovers is the perfect hands-on experience for two — your chance to craft, taste, and share the magic of artisan cheese together.
Begin the evening by exploring the art of fresh cheese-making — a simple yet rewarding process that will have you creating your own delicate cheese from scratch.
Our experts will guide you through each step, from curdling the milk to shaping and seasoning your fresh creation.
Start your journey by making two fresh cheeses from scratch, guided by our expert cheesemongers.

events.id: Le Petit Chef-Intercontinental Hotel Wellington, 2 Grey St-WOAP
events.name: Le Petit Chef
events.venue: Intercontinental Hotel Wellington, 2 Grey St
events.long_description:
InterContinental Wellington proudly presents the first official Le Petit Chef experience in New Zealand - an extraordinary fusion of theatre, storytelling, and fine dining.

Step into the whimsical animated world of Le Petit Chef, the world’s tiniest and most determined chef, as he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to source the finest ingredients. Using groundbreaking 3D projection mapping technology, your table transforms into a magical stage, where continents shift, spices fly, and the art of cooking comes thrillingly to life before your eyes.

As the journey unfolds, a five-course menu is served in perfect harmony with the story. Highlights include Wairarapa crayfish bouillabaisse, corn-fed chicken with Perigord truffle, and a decadent Valrhona chocolate dessert. Choose from the Grand Menu ($180), Classic Menu ($140), Vegetarian Menu ($140), or a dedicated Kids Menu $70). While each menu offers a distinct culinary experience, the stunning visual show remains the same for all guests and is centered around the Grand Menu storyline.

Please note, while primarily designed for individual bookings, some shared seating may apply due to the technical nature of the performance.
events.description:
InterContinental Wellington proudly presents the first official Le Petit Chef experience in New Zealand - an extraordinary fusion of theatre, storytelling, and fine dining.
Step into the whimsical animated world of Le Petit Chef, the world’s tiniest and most determined chef, as he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to source the finest ingredients.
Using groundbreaking 3D projection mapping technology, your table transforms into a magical stage, where continents shift, spices fly, and the art of cooking comes thrillingly to life before your eyes.
As the journey unfolds, a five-course menu is served in perfect harmony with the story.
Highlights include Wairarapa crayfish bouillabaisse, corn-fed chicken with Perigord truffle, and a decadent Valrhona chocolate dessert.

events.id: Tea Lover's Odyssey-t Lounge by Dilmah, 22-24 Willeston Street-WOAP
events.name: Tea Lover's Odyssey
events.venue: t Lounge by Dilmah, 22-24 Willeston Street
events.long_description:
Dilmah T Lounge, focusses on promoting tea in an innovative and creative way, offering guests an unforgettable experience. Their single-origin Dilmah tea, sourced directly from Sri Lanka – the Pearl of the Indian Ocean – is at the heart of what they do.

Guests are invited on a gastronomic journey through Sri Lanka's stunning hill country aboard the Dunhinda Odyssey, the latest addition to the Sri Lanka Odyssey fleet. Named after the majestic Dunhinda waterfall, this scenic train departs from Colombo and travels to Badulla, the hometown of our chefs. The journey offers travelers an unparalleled experience, surrounded by breathtaking landscapes and lush tea plantations.

The t Lounge chefs showcase the finest flavours of Sri Lankan cuisine, perfectly paired with premium teas. Each dish and tea pairing is thoughtfully presented in an innovative way, challenging guests to experience and appreciate tea in new and exciting ways.

events.id: Nyumbani: A Taste of Tanzania-Le Ciel Bakery, 6/100 Tory Street-WOAP
events.name: Nyumbani: A Taste of Tanzania
events.venue: Le Ciel Bakery, 6/100 Tory Street
events.long_description:
Journey through the heart of Tanzania with dishes that feel like home - comforting, bold, and full of love. This special five-course degustation is created by Chef Shuchi Bhardwaj, a baker who grew up in Tanzania and carries its flavours, traditions, and warmth in her heart. 
Whether it’s the warm embrace of coconut-infused stews, smoky grilled meats, or fragrant spiced rice, each course is a reminder of how food connects us. This menu brings authentic East African flavours to the table, reimagined in a modern way that feels like home. Each course is matched with a carefully selected wine to enhance the flavours of the dish. Expect generous hospitality and a setting that feels like stepping into a Tanzanian family gathering.

events.id: Drew Rae Roadshow - Wellington-Westpac Stadium, Waterloo Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Drew Rae Roadshow - Wellington
events.venue: Westpac Stadium, Waterloo Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The nature of health and safety work is changing. The scope of responsibilities is expanding. New risks, and new tools, are emerging. Are you prepared? This full-day workshop with Drew Rae has been developed to ready you for a professional future that could look very different from your past.
Dr Drew Rae is an Associate Professor in the Safety Science Innovation Lab at Griffith University, where he teaches courses on research methods and safety engineering, and manages the lab’s research programme. Drew co-hosts the Safety of Work podcast and is on the editorial board of the journal, 'Safety Science'.
Don't miss this rare opportunity to work with a renowned safety thought-leader. In person events are in Auckland, Christchurch and Wellington with an online option available too.

“Your reputation is everything.”
If you are not thrilled at the prospect of constant content creation and marketing, and would rather spend the bulk of your time working with clients, then your Referral Rich Reputation does the heavy lifting of client attraction for you. When you have a team of former clients and colleagues vouching for you, it’s like having your own sales team out there working for you 24/7.
A Referral Rich Reputation is something that grows and grows, provided you are investing in the right activities to support it.
Join Lorraine in this interactive session to learn how to intentionally create a reputation that does the heavy lifting of marketing for you.

events.name: Āhuru Kai Kōhua Poaka: Burger Wellington
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington
events.long_description:
The boil-up is a dish of love, traditionally made in big pots for whānau and friends. It brings people together. Te Papa wanted to capture the essence of this traditional Māori kai and give it a gourmet twist.

Traditional boil-up pork roulade, with Pagro lettuce and tomato, puha mousseline, and horopito aioli in a toasted Brezelmania watercress milk bun, with hand-cut kūmara fries, mānuka honey aioli, a shot of bone broth, and a heart-shaped raspberry framboise dessert.

Join us at the Te Papa Cafe on Level 1, walk-ins welcome. Reserve your spot by booking now.

Please note we aren’t able to accommodate dietary requirements.

events.id: Masterclass – Taumata Kōrero with Alexandre O. Philippe-Entrance D, Block Massey Unviersity, Wallace St Mount Cook, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Masterclass – Taumata Kōrero with Alexandre O. Philippe
events.venue: Entrance D, Block Massey Unviersity, Wallace St Mount Cook, Wellington
events.description:
Take a peek under the hood and get an inside look at the creative process as Swiss-American filmmaker Alexandre O. Philippe leads this special masterclass, with a focus on film history, deep analysis, and the art of cinematic storytelling.
Known for his distinctive approach to the cinema essay, including NZIFF 2025’s Chain Reactions Alexandre invites participants into a world where film is not just watched, but rigorously examined, deconstructed, and cherished.
A must-attend for filmmakers, critics, students, and film lovers alike, this masterclass promises to ignite your curiosity and sharpen your analytical eye.
Bring your questions, your obsessions, and your love for movies – this is cinephilia at its most alive and engaged.
Members of a number of Film Industry Guilds qualify for concession priced tickets to this Masterclass.

Eat Your Art Out brings a creative twist to high tea, inspired by the bold and brilliant works of Toi Art.
Enjoy a menu of classic treats with an artistic edge: from the Sweet William’s Dish, Golden Ratio Scone, Madeleine Moment, and the Mint to Be mousse.
Alcoholic beverages are available for purchase, and dietary options are available on request.

------ Set Menu (Includes one of each item per person) Cheery Cherry Curator A silky milk chocolate crémeux layered with vibrant cherry glaze and topped with a dark chocolate disc creates a perfectly balanced blend of tart and sweet Mint to Be Cool mint and sweet strawberry mousse gently resting on a white chocolate base, combining vibrant flavours that are meant to be together Madeleine Moment A citrus-infused madeleine paired with silky sambuca namelaka, vibrant green apple gel, and an elegant chocolate garnish delivers golden flavours with a playful twist Sweet William’s Dish Mānuka honey ganache nestled in a crisp vanilla tart shell, topped with a chocolate ‘The Dish’ by William De Morgan.

events.name: Interislander: Pop-up Burger
events.venue: Wellington Railway Station, Bunny St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Interislander has been a long-time supporter of Visa Wellington on a Plate, the famous hospitality event that lights up the Wellington region each August.

The Love Ferry
Featuring a Poneke Red brioche bun, with a beef & pork patty seasoned with a mix of smoked paprika, garlic, and a touch of cayenne pepper. Melted Kapiti brie cheese with caramelised onions, roasted red peppers, rocket and truffle aioli. Topped with crispy Harrington’s bacon and pickled jalepenos for those who like a little heat. Served with a side of crispy fries sprinkled with smoked paprika and sea salt at $20. For the perfect pairing, we offer a Garage Project Beer match for $12.

Pop-up Burger at Wellington Railway Station
We've set up a pop-up burger truck outside the Wellington Railway Station. This will allow the public to indulge in our burger and fries without needing to sail on the Interislander. Its also available to passengers when travelling the Cook Strait on the Ferry.

Join the Classical Voice students and the Collaborative Piano Class of NZSM with the senior choir Lyrica from Kelburn Normal Primary School in a magical journey. We start in a bedroom where chairs and clocks come alive and cats,tea pots, and cups talk. There's a Princess, a Fire who only warms the good, a little old man, a chorus of numbers, and all manner of birds, squirrels, frogs and talking trees teaching The Child empathy and compassion.
Children are welcome and will be encouraged to take part so please come dressed as your favourite animal or princess and let us tell you the story.

events.id: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression-Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression
events.venue: Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington
events.description:
Some people may have experienced depression in the past and come along to help manage relapses.
It is a very diverse group and ranges in number from week to week - from 3 to 14 people.
There is a structure to the meetings, with a new topic each week.
What is the structure of group meetings?
- 12:30pm - Meditative grounding exercise - 12:40pm - Opening round – how was your week, a highlight, did you achieve your goal or anything else you’d like to say - 1:30pm - Tea break (about 10 minutes) - 1:40pm - Educational topic - 2:20pm - Closing round - what you found useful, something you are looking forward to this week, possibility to set a goal for the week to come.

events.venue: Kemp Street Mātairangi Room Wellington, Wellington Region
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Leading by Learning, Wellington, August 2025- Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Leading by Learning, Wellington, August 2025
events.venue: Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Leading by Learning is both a theory and practice of effective, ethical educational leadership that enables you to make significant progress on the problems of practice that prevent you or your colleagues from achieving improvement goals.
Leading by Learning is the evolution of the seminal work of Argyris and Schön, whose 30-year research programme described why leaders struggled to create the organisational and interpersonal cultures that build trust, honesty, and collective commitment to solve important problems.
The course fee is $866 + GST per person.
This includes: the cost of the two-day workshop a one-year subscription to the Leading by Learning online hub (a value of $200!)
We are encouraging teams to attend these workshops.

events.id: It's the Little Websites that Count-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: It's the Little Websites that Count
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
For most current technology, it is assumed that the user is always online and has access to unlimited data.
But this assumption is only valid for regions with the infrastructure to support the internet.
As more vital communications and services transition into websites, how do we make sure that these services are still usable in areas with only low bandwidth internet or during natural disasters?
In this event we will start a discussion about developing smaller websites for accessibility in Aotearoa.
About the host Vic Roberts is a computer vision scientist who works with machine learning in medical imaging.

events.id: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Over three sessions create stunning jewellery using the age-old lost wax technique. This is an excellent opportunity to treat yourself to some creative fun!

In weeks one and two you'll learn how to work with jeweller's hard wax to create beautiful textures in metal that can be used to create amazing rings or objects. Your waxes will be sent away for casting in the metal of your choice.

Then there will be a week's break before the third session, to allow time for everyone's waxes to be cast. The third session covers how to trim, clean and finish your casts, turning them into original jewellery ready to wear!

More advanced students can use these sessions to complete projects in a class setting.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs which vary from student to student depending on what sized ring they want to make and the type of metal you choose. Small castings can cost around $6.65 - $12 and might cost between $7 to $30 in metals depending on if you use red bronze, white bronze or silver.

This class is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: Taputeranga: Above and Below exhibition opening-69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Taputeranga: Above and Below exhibition opening
events.venue: 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us as we welcome Rick Allender and Katy Cottrell to Toi Poneke Arts Centre for the opening of Taputeranga: Above and Below. Taputeranga: Above and Below celebrates the vibrant life of the Taputeranga Marine Reserve on Wellington’s south coast. Artists Katy Cottrell and Rick Allender explore the connection between land and sea through intricate works crafted from natural wood veneers. Katy delves beneath the waves, illustrating native marine flora and fauna with a Victorian-era scientific flair. In contrast, Rick maps the reserve’s surface with bold, modernist marquetry inspired by its geography, human structures, and natural landmarks.
Thanks to Fortune Favours, Victoria University Coastal Ecology Laboratory and Wellington City Council.

events.id: BOOK LAUNCH! o(l[i]ve)(*) (bly(th))'s "chrysalis (d[i]s)section"-61 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: BOOK LAUNCH! o(l[i]ve)(*) (bly(th))'s "chrysalis (d[i]s)section"
events.venue: 61 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Please join 5ever books from 6pm on Friday 15th August to celebrate the launch of o(l[i]ve)(*) (bly(th))'s first full length collection of poetry, "chrysalis (d[i]s)section".
From 6pm, at Unity Books Wellington
All welcome, free entry
Drinks and nibbles served
Books will be for sale for $30!
To launch the book, o(l[i]ve)(*) will be joined in performance with Mallory Elmo (violin), in addition to readings from Anneke Westra and Kieran Trainor. More information about the author, book and the performers below.
----------------

Blurb:
chrysalis (d[i]s)section takes a scalpel to poetic form(s), making a collage of neo-[n]ietzschean rhyme, jazz-inspired intonation, & second-wave feminist calls for male castration / in three sections, the 'caterpillar to butterfly' cliché of personal metamorphosis is rewritten, while exoskeletal references are both irreverently & deferentially effaced / silly, serious, & {self-}referential: rhythmically-punctuated wordplay toys with the notion of authorship, across time //
Author bio:
o(l[i]ve)(*) (bly(th)) is an outer-disciplinary artist / she has recently been playing the piano, writing poetry, painting, & poking ink into skin / (her) poetry has been published by various local literary journals & this is (her) first full-length collection of poetry //
---
Launch performances by:
Mallory Elmo (she) (Pākehā) ... born and living in Te Whanganui-a-Tara ... writes noisy lyrical scores for classical performers ... co-convenor with Sophia Frudd of the flexible noise improv group Frogmeat (Frogmeet) .......

with poetry from:
Kieran Trainor (they/them) is an English-born Pākehā artist and writer who works into the light-filled, gooey spaces of the world. Their joint practices are centred on Queer joy and ecological exploration.

Anneke Westra (she/her) is an emerging visual artist and writer. Born and raised in Rotorua, she is currently in her final year at Te Herenga Waka University of Wellington, completing her undergraduate degree in English Literatures & Art History. Although currently working as a studio artist out of Meanwhile, you can also often find her looking for seashells to put in her pocket.

events.id: BOOK LAUNCH: o(l[i]ve)(*) (bly(th))'s "chrysalis (d[i]s)section"-57 Willis Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011-Event Brite
events.name: BOOK LAUNCH: o(l[i]ve)(*) (bly(th))'s "chrysalis (d[i]s)section"
events.venue: 57 Willis Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011
events.long_description:
Please join 5ever books from 6pm on Friday 15th August to celebrate the launch of o(l[i]ve)(*) (bly(th))'s first full length collection of poetry, "chrysalis (d[i]s)section".
From 6pm, at Unity Books Wellington
All welcome, free entry
Drinks and nibbles served
Books will be for sale for $30!
To launch the book, o(l[i]ve)(*) will be joined in performance with Mallory Elmo (violin), in addition to readings from Anneke Westra and Kieran Trainor. More information about the author, book and the performers below.
----------------
Book blurb:
chrysalis (d[i]s)section takes a scalpel to poetic form(s), making a collage of neo-[n]ietzschean rhyme, jazz-inspired intonation, & second-wave feminist calls for male castration / in three sections, the 'caterpillar to butterfly' cliché of personal metamorphosis is rewritten, while exoskeletal references are both irreverently & deferentially effaced / silly, serious, & {self-}referential: rhythmically-punctuated wordplay toys with the notion of authorship, across time //
Author bio:
o(l[i]ve)(*) (bly(th)) is an outer-disciplinary artist / she has recently been playing the piano, writing poetry, painting, & poking ink into skin / (her) poetry has been published by various local literary journals & this is (her) first full-length collection of poetry //
---
Launch performances by:
Mallory Elmo (she) (Pākehā) ... born and living in Te Whanganui-a-Tara ... writes noisy lyrical scores for classical performers ... co-convenor with Sophia Frudd of the flexible noise improv group Frogmeat (Frogmeet) .......
With poetry from:
Kieran Trainor (they/them) is an English-born Pākehā artist and writer who works into the light-filled, gooey spaces of the world. Their joint practices are centred on Queer joy and ecological exploration.
Anneke Westra (she/her) is an emerging visual artist and writer. Born and raised in Rotorua, she is currently in her final year at Te Herenga Waka University of Wellington, completing her undergraduate degree in English Literatures & Art History. Although currently working as a studio artist out of Meanwhile, you can also often find her looking for seashells to put in her pocket.

events.id: The Magnificent Weirdos Presents "First Draft" - Eight Rehearsed Readings of Plays in Development-12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Magnificent Weirdos Presents "First Draft" - Eight Rehearsed Readings of Plays in Development
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
From 15-17 August, The Magnificent Weirdos is teaming up with writers in the early stages of creating new work to present rehearsed readings of these works in progress for the public, followed by audience kōrero with each writer/creator.
All the work is created by writers and devisers with lived experience of disability, neurodivergence, d/Deafness or mental distress.
Each work of approximately 20 minutes will be presented once over the weekend. Each reading will be followed by a 30 minute chat with the writer, facilitated by the director. It's an exciting and creative way to develop new work, both for writers, who receive feedback at an early stage, and for audiences who get to water the seed from which the fruit will eventually grow.
We will also be hosting an industry workshop led by Playmarket, leading a conversation on opportunities, processes and accessibility for new playwrights. Playwrights will need to register for this free workshop which has 20 spaces.
The whole event is NZSL interpreted. Accessible to blind/low vision folks without audio description.
Check out the program for more details of each play, content notes and pre show information here: https://www.magnificentweirdos.com/fd-program
#FirstDraft #Playwrights #LiveTheatre #Playreading #NeurodivergentWriters #DeafWriters #DisabledWriters #HannahPlayhouse #Wellington
INSTAGRAM:
@hannahplayhouse @sameena.zehra @WgtnCC @playmarketnz

events.id: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Jake Baxendale-Level 1/18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Jake Baxendale
events.venue: Level 1/18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
The eighth concert in our series is a new suite of music by local composer, performer, and wearer of excellent hats; Jake Baxendale.
For this concert, Jake is lifting his gaze from the domestic to the majestic with his new suite of music for improvisers, “Sky Meets Country”.
These new compositions utilise tools Jake developed for his Gardening Music ensemble: but where that music takes a granular approach to musical cells, simulating the inward posture of grubbing around in the earth, this new work expands outward to capture the feeling of vastness that open landscapes, bush canopies, and wide, blue skies can inspire.
Jake has written, performed, and recorded extensively over his career, including "Waypeople", a commission for the Wellington Jazz Festival in 2023, and releasing his latest album "Gardening Music" earlier this year.
Tickets are $15, door sales $20.

events.id: Ōtari Glow Worm Tour-160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Ōtari Glow Worm Tour
events.venue: 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington
events.long_description:
Take a guided night tour through Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush and discover some of the fascinating night-time residents on your way to see the titiwai/glowworms. Enjoy the tranquil beauty of the bush after dark and witness the magical glow of these unique creatures.
This outdoor night-time tour takes just over an hour.
If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 5 years and older.
The tour requires a moderate level of fitness, the route includes numerous steps to and from the glowworms.
Meet at the Ōtari Visitors Centre, 150 Wilton Road. Bring warm clothes, walking shoes, and a torch.
This tour is operated by the Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush Trust. Join the Trust from just $20 a year and the glow worm tour is free, plus you’ll be supporting the amazing work the Trust does. Join today at owbt.nz/membership-donations/
Glow Worm Tour Ticket Refund Policy
• No Refunds: We do not offer refunds for Glow Worm Tour tickets.
• Ticket Transfers: If you can’t attend your booked tour, we will put you on a future tour, subject to availability. Please contact us as soon as possible to arrange this.
• Weather Conditions: Tours operate rain or shine. In the event of extreme weather or unsafe conditions, we will reschedule your tour or provide a refund.
For any changes or inquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at Treehouse@wcc.govt.nz or call 04 499 1400.

events.long_description:
Wellington’s iconic Old St Paul’s will play host to a transcendent new series in August, partnering with the Pyramid Club to present Altared States, a unique electronic music experience.
Set beneath the exquisite stained-glass windows of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most exquisite landmarks, this series promises an immersive sonic experience that invites audiences to explore sound in a deeply personal and transformative way.
Altared States is inspired by Brian Sweeney’s New York-founded Ambient Church, an initiative dedicated to collaborating with artists to create transformative audio performances in architecturally significant spaces. This series will immerse attendees in soundscapes that transcend the ordinary, offering a chance to disconnect for a moment from the modern world.
Each of the evenings will bring a different electronic vibe, conjured by some of Wellington’s most innovative artists. The series lineup includes:
August 1: Ludus
August 8: Stephen Gallagher with David Long and Jules Desmond
August 15: Oghum
August 22: Dream Chambers
Set within the chancel at the altar of the venue, each artist will perform a 60-minute immersive sound experience that redefines ritual in a contemporary light.
Tickets are available from Wednesday 18 June, with limited capacity of 50 for each show of this intimate series.
About the Artists
Ludus
is the captivating musical venture curated by Emma Bernard. Her creative inspiration spans across the worlds of electronic music, audio engineering, sound design, and the written word. Bernard’s artistic journey explores the deep connection between soundscapes and the natural world, with a focus on evoking emotional responses to the environments we inhabit. She is also co-founder of the Pōneke-based collective Tonic.
Stephen Gallagher
is an Emmy award-winning composer and music editor who has worked on an extensive range of projects, from global blockbusters to television and contemporary dance. Most recently, he completed the score for The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim, directed by Kenji Kamiyama. Gallagher’s work spans collaborations with Peter Jackson, Brian Eno, Ed Sheeran, Nick Cave, and many more.
David Long
is a composer, performer, founding member of The Mutton Birds, and member of easy listening noise band, Teeth. His career has spanned over 40 years and seen him work on numerous projects to commercial and critical acclaim. In his own words he likes to “mash shit up”, creating orchestral scores that utilise “not only classical instruments but all sorts of things”.
Jules Desmond
is an experimental musician from Wellington who has played in bands including Letterbox Lambs, 1/3 Octave Band, Bachelor of Architecture and Black Boned Angel.
Oghum
is the interstellar duo of Nell Thomas (Orchestra of Spheres, Cookie Brooklyn and the Crumbs) and Jonny Marks (All Seeing Hand, Mean Bones), performing on Synthi AKS, theremin and other assorted items. Oghum blends electronic sounds from times past with an array of acoustic and found sounds, using nuanced improvisation to create detailed and tangible sonic environments, invoking memory and transporting the listener through narrow gaps into wide open otherworldly spaces.
Jess Chambers
is a composer, musician, and educator currently based in Aotearoa New Zealand, and working under the moniker Dream Chambers. From her beginnings as a folk singer to her current explorations in electronic music, she experiments with sound as a practice of attention: to a room, an outer world, an inner feeling. It’s in that space of beholding where transformation and connection occur, and Chambers is a master alchemist, likening that stretch of attention in music to growing a garden: “There’s a lot of searching, reaching and eventual blossoming in my music – it feels like coming up from underground, like a tulip bulb.”
The Pyramid Club, located on Taranaki Street, is an artist-run space dedicated to experimental music and sonic arts, providing a home for innovative sound exploration.

Wellington’s iconic Old St Paul’s will play host to a transcendent new series in August, partnering with the Pyramid Club to present Altared States, a unique electronic music experience.
This series will immerse attendees in soundscapes that transcend the ordinary, offering a chance to disconnect for a moment from the modern world.
Each of the evenings will bring a different electronic vibe, conjured by some of Wellington’s most innovative artists.
Stephen Gallagher is an Emmy award-winning composer and music editor who has worked on an extensive range of projects, from global blockbusters to television and contemporary dance.

events.id: Explorers – The Age of Discovery - with James May-The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Explorers – The Age of Discovery - with James May
events.venue: The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington
events.description:
James May will premiere a landmark live theatre show in Australia, New Zealand and Singapore, bringing to life the stories of the extraordinary explorers who traversed the deserts, scaled the mountains, sailed into the unknown.
The live show combines theatrical techniques and James’ charismatic storytelling to create an evening of compelling intellectual entertainment.
From Ice Age migrations to space travel, the stories of famous, infamous and unknown explorers will come to life in a theatric style, presented by British television presenter and award-winning journalist James May.
James May is best known as a co-presenter of the motoring programs Top Gear and The Grand Tour, and as the host of the Our Man in… TV series.
Few endeavors have captured the imagination and spirit of humanity as profoundly as exploration.

events.id: Ration the Queen's Veges-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Ration the Queen's Veges
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No.
Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien.
ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood.
While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.

events.id: ration the Queen's veges-1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: ration the Queen's veges
events.venue: 1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum
Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho
Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho
In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No. Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien. ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood. While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.
Ration the Queen’s veges is a story of how one action can inspire change in unlikely places. It is a story about the quiet voice of defiance that still burns within us even when we are silenced – a piece of gum and Brian, Te Wehi’s ingenious cellmate, were all that was needed to fan the flames and hear them roar.

events.id: Corrella Skeletons Winter Tour - Wellington-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Corrella Skeletons Winter Tour - Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.description:
Corrella Skeletons Winter Tour - Wellington Friday, August 15 @ San Fran- Wellington With special guests Valley Kids Loop, The Edge and Mai FM are stoked to present Corrella and their upcoming Skeletons Winter Tour!
After a massive summer of festivals and touring alongside L.A.B across Aotearoa and Australia, Corrella are hitting the road this August for their biggest headline tour yet — bringing their new album Skeletons to the stage for the very first time.
The album follows their breakout debut Road From 26, which featured the sleeper hit Blue Eyed Māori—a track that now holds the record for the most weeks ever spent at Number One on the NZ Singles Chart.
This run of shows will be their biggest headline tour to date.
See Corrella live as they hit the road in August for their Skeletons Winter Tour taking on Auckland's Tuning Fork, Hamilton’s Factory, Wellington’s San Fran, Christchurch’s The Church & Dunedin’s Erricks, presented by Loop.

events.id: Fazerdaze (duo) | Wellington-9 Edward Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Fazerdaze (duo) | Wellington
events.venue: 9 Edward Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Fresh off her Aotearoa Music Award wins for Best Solo Artist and Album Of The Year, coupled with the release of her critically acclaimed album Soft Power & new single Motorway, Ōtautahi dream-pop artist Fazerdaze (Amelia Murray) is bringing her special duo show to Christchurch, Wellington, and Auckland.
The last time the Fazerdaze duo hit the road was late last year, when Amelia Murray and bandmate Dave Rowlands (keys and guitar) toured North America alongside Australian psych-rockers POND. Along the way, they delivered a mesmerizing live set at Seattle’s legendary KEXP studio as part of the station’s iconic live-to-air series. Now, local audiences are in for a treat as Fazerdaze brings that same magic home for a series of rare, intimate shows on home soil.
Tickets live 9am Wednesday 11th June via Undertheradar.co.nz & www.fazerdaze.com/tour

events.id: La Bella: 25th Anniversary - Strictly Vinyl Edition-BL3, 8 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: La Bella: 25th Anniversary - Strictly Vinyl Edition
events.venue: BL3, 8 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
La Bella: 25th Anniversary - Strictly Vinyl edition!

In 2000, La Belle wasn’t just a party, it was a reckoning. A bold, bass-heavy moment in Wellington’s club history where women behind the decks claimed the space loud and proud. No permission. No compromise. Just raw talent, deep crates, and dance floor alchemy. It was a night where sonic mischief met feminine force, and the booth finally belonged to women who had long been left out of the spotlight.

25 years later, the original trio returns, not to recreate the past, but to honour the legacy and remind us why it mattered.

Miss Robyn, the original host and pulse of the La Belle movement, brings her instinctive, unapologetic selections back to centre stage.
Odette (aka Gimpgirl), known for her subversive sets and fearless mixing, returns with the same attitude that shook up lazy lineups and demanded more from every beat.
Amber (aka Bandit), the international wax slinger whose fingerprints still live on half the city's record sleeves, comes home to channel decades of global experience into one unmissable set.

This is no nostalgia act. This is a vinyl-fuelled rebellion.

All vinyl. All night.
From classic house to rolling techno and razor-sharp breaks, this is a celebration of the women who carved their place in the booth and never let go.

No sync buttons. No trend-chasing. No gimmicks.
Just three women taking the dance floor hostage, one more time.

events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
Carmichael are back at it again, with their monthly instalment at the Rogue and Vagabond. Joined by very special guests & friends, come escape the final days of hōtoke with one hell of a dance party!
Carmichael is a six-piece jazz ensemble, based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Inspired by different global groove-driven collectives, such as Kokoroko, Ezra Collective, Nubiyan Twist & Fat Freddy’s Drop, their music blends elements of afrobeat, neo-soul and jazz fusion.

Featuring the beloved faces of the below Carmichaelians:

Lily Atu - alto sax & vocals
Elisa Bird - baritone sax
Frank Paton - trumpet
Darcy Monteath - bass
Petar Tavich - guitar
Joseph Alexander - drums
& special guests to be announced!

Music from 9:30pm, FREE ENTRY - Koha for the band encouraged

events.long_description: Join Mojo's team of coffee experts for this hands-on specialty coffee tasting and blending workshop at their iconic roastery on Wellington's waterfront.
