events.id: Best of the Bee Gees Saturday Night Fever and the George Ellis Orchestra-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Best of the Bee Gees Saturday Night Fever and the George Ellis Orchestra
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
You’re invited to put on your boogie shoes and salute the Bee Gees album ‘Saturday Night Fever’.
Released in 1977, the album defined a disco generation.
Tribute act Best of the Bee Gees Saturday Night Fever and the George Ellis Orchestra come to The Opera House in August 2025.
They’ll play chart-busters from that album plus songs from other bands from the 70s like K.C.
Special guests Debora McLane (niece of the Bee Gees) and Roslyn Loxton join the tribute band on stage.

events.id: Paperghost / Rara Sekar & Waterfalls (duo) / Hoof School-Pyramid Club, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Paperghost / Rara Sekar & Waterfalls (duo) / Hoof School
events.venue: Pyramid Club, Wellington
events.description:
Paperghost The musical project of the prolific artist & game developer, Zach Webber.
Inspired by cryptids, horror films & gadgets for sonic manipulation, he mixes live instruments, synths and samples to create intricate music that aims to immerse the listener in a curious space between the sublime, serene and dreadful.
--- Rara Sekar (multi-instrumental) & Waterfalls (flute) Rara Sekar (aka Hara) is an Indonesian singer-songwriter who blends inspiration from folk with Indonesian traditional music, cinematic pop, ambient and field recording.
Amber Johnson (aka Waterfalls) [Ngā Puhi, Ngāti Kahu ki Whangaroa] is a classically trained flautist with a thirst for pushing the flute's capabilities and the sonic possibilities inherent in expanded techniques and experimental music.
Her exploratory sensibilities meld with her love of harmony, modal music and the beauty of lush sounds.

events.id: Planet Parade - Free event-The Albatross Fountain, Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Planet Parade - Free event
events.venue: The Albatross Fountain, Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Six of the seven planets and the Moon will be visible in dawn sky during this week in the final Planet Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), Te Marama (the Moon), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, the craters on the Moon, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!
Please note we will postpone the event to if the weather is uncooperative.
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

events.id: Detroit meets Martinborough-Union Square, 10 Memorial Square-WOAP
events.name: Detroit meets Martinborough
events.venue: Union Square, 10 Memorial Square
events.long_description:
Join Adam Cruz (General Manager, Union Square Bistro in Martinborough) for the second round of his 'Meets Martinborough' series. After delving into the vibrant flavours and stories of Charleston in 2024, this time Adam takes you on a journey to 1980s Detroit.

Step back in time to explore the rich history of Detroit during this iconic decade, filled with fascinating stories and cultural shifts. As you immerse yourself in the era, indulge in six expertly crafted Detroit street foods from the 1980s, each paired perfectly with Rock & Rye as well as local Martinborough wine, gin, and beer.

Let the soulful sounds of Motown and local rock legends set the mood for an unforgettable evening. It’s not just a meal, it’s a full sensory experience that transports you to the heart of Detroit’s culinary and musical legacy.

events.id: Pleasuredome-Ernesto's Cocina Cubana, 1 Grey Street-WOAP
events.name: Pleasuredome
events.venue: Ernesto's Cocina Cubana, 1 Grey Street
events.long_description:
Step into Pleasuredome, Ernesto’s bold, immersive dining experience where curiosity is encouraged, connection is celebrated, and playful fun is on the menu. From the moment you arrive, you’ll be welcomed with a glass of bubbles or a cheeky cocktail and swept into a sultry, tropical setting pulsing with warm beats and even warmer vibes. Charming MC Melody Thomas from The Good Sex Project will set the tone for an evening that blends aphrodisiac-inspired dining with deliciously daring entertainment.

Across the night, dive into a three-course feast, a refreshingly honest Q&A on love and intimacy hosted by Melody, and a few surprises - including a sex toy spotlight and the wildly entertaining vibrator races. With interactive moments, table icebreakers, and a pop-up “After Dark” shop, Pleasuredome is sexy, smart, and seriously fun. Come solo, with mates, or your main squeeze...just bring an open mind.

Entrée will tease the appetite with oysters or a velvet tofu kiss
Main course will be rich and indulgent - prime beef fillet, or snapper with luscious beurre blanc, or soul warming and decadent vegetable curry. 
Dessert will be your sweet climax - chocolate fondue and a Bohemian chocolate heart to take home.

events.id: Porirua Parkrun-Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Porirua Parkrun
events.venue: Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
What is Porirua parkrun? It is a free 5km walk or run event - It’s not about coming first or winning. You can go at your own pace and just enjoy being with other people. It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.

The start occurs just upstream of the Bothamley Park carpark. This car park is off Champion street, opposite the intersection with Windley Street. Head to end of carpark where the concrete ends and there is a gate. For location see https://goo.gl/maps/wEohfp9bRu82.

The course is following the old coach road (circa 1870's) established for the early farms in the area. Today this historic track is located within a park, away from cars and now used by walkers, runners and cyclists.

The track is generally 3 metres wide with a gentle gradient and a compacted gravel surface beside the Kenepuru Stream through a picturesque wooded wild valley. (Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres)

The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.

What does it cost to join in? Nothing - it's free! but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results. You only need to register with parkrun once, to participate at any of the parkrun events around the world. Don't forget to bring a copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be? Walking is fine as long as you can finish the 5km. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!

One dog per adult is welcome, as long as it is on a short hand held lead.

Children welcome but those 10 years and under need to be kept within arms reach of a supervising adult.

Note there is no toilets in the park, so go before you go.

We're friendly! Every week we grab a post park run/walk coffee/tea at Get Fixed within Kai Tahi at 20 Parumoana Street, to mix exercise with socialising.

There are volunteering opportunities even week. So those doing Duke of Edinburgh or similar challenges can get volunteer credits. Ensure you contact us well in advance at "porirua@parkrun.co.nz"

events.id: Padi Advanced Open Water Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Padi Advanced Open Water Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.description:
The AOW course is designed for both new and more experienced Open Water Divers and is best attended as soon after your Open Water Diver course as possible.
That way you will increase your confidence and build scuba skills to become safer and more comfortable in the water; all under the supervision of a PADI Instructor.
The AOW course consists of five dives that includes a: Deep and an Underwater Navigation dive.
Popular local options for the remaining three dives are: Peak Performance Buoyancy, Naturalist, Wreck, Fish Identification, Imaging, Night, *Enriched Air or *Dive Against Debris (* conditions apply).
This is the minimum requirement for our dive adventures and a prerequisite for the PADI Rescue Diver course.

events.description:
You'll be shown the program and the main features of its desktop, and then be taken through how to create and work with the main publishing items (text and graphics) in order to create your own publication.
Note: All computer courses are run in the school computer labs and you are required to use the school desktops for the duration of the course (you are not able to use your own laptop).

By the end of the course you'll be able to: • Describe the features of InDesign and how to work with them • Create text frames, connect text frames and format text • Create shapes and frames and format them • Import pictures into publications • Use rulers, guides and the pasteboard to lay out pages • Finish off, check and then print Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Messengers-National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Messengers
events.venue: National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington
events.long_description:
‘Animals first entered the imagination as messengers and promises,’ John Berger.
Messengers explores the enduring gaze shared between humans and other animals. The exhibition title is inspired by a line from John Berger’s seminal 1977 essay ‘Why Look at Animals?’ Berger argued that the relationship between humans and animals – ‘our unspeaking companionship’ – has been transformed by capitalism.
Messengers brings together historical and contemporary ways of looking at animals in photography and art. It features archival photographs from the National Library and Alexander Turnbull Collections, first taken by newspaper photographers in the mid twentieth century. The images capture everything from the polar bears once housed in Wellington Zoo, to an elderly gentleman standing amongst the life size concrete animal sculptures in his garden. These images are at once tender and loving, sentimental and silly, kind and indifferent.
Messengers places these archival photographs in proximity and conversation with contemporary sculpture and moving image works by four Aotearoa-based artists: Denise Batchelor, Brit Bunkley, Jane Dodd and John Ward Knox. From eerie AI and computer-generated animals to the hypnotic stare of a real live Ruru; from carved wooden godwits you can hold in your hand to ‘hominoid’ brooches, each artist’s work speaks to the ‘unspeaking companionship’ between humanity and other animals.
IMAGE Brit Bunkley, still from Transit, single channel video, 2025

events.id: Negotiation Skills for Successful Outcomes-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Negotiation Skills for Successful Outcomes
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Everyone negotiates—at work, at home, or anywhere in between. Whether you're closing deals or resolving conflicts, learn how to get what you want and bring others on board with your vision. (NZ citizens and residents free with ID, others pay $100).

Description
Negotiation Skills for Successful Outcomes

What’s the Goal?
To arm you with the strategies, skills, and mindset to walk into any negotiation and leave with the outcome you desire.

What You'll Discover:

Crack the Code on People: Spot different types of negotiators and tailor your approach using the DISC methodology.
Gear Up for Success: Build a killer prep list with intel on your opponent and a clear inventory of your strengths.
Own the Room: Master the art of negotiation strategy, use space to your advantage, and know the unspoken rules.
Discover Your Edge: Tap into your natural negotiation style and make it work for you.
Learn from the Masters: Unlock game-changing tips and theories from the biggest “gurus” in the field.
Practice Makes Perfect: Get hands-on with exercises that turn theory into action.
Ready to negotiate like a pro? This workshop will show you how to make your case, win people over, and seal the deal.

You must be a NZ citizen or resident to register in this course for free and you must provide photo ID when you attend.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.id: Retirement Reinvented-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Retirement Reinvented
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Whether you’re already retired, or planning ahead, this practical workshop will help you to reflect, re-envision and re-vitalise your life and develop a plan for your future, on your own terms. (NZ citizen and residents free with ID, all others pay $109).

In your middle years, working, retired or somewhere in between? What’s next? Life is about much more than work or leisure, but most of us have given little thought to what “retirement” might mean.

It’s difficult to speculate what may happen in the future – but we can be proactive and take control.
This course offers insights into how to make the most of our time once we’re less focused on career and/or childrearing. It covers many of the issues people face when considering a move from current employment to a different lifestyle that includes more time to do the things we’ve always promised ourselves we’d do – “when we retire”.

After the workshop, you’ll be able to identify a number of common issues and potential ways to manage them when considering and planning your “rejuvenation”, rather than a retirement. We won’t cover financial planning, but will focus on some of the personal growth opportunities for living and making a conscious contribution to your community.

By the end of the day, you’ll have:
- Developed your own perspective on ageing and retirement in the 21st Century and identified what’s important to you
- Completed a personal life audit exercise and considered your strengths
- Explored possibilities in the major aspects of your life and identified potential challenges and strategies for overcoming them
- Developed a blueprint to maximise the best years of your life and developed a “future proofing” downsizing plan
- Considered options to include a sense of purpose and explored and implemented choices that provide you with that sense of purpose
Bring a pen and paper.

1 day, Sat 9:30 AM – 4:00 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Angela Robertson

events.id: COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish- Tinakori Road Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish
events.venue: Tinakori Road Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for a relaxed, hands-on workshop where you'll create your very own ceramic butter dish in a working pottery studio. Over two inspiring hours, you'll learn the basics of hand-building with clay, guided step-by-step by a ceramic artist.
Unwind with a hot drink and homebaking as you get creative with shaping, decorating, and embellishing your piece. You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we'll take care of the firing process. Your finished butter dish will be ready to collect approximately four weeks later.
This small group workshop is perfect for absolute beginners—no experience needed. Come solo and meet like-minded creatives, or bring a friend for a fun and mindful morning.
You’ll be amazed at how calming it is to get out of your head and into your hands!

events.id: Fascinating Fungi: A practical macro photography workshop-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Fascinating Fungi: A practical macro photography workshop
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Learn the art of macro fungi photography from award-winning New Zealand macro photographer Paula Vigus.
For this special Sony Scene practical workshop we are bringing Paula to Wellington to share her knowledge and demonstrate how she goes about achieving such wonderful macro images of fungi. Paula will demonstrate using her camera setup of choice: the Sony Alpha 7R V and FE 90mm F2.8 G macro lens. This workshop is open to all camera brand users and is designed for beginner macro shooters.
You'll come away from this workshop equipped with the knowledge of interesting and endemic fungi, how to plan and approach an outdoor macro shoot, the ideal camera settings and what you need in your macro kit. Paula will also provide an online post-production session so you can see how she edits her incredible macro shots.
This practical workshop involves:
An online briefing prior to the practical workshop.
3-4 hours on the ground shooting with Paula in the Botanic Gardens
An online editing session
An optional photo review one week following the workshop

events.name: Ngaio Repair Cafe
events.venue: Ngaio Union Church, 3 Kenya St, Wellington
events.description:
Ngaio Repair Café, organised in and by Ngaio Union Church, is part of the worldwide Repair Café movement to cut down waste and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
Our local volunteer repairers will look at and try to fix all sorts of household gear: wooden, metal, electrical, electronic, pottery, computer, fabric, toys, clothing, beads, cardboard – as long as it’s small enough for you to bring.
One of our volunteers is a guitar repairer who can mend and tune any fretted instruments.
Another has an oilstone and will sharpen knives.
While you wait to have your item looked at, tea and coffee and cold drink are provided.

events.venue: Otaki Montessori Pre School, Haruatai Park, Mill Rd, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
This is a great opportunity to see our beautiful Preschool environment nestled beside the native forest area of Otari Wilton's Bush which we utilise for our weekly bushwalk.

Meet our 100% registered teachers and ask any questions.

We are a not-for-profit, community Preschool offering affordable Montessori Early Childhood Education. Catering for children from birth to 6 years.

Small class sizes.

Our vision is to "nourish the human spirit to create a better world".

We currently do have a few spaces for immediate start for both our Playgroup and Preschool.

Our Preschool (2 years 9 months - 6 years) hours are 8.30am - 1pm five mornings/week with fees of $23.50 per week. If you wish afternoon classes can be added on top of the mornings with hours 1pm - 2.45pm for any or all days. See fees on our website. We also offer a holiday programme for both weeks of the school holidays (not Christmas).

Our Playgroup (for 0 - 36 months) runs sessions on Tuesday and Thursday 8.45-11.45am out of Cardinal McKeefry School. Pop in for a visit anytime, Camilla our Playgroup Supervisor will welcome you.

For more information call the Preschool on 475 9688 or visit our website.

Bring the whole whanau, we really look forward to meeting you.

Our on farm Craft Open Days are aimed primarily at knitters, spinners, crocheters and other fibre crafters.
Romney, Corriedale cross Romney, Polwarth & Gotland sheep provide the fleeces to create fibre products for crafters which are sold via the Rewa Rewa Station website, and at Fibre Markets.
Our Craft Days give you an opportunity to work on your own project, seek advice, learn a new fibre skill or maybe just spend time with fellow fibre crafters while potentially ticking off a project or two in the process.

Everyone is welcome the more the merrier!

events.id: ‘A Vocabulary’ exhibition — Artist’s talk with Bruce Connew-Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: ‘A Vocabulary’ exhibition — Artist’s talk with Bruce Connew
events.venue: Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join artist and photographer Bruce Connew in a tour of his exhibition ‘A Vocabulary’, which features photographs of memorials and gravestones of Aotearoa’s colonial wars.
A vocabulary of colonisation
The exhibition, A Vocabulary, is a narrative selection of photographs by artist Bruce Connew. He spent several years “roaming among” the memorials and gravestones of Aotearoa’s colonial wars, seeking out and photographing the texts on these testaments.
Join Bruce Connew for this artist’s talk where he will discuss the genesis of the exhibition and its relevance in 2025.
About the speaker
Bruce Connew is an artist and photographer based in Tāmaki Makaurau Auckland.
Image: Heke’s Pah, photo by Bruce Connew, 2018. Used by permission.

events.venue: Martinborough Town Hall, 8 Texas St, Martinborough
events.description:
It's round, it's blue, and inside it, your mini astronauts will learn about planets, galaxies, the origin of life, and whether aliens are out there.
Most importantly, they get to ask questions to real space scientists!
Hari is an astrobiologist who interned at NASA and is a Mars researcher, and Sam is an astrophysicist.
They both love answering questions about space and looking at the stars at night with really large telescopes (make sure you check their Star Safari experience too).
No scripts, no recordings – just real science, real stories, and your real questions.

events.venue: 317 Mansfield St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Crop Swap is a FREE heart-warming monthly community gathering to share what we have with each other. Think of it like a community garden potluck when each offering regardless of the amount adds up to a bounty.
Everyone is welcome - with or without something to share
WHEN?
Come along at 10:30am for a kōrero with our friendly community and enjoy free @Peoples coffee, usually with a scone or muffin that someone has brought along.
Swapping kicks off from 11.00am.
WHERE?
You can find us in the community room on the ground floor of block C of the Newtown Park Apartments, 320 Mansfield St, Newtown, Wellington.
IDEAS OF WHAT TO BRING
Bring a friend!
Maybe you like baking?
Surplus lemons?
excess seedlings
Have garden books or magazines to destash?
Too much silver beet going crazy?
Left over seeds from summer to share?
Got some foraged flowers?
Crop Swap is the place for you!
Note; giving isn't necessary but we do welcome koha of help / waiata / pūtea towards costs like room hire / milaka etc.

events.id: Well-heeled: The Personalities Behind the Shoes- Laings Road Lower Hutt, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Well-heeled: The Personalities Behind the Shoes
events.venue: Laings Road Lower Hutt, Wellington
events.long_description:
Take a peek inside the closet of a world-renowned artist, a noted curator, and an executive people leader, and find out what we can learn about them through their shoes. Hear from Lisa Reihana, Nigel Borell and Karepa Wall about their shoe collections on display in Well-heeled: Shoes with Personality. Director Karl Chitham will be diving into the stories behind the shoes, and the lives of their wearers, to get a glimpse of the personalities behind the shoes. Come along and walk a mile in the gorgeous shoes of these three fabulously shod individuals.
Lisa Reihana is a multi-disciplinary artist whose practice spans film, sculpture, costume and body adornment, text and photography. Since the 1990s she has significantly influenced the development of contemporary art and contemporary Māori art in Aotearoa New Zealand. She has earned an outstanding reputation as an artist, producer and cultural interlocutor with her attention to the complexities of contemporary photographic and cinema languages expressed in myriad ways. Reihana represented New Zealand at the Venice Biennale in 2017 with the large scale video installation in Pursuit of Venus [infected] (2015-17). The work premiered at the Auckland Art Gallery in May 2015 and has since become a seminal work in Aotearoa New Zealand’s art history canon. in Pursuit of Venus [infected] has since been shown around the world and garnered widespread critical acclaim.
Nigel Borell is of Pirirakau, Ngāti Ranginui, Ngāi Te Rangi, Te Whakatōhea tribal descent. He is a curator, writer and artist specialising in Māori art in both customary and contemporary fields of research. His career began working on three meetinghouse projects under tohunga whakairo Pakaariki Harrison and Peter Boyd followed by formal study at Massey University’s Bachelor of Maori Visual Arts (Hons) in 2000 and a Master of Fine Arts (Hons) in 2003 from Elam School of Fine Arts, The University of Auckland. Borell curated the large survey exhibition Toi Tū Toi Ora: Contemporary Māori Art, Auckland Art Gallery Toi o Tāmaki (2020-2021), where he was the Curator Māori art from 2015-2020. He is currently Curator Taonga Māori at The Auckland War Memorial Museum Tamaki Paenga Hira.
We asked Karepa Wall for a bio but haven’t heard back from him. He may have been buried under an avalanche of his collection of more than 250 pairs of shoes. Someone should really do a wellness check.
events.description:
Take a peek inside the closet of a world-renowned artist, a noted curator, and an executive people leader, and find out what we can learn about them through their shoes.
Hear from Lisa Reihana, Nigel Borell and Karepa Wall about their shoe collections on display in Well-heeled: Shoes with Personality.
Director Karl Chitham will be diving into the stories behind the shoes, and the lives of their wearers, to get a glimpse of the personalities behind the shoes.
Since the 1990s she has significantly influenced the development of contemporary art and contemporary Māori art in Aotearoa New Zealand.
Borell curated the large survey exhibition Toi Tū Toi Ora: Contemporary Māori Art, Auckland Art Gallery Toi o Tāmaki (2020-2021), where he was the Curator Māori art from 2015-2020.

events.id: First Draft: Playmarket Hosts a Workshop for Writers-12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: First Draft: Playmarket Hosts a Workshop for Writers
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
Murray Lynch, director of Playmarket NZ, hosts a conversation on opportunities, processes and accessibility for new playwrights.
This event is free, but registration are required. Only 20 places available so early registration is encouraged.
If you would like an NZSL interpreter for this event, please indicate this when registering.
ABOUT FIRST DRAFT
From 15-17 August, The Magnificent Weirdos is teaming up with writers in the early stages of creating new work to present rehearsed readings of these works in progress for the public, followed by audience kōrero with each writer/creator.
All the work is created by writers and devisers with lived experience of disability, neurodivergence, d/Deafness or mental distress.
Each work of approximately 20 minutes will be presented once over the weekend. Each reading will be followed by a 30 minute chat with the writer, facilitated by the director. It's an exciting and creative way to develop new work, both for writers, who receive feedback at an early stage, and for audiences who get to water the seed from which the fruit will eventually grow.
The whole event is NZSL interpreted. Accessible to blind/low vision folks without audio description.
Check out the program for more details of each play, content notes and pre show information here: https://www.magnificentweirdos.com/fd-program

events.id: Opening Day: Messengers Artists’ Talk-Corner Molesworth and Aitken Streets, Thorndon, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Opening Day: Messengers Artists’ Talk
events.venue: Corner Molesworth and Aitken Streets, Thorndon, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us to celebrate the opening of City Gallery Wellington Te Whare Toi’s exhibition Messengers at The National Library of New Zealand Te Puna Mātauranga o Aotearoa. Hear artists Denise Batchelor, Brit Bunkley, Jane Dodd and John Ward Knox in a series of conversations with curator Megan Dunn, about how each artists work ask us to consider the ‘unspeaking companionship’ between humanity and other animals.
Denise Batchelor is a visual artist based in Hokianga, in the far north of New Zealand. Batchelor has an MFA (2010) from Whitecliffe College of Arts and Design, Auckland. Working primarily in digital media, both still and moving image, Batchelor’s work reflects personal encounters within nature; quiet moments of reflection within which deeper connections can be experienced. She has exhibited widely in New Zealand for the past fifteen years, and internationally in Sweden, Germany, Italy, USA, Scotland and France. A recipient of artist residencies and art awards, her work is held in public and private collections.
Brit Bunkley is a New Zealand-based artist and videographer whose practice spans sculpture, installation, and digital media. A recipient of the US National Endowment for the Arts fellowship, two NY state grants, and the Rome Prize Fellowship, his work explores the intersection of physical and virtual spaces, often blending surreal imagery with themes of history, politics, and environmental concerns. He has exhibited at the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa and internationally at Rencontres Internationales Paris/Berlin, FILE São Paulo (including 2025), and the Athens Digital Arts Festival. Recent exhibitions include Visions in the Nunnery, London (2022), Cybersculpture 2024 at Collège des Bernardins, Paris, and The Torrance Art Museum, LA (2025). In 2024, he won Best Art | Experimental Video/Film at the New York City Independent Film Festival. His work continues to evolve, embracing new technologies and alternative methodologies to challenge perceptions of reality and imagination.
Jane Dodd is a contemporary jeweller based in Dunedin. Dodd has a BA from Otago University and a Diploma in 3D design from UNITEC in Auckland. Since the early ‘90s she has exhibited widely in solo and group exhibitions in New Zealand and internationally.
Her jewellery is largely a carving-based practice utilizing re-purposed woods and bone. Narratives from the environment and animal world, homages to historic crafts, critiques of modern society, mysterious plotlines, comedy and tragedy can all be found in her jewellery.
John Ward Knox is an artist living in Karitane, north of Ōtepoti (Dunedin). He has a Master of Fine Arts from Elam School of Fine Arts and was the recipient of the National Drawing Award, in 2008, and the Frances Hodgkins Fellowship at Otago University, in 2015. His work has been included in The Archibald Prize, Art Gallery of New South Wales, Sydney (2020) and is included in New Zealand and Australian collections. Ward Knox leans towards materials and objects that are imbued with time and patience and are rewarding to touch.

events.id: Hands-on Sourdough Workshop- Gossey Drive North Wakefield, Tasman Region-Event Brite
events.name: Hands-on Sourdough Workshop
events.venue: Gossey Drive North Wakefield, Tasman Region
events.description:
This workshop is currently the only hands-on sourdough workshop being offered in the Nelson region - I teach and demonstrate to you and then you get to mix and practice on your own dough as we go along.
Then this is for you!
You'll go home with all you need to make a good loaf of sourdough bread: Knowledge Student Guide, including recipes and troubleshoot guide Bowl, liner, bowl scraper, and razor blade... all the tools you'd need to make sourdough Dough made in class to bake the next day at home, to wow your family/friends Confidence to continue the process yourself Healthy, bubbling starter to continue your journey at home Continued support and encouragement via our own private Facebook community group, for class attendees only Note: You will have your dough to take home after the workshop that will need shaping around 6-8pm, so please ensure that will work for you that day.Also, please double check the date when booking.
If for some reason you are unable to attend on the day, due to time constraints, I am unable to refund your ticket.
From feeling overwhelmed and giving up on the idea of ever making my own loaf of sourdough, to dancing with joy as i watch a beautiful perfect sourdough loaf get nice and golden in the homewood stove!The information was packaged in bite sizes with hands on practice in between, where we all got to experience each step of the whole process, which was cleverly condensed and prepared so that despite normally having waits in between, we were able to see it all play out in a short few hours!The process was beautifully organised with attention to detail that had us fawning, came away feeling so blessed and privileged!Sarah's glowing personality made all the information feel easy and palatable, it was so fun!Such a lovely time, great environment to learn with ease."

Koraunui Ukulele's objective is to turn members into seasoned performers by providing: - Weekly Ukulele, performance and stage skill practice sessions - Monthly performances with each member taking turns performing on front stage mic - After gig team photos - Regular team video uploads - Regular song writing projects The aim is to 'get a group going that could include people with zero experience and take them all the way through to performing'.

events.name: Pōneke Pump n' Dump - Pinball Tournament
events.venue: 14 Bond St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
PINBALL TOURNAMENT AT YE OLDE PINBALL SHOPPE
Pōneke's Premier Pinball Tournament for your future career as an internationally ranked pinball player!
Make a hearty pilgrimage through the arcade, trying your hand at a selection of our finely curated games, report your scores to the staff, and watch your ranking on the tournament ladder rise as your scores are stacked up against your competitors. Not happy with a score you got? No problem, you can keep trying until you're
happy with it!
Make it into the Top 16 before the end of Saturday, and you'll be invited to play in the finals round the following Sunday, where 1st - 8th will play in A Division, and 9th - 16th will play in B Division.
This finals round is free of charge, and comes with a whopping prize pool worth $200 in value awarded to the top finishers in each division.
So what are you waiting for? Come and show us your skills!
Qualification Round (10th - 16th August):
Each player is granted access to a token deal of 12 tokens for $20!
- Sunday to Saturday
- Submit at least one score on each of the selected 8 games during open hours.
- Your best score on each game is ranked.
- Take a picture of your score and submit it at the counter.
- Unlimited qualifying! Not satisfied with your score? Grab more tokens and keep playing to improve it!
Scoring System:
- Linear Scoring applies. Score 100pts for the top score on each selected game, 99pts for 2nd, 98pts for 3rd, and so on.
Finals (13th July):
Top 16 qualifiers will battle it out on Sunday from 12pm onwards, with 8 in A-Division, and 8 in B-Division! Keep an eye on our socials if you've participated in the competition throughout the week - those who have qualified for the finals will be announced on SATURDAY night (the 12th).
You could win a share of $200 in Shoppe Credit!
How to Participate:
Simply come to Ye Olde Pinball Shoppe during open hours and submit your scores from Monday to Saturday!
Location:
18A Bond Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
This month's games are:
Big Guns
D&D
Foo Fighters
Iron Maiden
Jack Bot
Labyrinth
Led Zeppelin
Twilight Zone
Come, participate, and let’s find out who the true Pinball Wizard is! May the best player win!

events.long_description:

events.id: Discover Te Muna – Explore the Wines-Craggy Range Te Muna Vineyard, 275 Te Muna Rd, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Discover Te Muna – Explore the Wines
events.venue: Craggy Range Te Muna Vineyard, 275 Te Muna Rd, Martinborough
events.description:
Born from passionate vignerons who embrace the challenge of extreme weather conditions, Te Muna Valley’s unique microclimate and soil structure produce exceptional wines with a distinctive style.
Join us for an interactive tasting led by wine writer and educator Joelle Thomson, as we explore a curated selection of Te Muna wines from a variety of producers.
You will be picked up from the Square in Martinborough and driven to the stunning Craggy Range Te Muna Estate vineyard, not normally open to the public.
Joelle will guide you through a tasting of twelve of Te Muna wines.
The experience concludes with a relaxed opportunity to revisit some of your favourites from the tasting and snack on some local products while meeting several of the producers, before being transported back to the Square.

events.id: Thyme Well Spent: Bubbles & Breads-1023 Longbush Road, Masterton-Facebook
events.name: Thyme Well Spent: Bubbles & Breads
events.venue: 1023 Longbush Road, Masterton
events.long_description:
Nestle into the warmth of the Longbush Cottage glasshouse for a mindful winter afternoon of watercolour nature journaling. Surrounded by the subtle beauty of the winter garden, you’ll be guided to sketch and paint seasonal herbs like rosemary, thyme, and sage, learning techniques to capture detail and texture in your journal. This peaceful session is perfect for slowing down and reconnecting with nature through art.
Sip on bubbles and savour warm rosemary focaccia with herb-infused oil as you work. No experience required- just bring a curious eye and a love of seasonal beauty.
Date & Time: Saturday 16th August | 2-4pm
Location: 1023 Longbush Road, Longbush 5884
(20 min scenic drive from Martinborough)
Price: $119

events.id: Walking with Alpacas-Cantharis Alpacas, 105 Waterfall Rd, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Walking with Alpacas
events.venue: Cantharis Alpacas, 105 Waterfall Rd, Paraparaumu
events.description:
Cantharis Alpacas offer guided walks with alpacas in the hills above the Kapiti Coast, conveniently located just 45 kms North of Wellington and just North of the new motorway.
During this unique experience you can learn about these beautiful creatures, and you will have ample time to meet, get close, walk, enjoy a cuddle and hand feed the alpacas.
On the way up and at the top you can also catch the stunning views of the Kapiti Coast, Kapiti Island, the South Island (on clear days) and beyond.
Ensure you have your camera ready to take photos and “selfies” of you and the alpacas.

events.venue: Karahui Wine Bar & Eatery, 1 Memorial Square, Martinborough
events.description:
This event pairs the indulgence of freshly shucked oysters with a rare opportunity to taste boutique wines from the most exciting low-intervention winemakers: Equilibrium, Huntress, and Halite.
Hosted at Karahui Wine Bar & Restaurant the experience features a pop-up oyster bar serving fresh oysters to order, complemented by a rotating pour of wines direct from the winemakers’ cellars—including special releases and limited bottlings.
Guests will meet the makers, sip on unique expressions of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, skin-contact whites and so on and learn how these wines interact with the delicate brine, minerality, and texture of oysters.
Walk-in tasting

events.id: Mana Noctourno-18 Raiha St, Elsdon, Porirua-Facebook
events.name: Mana Noctourno
events.venue: 18 Raiha St, Elsdon, Porirua
events.long_description:
The mana cycle group and the wmtbc are pleased to invite you to the inaugural mana noctourno.
The race is a more social vibe with 3 optional stages that you can race at your leisure, its all about having fun and racing your mates!
The three stages are:
Trail 10/Chimney
Tumeke
Blaster
You can race 1 stage or all the stages as many times as you like, there's no official winner.
MANDATORY EQUIPMENT
You must have two fully charged night lights, one mounted to your handlebars and one mounted to your helmet, each with 1000 Lumens or more and a NZ Safety Standards approved helmet.

RACE TIMETABLE
4:00pm Registration
4:45pm: Mandatory rider briefing
5pm: Race start
9pm: Race finish
Online registration closes Friday 15th August, 9pm. Entries will be limited to 150.
ON-THE-DAY PRICES
There may be limited on the day entries. Registering online is highly recommended to speed things up on the day and save on registration. Entry prices on the day will be $40 (members) and $60 (non-members).
TRAVELLING TO THE NOCTOURNO
The event village will be located at the grassy park at Camp Elsdon/Raiha St carpark.
REFUNDS AND CANCELLATION
In the event that you are no longer able to attend (and notify us by the Friday prior to the event) or the event is canceled due to bad weather or unforeseen circumstances – we are unable to provide refunds, so instead we will credit your WMTBC account. You can use the credit to pay for future events, WMTBC membership or as a donation to Wellington trails.
EVENT TERMS AND CONDITIONS
NOTE: If you are under 18 years of age, you need your parent or guardian to sign/agree on your behalf.
I agree to wear a NZ Safety Standards approved helmet for the duration of any runs down the tracks.
I accept the risks inherent in mountain biking and will not hold the event organisers or landowner liable for any damages.
I am personally responsible for ensuring my bike is securely on the shuttle transport (if part of this event) and will not hold the Wellington Mountain Bike Club Inc liable to any damage.
If you need to stop on a trail, pull to the side and ensure both you and your bike are well off the trail.
You may injure yourself or come across an injured rider, if it is serious, someone should remain stationary with the injured rider and then the next rider must notify a marshal as soon as possible.
I agree to abide by all rules set out by the Wellington Mountain bike Club Inc.
I agree to a fee of $100 in the event that the race timing token allocated to me is not returned to WMTBC at the end of the event.
All entrants must have two night lights, one helmet mounted and one handlebar mounted, each with a minimum of 1000 Lumens.

events.id: Mulled Wine Concert - ERNA FERRYwith the Rodger FOX Jazz Ensemble-62 Bell St, Featherston 5710, Wellington Region-Facebook
events.name: Mulled Wine Concert - ERNA FERRYwith the Rodger FOX Jazz Ensemble
events.venue: 62 Bell St, Featherston 5710, Wellington Region
events.long_description:
REMEMBERING A JAZZ GREAT
ERNA FERRY AND RODGER FOX JAZZ ENSEMBLE TO PLAY THE WAIRARAPA
Jazzy grooves with Horns; Erna Ferry, partner of the late Rodger Fox and long-time
singer with his band describes the show she will be presenting for Mulled Wine Concerts in
Featherston at 4:00 PM on Saturday 16 August 2025.
Rodger was a great jazzman and teacher and put together jazz groups of all sizes, ranging from his famed Big Band to
smaller combos more suited to more intimate venues.
He has left us, but the jazz he championed so well remains. The musicians who were associated with him still want to
play and I still want to sing. Together with the principal musicians from Rodger line-up, she will cover an eclectic range of songs from The Beatles to Beyond for Wairarapa audiences at the Featherston event.
Mary Gow, the organiser of the concert reminds us that Rodger Fox and his ensemble played several times in Anzac Hall and he loved the informality and passion for jazz he found in the area.
We were so happy to learn that this group will carry on the good work she notes. It won't be a sad occasion at all, but a happy celebration of the good-time music and fun he enjoyed
The Mulled Wine Concerts organisation has been presenting musical events for sixteen years, ranging from full-on classical events - piano recitals, string quartets and soloists - through Celtic folk music and ukeleles, and also jazz and band music. Over the years Gow's focus on quality has cemented her series of concerts into must-see happenings and whatever the genre of music is presented, they usually attract a good audience.
The popularity of jazz makes it certain that the 16 August concert will be well attended!
===ENDS===
Mulled Wine Concerts presents Erna Ferry and the Rodger Fox Jazz Ensemble
at the ANZAC Hall, Bell Street, Featherston
Saturday 16 August at 4:00 PM
Tickets $25 (Student under 16, $10). Online Sales: marygow@gmail.com
Ticket outlets: Dickensian Bookshop, Featherston; iSite Martinborough and Masterton; Mrs
Blackwells Village Bookshop, 93 Main Street, Greytown.
Info: www.mulledwineconcerts.com

Featherston at 4:00 PM on Saturday 16 August 2025. "Rodger was a great jazzman and
teacher and put together jazz groups of all sizes, ranging from his famed Big Band to
smaller combos more suited to more intimate venues. He has left us, but the jazz he
championed so well remains. The musicians who were associated with him still want to
play and I still want to sing". Together with the principal musicians from Rodger's line-up,
she will cover an eclectic range of songs from "The Beatles to Beyond" for Wairarapa
audiences at the Featherston event.
Mary Gow, the organiser of the concert reminds us that Rodger Fox and his ensemble
played several times in Anzac Hall and he loved the informality and passion for jazz he
found in the area. "We were so happy to learn that this group will carry on the good work"
she notes. "It won't be a sad occasion at all, but a happy celebration of the good-time
music and fun he enjoyed".
The Mulled WIne Concerts organisation has been presenting musical events for sixteen
years, ranging from full-on classical events - piano recitals, string quartets and soloists -
through Celtic folk music and ukeleles, and also jazz and band music. Over the years
Gow's focus on quality has cemented her series of concerts into must-see happenings and
whatever the genre of music is presented, they usually attract a good audience. The
popularity of jazz makes it certain that the 16 August concert will be well attended!
===ENDS===

at the ANZAC Hall, Bell Street, Featherston

events.venue: Tonic Bistro, 8 Kitchener Street, Martinborough
events.description:
Michael, owner and bartender at Tonic, loves two things in equal measure (pun intended) – cocktails and history.
He’ll offer up some of each in this class.
Shaken or stirred?
Olive or with a twist?
He’ll get back to the roots of some of our favourite drinks and help you make three of your own.

events.id: Movie Night - Gone in 60 Seconds (1974)-1 Fairway Drive, Lower Hutt-Facebook
events.name: Movie Night - Gone in 60 Seconds (1974)
events.venue: 1 Fairway Drive, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Can a group of car thieves steal 50 cars in a matter of days? Come to Our movie night to find out.
This film is known for featuring a 40-minute car chase scene, the longest in film history, during which a total of 93 cars were destroyed!
Sounds fun!
We’ll be gathering at 5pm at GNS Science in Avalon, Lower Hutt. (They have a movie theatre)
Aiming to start the movie around 5.30pm.
Afterwards some of us are going to go somewhere nearby to eat food, all are welcome.

events.id: Advanced Workshop with Ryan and Hannah-13 Dufferin St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Advanced Workshop with Ryan and Hannah
events.venue: 13 Dufferin St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Parameters, precision, and exploration.
Let’s take a look at how we can bring some control into our play by honouring some key principles and boundaries while we do it!
---
IMPORTANT: These workshops are designed to challenge and grow our most experienced dancers, and so we are restricting the main rotation to those who have recently competed at a Level 3 and Level 4 dancers.
If you are comfortable in Int+ and would like to experience these workshops but do not qualify for Level 3 or 4, you are welcome to bring your own partner and not rotate. However we ask that you refrain from asking questions, or save them until after class.
---
Just Workshop: $25
Workshop + Party: $35
Party after the workshop from 7:30pm til late!
https://www.facebook.com/share/1Ghcht9KJy/

events.id: Evening with Contemporanea - Pop Up Shop-Left Bank 1, 108 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Evening with Contemporanea - Pop Up Shop
events.venue: Left Bank 1, 108 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
𝗘𝘃𝗲𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗲𝗮 – 𝗣𝗼𝗽-𝗨𝗽 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗽

𝗦𝗼𝘂𝗹𝗳𝘂𝗹 𝗷𝗲𝘄𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗿𝘆 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗳𝗲𝗲𝗹, 𝘁𝗿𝘆 𝗼𝗻, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵.
Join me for a special evening surrounded by beauty, intention, and presence —𝗮 𝗿𝗮𝗿𝗲, 𝗼𝗻𝗲-𝗼𝗳𝗳 𝗼𝗽𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝘆 to experience Contemporanea in person.
I'll be bringing a curated selection of handcrafted jewellery by female artists from around the world. These are pieces made with care, rich with meaning, designed to be worn, felt, and truly connected with.
Contemporanea celebrates connection, belonging, and self-expression through one-of-a-kind, ethically made jewellery. Each piece honours both the artist who created it and the person it finds its way to.
The event will be held at the beautiful 𝗪𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴𝘁𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗽𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗰𝗮𝗿𝘆—a true oasis in the heart of Cuba Street. A place of calm within the busy city, it’s the perfect setting to slow down, explore, and find a piece that speaks to you.
𝗦𝗮𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗱𝗮𝘆 𝟭𝟲 𝗔𝘂𝗴𝘂𝘀𝘁
5:30–7:30 pm
The Wellington Apothecary, Cuba St, Te Whanganui-a-Tara
𝗥𝗦𝗩𝗣 𝘃𝗶𝗮 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗸.
I’d love to see you there.

events.id: Kapiti Irish Society Winter Dinner-Marine Parade, Paraparaumu Beach-Facebook
events.name: Kapiti Irish Society Winter Dinner
events.venue: Marine Parade, Paraparaumu Beach
events.long_description:
Kapiti Irish Society Winter Dinner.

Come join us for a cozy evening at the Kapiti Boating Club for our annual Winter Dinner! Indulge in traditional Irish cuisine, enjoy live music, and mingle with fellow Irish enthusiasts. This event is a great opportunity to celebrate the season and connect with the local Irish community. Don't miss out on this chance to experience a taste of Ireland right here in Kapiti!

Doors open at 5.30pm
Dinner at 6.30pm
Live Music at 7pm

Irish buffet
Braised beef brisket with jus’
Irish whiskey Glazed champagne ham with mustard condiments
Traditional Irish colcannon ( creamy potato mash with kale)
And more....

Irish Music
We will be joined on the night by a fantastic young Irish musician Dónal Gunning who performs beautiful Irish folk songs.

events.id: Pour & Explore - Sip & Sauna at Colombo-Colombo Martinborough, 107 Todds Road, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Pour & Explore - Sip & Sauna at Colombo
events.venue: Colombo Martinborough, 107 Todds Road, Martinborough
events.description:
Take the edge off winter with a unique evening of warmth and indulgence at Colombo Martinborough, in collaboration with The Sauna Project Wairarapa.
Join us for a relaxing escape under the stars.
Your ticket includes a 30-minute express sauna session with an optional cold plunge to revitalise, followed by a delicious takeaway pizza and a mug of mulled wine to enjoy while you wait.
The finer details: Please arrive 10 minutes before your sauna booking to allow time to get ready to sauna and choose your pizza.
If you require a gluten-free base, please email bookings@colombo.co.nz at least 24 hours before your booking to pre-order your base.

Entry: $15.00 waged, $10.00 unwaged $5.00 children $30.00 family (CASH ONLY)
Please bring something to share for supper around 9:15. Tea and coffee are provided.
About Contra: Contra Dance is for all ages. It's called and danced in long opposite lines. You swap partners progressively and dance with everyone in the opposite line. Footwork is easy and at a walking pace. No special dance ability required. You meet everyone and it’s massive fun!!
The Band:
Jonathan Berkahn – accordian, piano
Emily Griffiths – fiddle, banjo
Monika Wells - accordian
Lydia Warren – recorder, whistle
Bernard Wells – keyboard, flute, fiddle
Mark Howell – hammered dulcimer and mandolin
Remember!
Please come only if you're feeling well.
Bring family, friends, tell people it’s on.
Like Contra Dance Wellington on Facebook to stay in the loop about upcoming dances.
See you on the dance floor!

events.id: Hihi & The Stitchbirds EP Release, with special guests the Bidibids-167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Hihi & The Stitchbirds EP Release, with special guests the Bidibids
events.venue: 167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come celebrate Hihi & The Stitchbirds' first EP - On a Good Day - an exploration of love, and loss, and the pieces in between.
7:00pm - Doors
7:30pm - The Bidibids
8:30pm - Hihi & The Stitchbirds
After a whirlwind 18 months as a five-piece folk band, Hihi & The Stitchbirds are delighted to release their debut EP with five original songs that will make you feel soothed and seen. Written by band members Tess Luff, Elena Saunders and Ellie Stewart, this group of talented musicians invite you into contemplative corners of their brains with a set of gentle and jovial numbers that will entertain and delight.
They will be joined on stage by their friends the Bidibids.
About Hihi & The Stitchbirds:
Hihi & The Stitchbirds are an exciting five-piece musical experiment, based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Pairing rich vocal harmonies with vibrant original music inspired by the folk and Americana playbooks, this band brings something for everyone.
Hihi & The Stitchbirds are:
Elena Saunders - vocals and vibes
Chris Goldsbury - guitar, clarinet and vocals
Tess Luff - guitar, banjo uke and vocals
Matt Hutton - bass uke and vocals
Ellie Stewart - fiddle and vocals
About the Bidibids:
With lush harmonies, intricate arrangements, and beguiling melodies, the Bidibids explore what it means to play folk music in New Zealand. The Bidibids are Sarah August on banjo and guitar, Simon Carryer on cello-banjo, and Brendan Schenk on mandolin and guitar. The trio came together at the 2020 Wellington Folk Festival, where they were each supposed to be playing in different groups. Since then, the Wellington-based band have become regulars at some of the region’s best venues for folk music, including the Mussel Inn, Moon, and the Wellington Bluegrass Society.
Driven by Sarah’s honest, intimate songwriting and Brendan’s blazing musicianship, the Bidibids balance soulful ballads that will tug your heart-strings with upbeat numbers which will get your toes tapping. Influenced by American bluegrass and folk bands like Watchhouse and Nickel Creek, they’re also inspired by local acts like the Eastern and Marlon Williams who are forging an authentic New Zealand folk tradition. You can listen to the Bidibids' debut EP here:

events.id: Sue Dyson - Welcome To Our Lounge-Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sue Dyson - Welcome To Our Lounge
events.venue: Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
Welcome To Our Lounge Tour - Featuring songs from Linda Ronstadt & Carole King Gate opens 6.30pm Music Starts 7pm Saturday 16 August 2025 Sue Dyson, a gifted vocalist known for her warm and captivating stage presence, backed by talented pianist Mitch Dean to offer an extraordinary musical experience that celebrates the enduring legacies of Linda Ronstadt and Carole King.
Set in Hilltop's laid-back intimate atmosphere, their performances promise an engaging experience where the audience will tap their feet to the classics that have defined generations.
Additionally, Sue has lent her voice as a backup vocalist at the prestigious New Zealand Music Awards and has enjoyed significant success with her original country music in Australia.
Notably, he played keys and guitar in the acclaimed Wellington Fleetwood Mac Experience, contributing to their successful tour.
Mitch’s deep understanding of music, combined with his skillful instrumentation, enriches the duo's sound and enhances the overall performance.

events.id: Misty Frequency-211 Left Bank, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Misty Frequency
events.venue: 211 Left Bank, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To close An Ethics of Witnessing, join artist Misty Frequency for a one-night-only performance offering a vision of Takatāpui futurism and collective dreaming.
7:30pm, Saturday 16 August
Free event — all welcome
Registration encouraged but not essential.
Mauri ora!

Misty Frequency (ia/they/them) [Ngāti Kahungunu, Ngāti Tūwharetoa, Ngā Rauru, Kai Tahu, Scotland] is a Takatāpui multidisciplinary artist who merges traditional and contemporary mahi toi to serve as a form of Takatāpui futurism, a koha for their community.
In their own practice and as member of the Takatāpui arts collective Utu Ā Matimati, Misty is drawn to the ideas of inclusion, advocacy and celebration of other Takatāpui; Misty paints an etherial scene of safety within their work.
www.instagram.com/misty_frequency_
www.instagram.com/utu_a_matimati

events.long_description:
Sam Manzanza is a leading African NZ-based performance artist. He has performed his infectious Afrobeat to audiences all over the globe for the past 25 years as an entertainer. A versatile instrumentalist and composer of songs in French, Lingala, and English, his fast-paced blend of Afrobeat, Afropop, and Afrorock is taken from tribal beats to make you feel magic and positive vibes. It is an experience not to be missed.
As Sam says, "You will find yourself dancing nonstop and not needing to go to the gym the next day. Satisfaction is guaranteed on Saturday 16th August 2025 at Raumati Social Club at 7.30 PM. Sam Manzanza will be performing with his 4 piece band to make you boogie

events.id: Orangefarm and Warm Regards-Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Orangefarm and Warm Regards
events.venue: Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington
events.description:
Orangefarm and Warm Regards Live at Vogelmorn Upstairs.
Warm Regards is a band that epitomizes style, comfort, economy, and power — a sleek sedan equally at home on the racetrack or with the family bundled safely in the back.
Blending indie rock, pop, folk, and jazz-country flair, their infectious sound and high-energy performances have earned them a dedicated local following.
With frontman Tom Watson (Cassette, Terror of the Deep, HLAH) leading the charge, Warm Regards deliver introspective lyrics, tight grooves, and lush harmonies that promise an unforgettable live experience.
Orangefarm brings a distinct mix of shimmering guitars, melodic hooks, and lyrical wit that’s become their signature sound.

events.id: For the Love of the Land-Conscious Valley Farm, 84 Takarau Gorge Road-WOAP
events.name: For the Love of the Land
events.venue: Conscious Valley Farm, 84 Takarau Gorge Road
events.long_description:
Escape the hustle and bustle of the city and immerse yourself in the tranquility of the Ohariu Valley for a one-of-a-kind, farm-to-table experience. Jano Bistro, Conscious Valley Farm, and Strait Speared are teaming up to offer an afternoon of hyper-local indulgence, featuring a thoughtfully curated three-course lunch with drinks pairing (non-alcoholic available), set against the stunning backdrop of the valley’s rolling hills.

The day begins with a tour of the Conscious Valley Barn, where Hamish, the passionate owner behind Conscious Valley Farm, will guide you through the sheep shearing process, offering insight into his sustainable farming practices. Afterward, head to the picturesque Ohariu Farm venue for a welcome glass of bubbly, followed by a delectable three-course menu that celebrates the land’s bounty. With snacks to start, sourdough bread, macarons, and expertly paired wines or non-alcoholic beverages, the menu highlights locally raised lamb and spear-caught butterfish sourced from the nearby coast.

Throughout the meal, you’ll learn about the inspiration behind the dishes, with chefs explaining how the surrounding flora and fauna shape their culinary creations. Cole and Tom, the dynamic duo behind Strait Speared, will also share their secrets on catching the finest butterfish, while you enjoy your starter. The afternoon promises an unforgettable experience, combining great food, breathtaking scenery, and rich stories from the land and its people.

events.id: Painting with Sugar-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place-WOAP
events.name: Painting with Sugar
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place
events.long_description:
Step into a creative collaboration that blends culinary and visual artistry. Over three hours, you’ll experience the intersection of art and food as you draw, paint, and indulge in hand-crafted pastries nestled amongst other still-life objects.

Set within the historic halls of Inverlochy Art School, this event brings together Sugar Flour’s Maxine Schecter and Inverlochy’s skilled tutors for a guided artistic journey. Maxine is a French trained pastry chef who has worked in restaurants and patisseries in Wellington (Logan Brown), Paris (Gâteaux Thoumieux), London (The Fat Duck and Sketch) and is the author of Patisserie Made Simple: The Art of Petits Gateau.

The artistry of Maxine's pastries, set within two intricately composed still life installations, will serve as both inspiration and delight, featuring four hand-crafted pastries paired with refined tea and non-alcoholic bubbles.

As you work under the guidance of Inverlochy’s expert tutors, you’ll explore traditional and contemporary drawing and painting techniques, all inspired by the textures, colours, and forms of food. This event bridges two creative disciplines - some confections are designed to reflect the artists’ works, while others become the starting point for your own artistic exploration.

Designed to welcome artists of all skill levels, this session provides all the materials you need, so you can focus on your creativity. Whether you’re a seasoned painter or someone curious about trying your hand at still-life art, you’ll find a supportive environment that encourages experimentation and expression.

Beyond the canvas, you’ll gain a deeper appreciation for the artistry behind Sugar Flour’s confections. Each pastry tells a story, celebrating the collaboration between Inverlochy’s artistic heritage and Sugar Flour’s culinary expertise.

Don’t miss this rare opportunity to engage all your senses in a setting that merges Wellington’s vibrant art and food cultures. Whether you’re here to create, indulge, or simply try something new, this event promises an unforgettable experience.

events.id: Pesce alla Ebraica-Ombra, 199 Cuba St-WOAP
events.name: Pesce alla Ebraica
events.venue: Ombra, 199 Cuba St
events.long_description:
Ombra welcomes beloved former-Wellington restaurant Field & Green for this special continuation of their iconic Wellington On a Plate Jewish cuisine series. Join Laura Greenfield and the chefs at Ombra for a special five-course dinner celebrating the diaspora of Jewish cuisine - ‘Pesce alla Ebraica’, a Jewish-Italian fish cuisine. 
In the 16th century, Jewish immigrants from the Iberian and Levant regions came to the coastal trading cities of Livorno, Venice and Rome, bringing their Sephardic traditions and produce, including the humble tomato. Fish has always been a primary ingredient in Jewish cooking and is considered pareve (neutral in the observance of dietary laws) and so for new immigrants, fish could be bought from a non-kosher market. Because fish was plentiful, it symbolised prosperity and led to some fascinating culinary creations that have made a long-lasting impact on Italian cuisine.

events.id: Stretch & Slurp-Lola Rouge Restaurant & Bar, 213-223 Cuba Street-WOAP
events.name: Stretch & Slurp
events.venue: Lola Rouge Restaurant & Bar, 213-223 Cuba Street
events.long_description:
Celebrate old friends and new flavours as Lola Rouge and Taste of Home unite to celebrate the art of hand-pulled noodles and innovative Asian fusion cuisine. This unique collaboration brings together longtime friends and culinary innovators, whose journey began in the warmth of shared kitchens. Lola Rouge Executive Chef Jason Ng and Taste of Home Chef Tina Hu worked together years ago. Now they find themselves managing and owning restaurants within 100m of each other and were inspired to work together again to create dishes from their childhood and meals they love.
Prepare for a bold and flavourful four-course journey through Asia that celebrates taste, tradition, and technique. The curated menu promises to pack a punch, blending the best of both restaurants with a mix of reimagined classics and soulful, homely flavours, and finishing with a shared dessert tasting platter. From start to finish, Stretch & Slurp promises a feast that is bold, comforting, and best enjoyed in the company of great friends and loved ones!

events.id: Kapiti Coast Tasting Safari-Hey Coastie, 42 Tutere Street-WOAP
events.name: Kapiti Coast Tasting Safari
events.venue: Hey Coastie, 42 Tutere Street
events.long_description:
Escape the city for an afternoon safari that will have you tasting some of the finest flavours the Kāpiti Coast has to offer. Jump on the bus with your friends and get playful with the local makers to share and sample some of the region’s best artisan food and drinks with a chance to chat to the people bringing them to life.
Your food adventure will see you visiting four local hot spots including: The Waterfront, Salty’s Diner, Passo Italian and finishing at Hey Coastie. 
Each safari stop will give you the chance to taste and explore a delicious canapé and a cocktail (non-alcoholic alternatives available) showcasing Kāpiti’s unique foodie offering. You'll also get a goody bag to take home.
The Safari Bus led by your trusted tour guide will depart and drop off at The Arborist Rooftop Bar and Eatery, 166 Willis Street at 1pm sharp. Alternatively, you could join the Safari group from The Waterfront, Raumati at 2pm and be returned to Paraparaumu Train station before the bus heads back into Wellington.

events.id: Maille Sunday Kai-Cuba Street Tavern, 172 Cuba Street-WOAP
events.name: Maille Sunday Kai
events.venue: Cuba Street Tavern, 172 Cuba Street
events.long_description:
Escape the winter chill and head along to Cuba St Tavern for some Sunday Kai with Maille Mustard, running every Sunday of August. Each week features a different delectable roast, served with either a Maille Dijon Bloody Mary or warming mulled wine, and finished with a house-made dessert. Sunday has never tasted so good! Bookings available from 1pm.

$50 for 2 courses
$65 for 2 courses inc a Maille Bloody Mary or House made Mulled wine

Menu
Every Maille Sunday Kai event will offer a vegetarian option of eggplant parmigiana with buffalo mozzarella, Maille Dijon mustard, tomato ragù, garlic potato and broccolini.

3 August
Free-range roast porchetta served with garlic potato, creamed spinach, broccolini, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and apple sauce.
Dessert: Sticky toffee pudding with custard.

10 August
Roast duck breast served with duck fat roast potatoes, Chinese broccoli, mushrooms, Yorkshire pudding, and Maille Dijon mustard and onion cream.
Dessert: Dark chocolate torte with orange mascarpone.

17 August
Conscious Valley roast lamb shoulder with garlic roast potatoes, honey-glazed carrots, minted peas, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and mint sauce.
Dessert: Bread and butter pudding with ginger gelato and crème anglaise.

24 August
Half a roast chicken with duck fat roast potatoes, garlic green beans, cavolo nero, Yorkshire pudding, chicken schmaltz and Maille mustard gravy.
Dessert: Steamed honey pudding with custard and honey gelato.

31 August
First Light roast sirloin served with honey-glazed carrots, duck fat roast potatoes, cabbage and bacon, Yorkshire pudding, horseradish, Maille Dijon mustard and jus.
Dessert: Chocolate fondant with vanilla bean gelato.

events.id: Due Isole-Cicio Cacio Osteria, 167 Riddiford St-WOAP
events.name: Due Isole
events.venue: Cicio Cacio Osteria, 167 Riddiford St
events.long_description:
Join Chef Giulio Ricatti for an extraordinary evening celebrating the bond between two islands — Sardinia and New Zealand. Through a carefully curated nine-course dinner, this event offers a personal and heartfelt exploration of identity, place, and the connection between land and sea.

Raised in Sardinia and now at home in New Zealand, Chef Ricatti shares his story through a menu that bridges the wild, untouched landscapes of both countries. Each course is crafted exclusively with New Zealand ingredients, reflecting the rich bounty of our land and sea, yet inspired by the timeless traditions and bold flavours of Sardinian cuisine.

Accompanying the meal is an expertly selected pairing of wines from Sardinia and New Zealand, highlighting the unique characteristics of each region while celebrating their shared essence. The thoughtful combination of food and drink creates a dialogue between the two islands, offering diners a chance to taste the harmony of contrasts.

More than just a meal, this is an evening of storytelling. Chef Ricatti invites you to journey with him as he reflects on the places that have shaped his life and the meaning of finding a home across oceans. His philosophy of embracing the present moment is woven into every dish, making this event a sensory and emotional experience.

Whether you’re a lover of fine dining, an admirer of Sardinian culture, or simply curious about the connections between food and identity, this dinner promises a night of discovery. Step into the heart of two islands and savour their soul in one unforgettable evening.

Join Chef Giulio Ricatti for an extraordinary evening celebrating the bond between two islands — Sardinia and New Zealand.
Through a carefully curated nine-course dinner, this event offers a personal and heartfelt exploration of identity, place, and the connection between land and sea.
Raised in Sardinia and now at home in New Zealand, Chef Ricatti shares his story through a menu that bridges the wild, untouched landscapes of both countries.
Each course is crafted exclusively with New Zealand ingredients, reflecting the rich bounty of our land and sea, yet inspired by the timeless traditions and bold flavours of Sardinian cuisine.
Accompanying the meal is an expertly selected pairing of wines from Sardinia and New Zealand, highlighting the unique characteristics of each region while celebrating their shared essence.

events.name: WHAC Presents: Honest 10 - 17 August 2025
events.venue: 64 Freyberg St, Lyall Bay, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us at 8:30am on Sunday 17 August for the next edition of the Honest 10 taking in Wellington's beautiful waterfront. The Honest 10 is the perfect chance to test your 5km or 10km fitness and maybe have a go at walking or running PB.
EVERYONE IS WELCOME NO MATTER WHAT YOUR LEVEL OF FITNESS. The is an optional 8:15am early start for those who think they might need more time (eg over 70 mins for 10k)
Organised by WHAC, the Honest 10 provides a fast, fun and friendly environment. The race course has been officially measured and there will be pacers running 40min, 45min, 50min, 55min and 60min to help you run your best.
Cost: Just $10 for 10km, $5 for 5km!!
How to enter:
1. Pre-register by email (recommended) BEFORE 5PM on Saturday 16 Aug (see instructions below) Payment methods for pre-registrations include online bank transfer (an email with your reference will be sent back to you) or pay cash on the day.
2. Sign up on the day from 8am (cash only).
Photos are free of charge and posted online (on the WHAC website) alongside results after the race. https://whac.org.nz/wp/honest-10/
Where: At the Whale's Tail next to Freyberg Pool, Oriental Bay
When: Registration from 8am. Race starts at 8:30am Sunday morning. Let us know when you register, if you request an early 8.15am start, eg if you are walking the 10km or are likely to run slower than 70mins.
***Pre-registration details***
Email the following details to honest10@whac.org.nz BEFORE 5pm Saturday 16 Aug
You will receive a confirmation email back with your race number. If you select 'N' for prepaid, just bring cash to the race with you. If you select 'Y' for prepaid, pay via WHAC's bank account details below.
- Name
- Age
- 5km or 10km
- M, F or D (unfortunately we are currently unable to give age-calculated results for the gender-diverse (D) category, as our source currently only provides age-calculated result data for M and F)
- Phone number
- Prepay Y or N
BANK ACCOUNT DETAILS If you select "Y" for Prepay when you register via email, transfer your $10 entry fee (or $5 for 5k) to
Account Name: Wellington Harrier Athletic Club
Account Number: 12-3493-0058553-00
using "H10 [your race number]" as your reference. Eg "H10 #23"
Looking forward to seeing you on Sunday 17 August

events.id: Life Drawing @ Wellington Naturist Club-20 Molloys Road, Upper Hutt-Facebook
events.name: Life Drawing @ Wellington Naturist Club
events.venue: 20 Molloys Road, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Life drawing with a difference - it's Life Drawing @ Wellington Naturist Club. The next one is on Sunday 17th Aug 2025.
We have the sessions monthly. If the weather is not suitable for outdoor life drawing then we'll be inside, nice and warm.
The fee for life drawing is the normal Day Visit Fee of $20, for non-members. (The life drawing is otherwise free for Club members and for non-members who are paying for an overnight stay on the Sat or Sun nights.)
Bring some lunch. Morning and afternoon tea are provided. You can bring your own art materials, or you can use some that are provided. Come to either draw or to model or swap between the two. All the models are volunteers, so a nice variety of shapes and sizes all in the one session. Draw if you like. Model if you like.
The session format: beginning the session with 2 minute poses to warm-up, then increasing the pose lengths to something between 10-30 minutes. Each model posing chooses how long their pose(s) will be in that 10-30 minute range.
Some tuition is given to those who would like it. We'll be life drawing from 11am until 3pm, but you’re very welcome to come and go as you please, and to use the club facilities. It's a pretty casual event.
There's full kitchen facilities, BBQ facilities, the new hot tub, spa, sauna, table tennis, golf, eels to feed, bush walks etc. Make a day of it if you like.
If you're coming for the life drawing at the club, then the only time anyone is obliged to wear "club uniform" is if you're modelling for the life drawing, or you’re using the spa/hot tub/sauna/pool. Otherwise just wear - or don't wear - what you like. No need to book either, just come enjoy the day.
Wellington Naturist Club, 20 Molloys Rd, Te Marua, Upper Hutt 5018. Call the club mobile 027 330 6212 when you get to the gate, so you can be buzzed in. Then follow the signs to park and come up to the hall to see where we will be having the session.

events.description:
Fareham Journey is building a sustainable cohousing community in Pae Tū Mōkai, Featherston and they are looking for people who share their kaupapa to create this with us.
The Fareham property has extensive grounds which include a historic homestead, farmland, established organic gardens and an orchard, old school buildings, a swimming pool, and an arts community on site.
We run these free information and tour events on the third Sunday of every month, from noon until 2pm at Fareham, 80 Underhill Road, Pae Tū Mōkai, Featherston.

events.id: First Draft: Forget the Music-12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: First Draft: Forget the Music
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
Two friends wake up in a recording studio with no memory of the night before.
Join us for a rehearsed playreading of this new work by Ethan Rodgers, followed by an audience kōrero with the playwright.
ABOUT FIRST DRAFT
From 15-17 August, The Magnificent Weirdos is teaming up with writers in the early stages of creating new work to present rehearsed readings of these works in progress for the public, followed by audience kōrero with each writer/creator.
All the work is created by writers and devisers with lived experience of disability, neurodivergence, d/Deafness or mental distress.
Each work of approximately 20 minutes will be presented once over the weekend. Each reading will be followed by a 30 minute chat with the writer, facilitated by the director. It's an exciting and creative way to develop new work, both for writers, who receive feedback at an early stage, and for audiences who get to water the seed from which the fruit will eventually grow.
We will also be hosting an industry workshop led by Playmarket, leading a conversation on opportunities, processes and accessibility for new playwrights. Playwrights will need to register for this free workshop which has 20 spaces.
The whole event is NZSL interpreted. Accessible to blind/low vision folks without audio description.
Check out the program for more details of each play, content notes and pre show information here: https://www.magnificentweirdos.com/fd-program

events.name: Capital Blues Concert Series: Wellington Heads
events.venue: 5 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Get ready for swing, soul, and shufflin’ blues. Wellington Heads bring us their signature blend of original tunes, bold horns, and groove-rich rhythms. Their sound is shaped by New Orleans funk, Kansas blue jazz, with more than a dash of Pacific flavour. This six-piece delivers music that moves—from feet to heartstrings.
With over 20 years of playing everywhere from packed pubs to sunny street corners, they’re a capital favourite for a reason.
Cooler than a southerly. Hotter than a hornline.
Neil Worboys (lead vocals, harmonica, guitar), Bill Wood (guitars, vocals), Geoff Keith (bass, vocals), Nic Deighton (drums), Phil Costello (saxophones), and Tom Hulland (trumpet).
$20 or $10 if you’re a blues club member!
