events.id: Capital Blues Presents: Wellington Heads-13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Capital Blues Presents: Wellington Heads
events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Named after the rugged beauty of Wellington’s southern coastline, Wellington Heads bring their signature blend of swing, soul, and rhythm & blues to the Capital Blues Concert Series. With over 20 years of groove under their belts and a sound shaped by Kansas blue jazz, New Orleans funk, and Pacific rhythms, this six-piece is pure leg jiggle magic :)
Cooler than a southerly. Hotter than a horn solo.
Playing predominately original music, Wellington Heads have evolved their own sound through the influences of Kansas style blue jazz, the swinging rhythm n blues of Louis Jordan and Ray Charles, Chicago blues and infused with Pacific/Hawaiian rhythms, New Orleans grooves and Latino feels. They regularly delight audiences at a number of Wellington venues, and are frequently invited to perform outside of Wellington. Over the years they have played Auckland, Tauranga, Manawatu, Nelson and Wellington Jazz and Blues Festivals.
Wellington Heads have recorded six albums, their latest, ‘World Keep On Turning’ was released in December 2023. This album continues their unique sound with a mix of rhythm n’ blues, swing, soul and latino grooves. In combining this with their previous albums, Wellington Heads have built an extensive repertoire of eclectic original songs.  
Neil Worboys – vocals, guitar, harmonica, Bill Wood – guitars, Geoff Keith – bass, Nic Deighton – drums, Phil Costello – saxophone, Andy Weir – trumpet

events.id: FUJIFILM Meet-up | World Photo Day- Queens Wharf Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
events.name: FUJIFILM Meet-up | World Photo Day
events.venue: Queens Wharf Wellington, Wellington Region
events.long_description:
Photography doesn’t start with your settings. It starts with light.Join us for a relaxed photo walk with Fujifilm brand ambassadors Michelle and Hemi Phillips from Patina Photo, open to anyone keen to get more confident with their camera and how they see the world.
We’ll explore the shifting moods of natural light—sunny,cloudy, soft or harsh—and show you how to create images with whatever weather and light we get on the day. No pressure, just a chance to slow down, observe, and practise seeing light in a new way.
Michelle and Hemi have been shooting weddings professionally in Wellington for over 12 years, and are well used to making magic in unpredictable weather. This walk is about working with what’s already around you—light, shadow, movement, mood.
Whether you’re just starting out or looking to reconnect with your creative side, come along for some fresh perspective and a relaxed afternoon with fellow photography lovers.
Bring your own camera (and weather-appropriate layers—we’ll be heading out into the Wellington winter)
All camera brands welcome
events.description:
Photography doesn’t start with your settings.
It starts with light.Join us for a relaxed photo walk with Fujifilm brand ambassadors Michelle and Hemi Phillips from Patina Photo, open to anyone keen to get more confident with their camera and how they see the world.
We’ll explore the shifting moods of natural light—sunny,cloudy, soft or harsh—and show you how to create images with whatever weather and light we get on the day.
No pressure, just a chance to slow down, observe, and practise seeing light in a new way.
Michelle and Hemi have been shooting weddings professionally in Wellington for over 12 years, and are well used to making magic in unpredictable weather.

events.id: Manawa Karioi Working Bees-7 Danube St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Manawa Karioi Working Bees
events.venue: 7 Danube St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Our track maintenance and planting working bees are focussing on plant species diversity rather than large planting quantities. We have ordered 500 special trees from the Berhampore Nursery. We are in this for the long haul and a forest that contains a wide range of plant species will, in turn, attract a wider range of birds, lizards, and invertebrates. A wider range of plant species also allows for the forest to naturally regenerate and helps prevent weed species from establishing.
Tools are provided, bring sturdy shoes and a water bottle, Working bees are held every Sunday in June (except June 1st - Kings Birthday Weekend) and August 2025.
Meeting at the Information Shelter in the Tapu te Ranga Marae car park at the end of Danube Street in Island Bay. Children are welcome with parents or guardians.

events.id: Hataitai community centre Raranga-27 Arcus Way, Hataitai, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Hataitai community centre Raranga
events.venue: 27 Arcus Way, Hataitai, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Hataitai Centre & Community House, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Open session: 1:30pm – 5:00pm (pack down starts at 4:30pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.

We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
• An old towel • Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke • Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools • Some tools are available to borrow • Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required • Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke Koha appreciated, not required If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.

events.name: NZSO Creepy-Crawly Carnival: Saint-Saëns & Roussel
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington
events.description:
Roussel "The Spider’s Feast: Symphonic Fragments" Saint-Saëns "Carnival of the Animals" It’s a bug’s life in Roussel’s "The Spider’s Feast", a suite depicting the insects found in a garden.
This special performance moves from the garden to the Aotearoa New Zealand native bush with Giant Wetas, Huhu Grubs and all the fluttering life found in the forest.
One thing is always clear, the spider is always looking for lunch.
This work is guaranteed to make the kids laugh, smile, and squirm!
We also welcome Oscar-winning songwriter and funny man Bret McKenzie.

events.id: Wellington Film Festival Screening 1: GRACE A Prayer for Peace-10 Kent Ter, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Wellington Film Festival Screening 1: GRACE A Prayer for Peace
events.venue: 10 Kent Ter, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
GRACE A Prayer For Peace asks big, bold questions about art, community, and the human spirit.
A film of beauty and conviction, GRACE — A Prayer for Peace journeys through Aotearoa, Kiribati, and Japan in search of meaning, memory, and peace. Born from dialogue between two great Dames — Gaylene Preston and Robin White — this is a prayer told in images, art, and truth.
Join us for a Q&A afterwards from the Dames themselves: Dame Gaylene Preston and Dame Robin White.

events.id: Author Talk: Author Talk: Jewish, Not Zionist: Marilyn Garson in conversation with Gigi Fenster-57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Author Talk: Author Talk: Jewish, Not Zionist: Marilyn Garson in conversation with Gigi Fenster
events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Marilyn Garson is the author of Still Lives: a Memoir of Gaza and Jewish, Not Zionist. She co-founded Alternative Jewish Voices, Aotearoa and is a steering committee member of Global Jews for Palestine. In this conversation with Gigi Fenster, she will talk about the power of memoir to bring readers into new territory and to involve them in the hard issues of the moment.
Bring the questions you have hesitated to ask.
Gigi Fenster photo credit: Tara Lemana

events.id: First concert with new Music Director-209 The Parade, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: First concert with new Music Director
events.venue: 209 The Parade, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Vocal Blokes have been away from Facebook since our last big concert. Or was it the one before?
A lot has happened and we want to let you know about it.
Our music director of the past 5 - 6 years, Nino Raphael has left us to seek adventure in the UK.
We were sorry to see him go and give a great benefit concert at St Andrews early this year.
We now have a new music director, Paddy Shanahan and he's completed a term and a half with us. Paddy brings a fresh energy to Vocal Blokes. He is building on the great work that Nino has done over the past few years.
We are building up to a concert on Saturday 16 August. More details to be revealed in due course.
Stay connected and be the first to know.
https://events.humanitix.com/vocal-blokes-back-on-track

events.id: Ghost Trio (piano trio)-St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Ghost Trio (piano trio)
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
Monique Lapins (violin), Ken Ichinose (cello) and Gabriela Glapska (piano).
The programme is titled “Between Tides” based upon the concept of a journey through time and cultural landscapes, showcasing the evolution of chamber music from the late 18th century (Beethoven) to the 20th century (Shostakovich), and finally to the contemporary era (Takemitsu, Downie).
There is a world premiere of a work by New Zealand’s own Glen Downie, written especially for the Ghost Trio.
Ludwig van Beethoven, Piano Trio in D major Op 70 No.
2 in E minor Op 67

events.id: Art/Craft Workshop for Children (5-13yrs)-Moera Community House, 107 Randwick Crescent, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Art/Craft Workshop for Children (5-13yrs)
events.venue: Moera Community House, 107 Randwick Crescent, Lower Hutt
events.description:
Our art class is designed to help children unleash their creative potential by providing expert guidance, ample space, and a wide range of art materials and tools.
By encouraging children to explore their imaginations and express themselves in great detail, we inspire them to develop a deeper understanding and appreciation of the world around them.
Through hands-on activities using paints, clay, foam, coloured paper, cardboard, brushes, scissors, and more, children gain the ability not only to appreciate the beauty in life but also to create their own stunning works of art.
Join us to nurture your child's creative talents and inspire their artistic journey!
Time: 3:15 - 4:15 pm, Sundays Location: Moera Community House, Lower Hutt.

events.id: It's in the Ballot - PNCC – Te Pūao Māori ward -In-studio- The Square Palmerston North, Manawatu-Wanganui-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - PNCC – Te Pūao Māori ward -In-studio
events.venue: The Square Palmerston North, Manawatu-Wanganui
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Songwriter Showcase #105-Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Songwriter Showcase #105
events.venue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Songwriter Showcase presents showcase #105, Sun August 17 at Moon bar in Newtown.

Every 3rd Sunday of the month we showcase four local songwriters and celebrate the rich culture and depth of talent we have here in Aotearoa.

This month we present.. The Faustians, Martin Andrews, Beans Wright, and Billy Lyrical.

With the banjo, fiddle, guitar and bass, and the wailing vocals of their Oldtime Appalachian roots, The Faustians have veered off course into a strange world of lost souls, bleak plains and cries for help from the dystopian dreamscapes of Helena’s original songwriting.

Martin Andrews is a singer/songwriter from Pōneke, Aotearoa. He writes blues and country based songs of humanity, mixing story telling with lived experience. For this show he will be playing songs from his upcoming fourth album “Hands” and will be joined by long time friend and collaborator, Scott Pilgrim.

Beans is a recent fixture in the Pōneke folk scene, importing a wild array of original songs and generally embodying the classic singer songwriter formula – introvert plus guitar. They gained international acclaim in 2021 as a finalist in the Liverpool International Song Contest, and have since performed at small venues and festivals across Australia and Aotearoa. They are also one third of folk trio 'Don & the Divorcees', but are known for solo shows which are rich with humour, honesty and interesting word choices. Expect to feel things.

Billy Lyrical has been writing, singing, busking, mixing, composing and performing for over 40 years. Like a mix of Tom Waits, Tom Lehrer and Woody Guthrie, he's written hundreds of songs and played thousands of gigs. He's not on Facebook, Instagram, Tiktok, Twitter, Linkedin, Spotify, Tumblr, Tindr, Grindr, Onlyfans or Pornhub. He's alive and kicking, living in the moment, rocking in the pocket, riffing this condition. We're now entering an Extinction Event, Please extinguish your cigarettes.

events.id: Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour (Wellington)-Old St Paul's Cathedral, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour (Wellington)
events.venue: Old St Paul's Cathedral, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by Strung Out Touring
Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour
After opening for Kasey Chambers around Australia, award-winning songwriter Jenny Mitchell returns home for a national tour celebrating her acclaimed album Forest House.
An Aotearoa Music Award Winner and 2 x Australian Golden Guitar nominee, Jenny is a gifted storyteller from the deep south of New Zealand. Now based in Melbourne, the AU Review describes Jenny’s music as a “sublime slice of folk” and her new highly anticipated album, Forest House, is capturing fans across the motu and the globe.
“Forest House - 10/10,” Newstalk ZB
"Every so often, an artist emerges who has everything it takes to reach the pinnacle of country music success. Jenny Mitchell is a star.” Country Music Capital News
Jenny is thrilled to welcome very special guest Katie Thompson to The Forest House Tour. Hailing from New Zealand’s West Coast, Katie is a captivating alt-country artist known for her soul-stirring storytelling and rich, emotive voice. A 2024 finalist for Best Country Song, Katie has shared stages with legends like Sir Elton John and Don McLean, leaving lasting impressions with her raw honesty and polished edge.
WELLINGTON
Old St Paul's
Sunday 18 August
Doors open at 7pm
Support from Katie Thompson
NZ TOUR DETAILS
SAT 17 AUGUST - Errick's Venue, Dunedin
SUN 18 AUGUST - Old St Paul's, Wellington
THURS 21 AUGUST - The Piano, Christchurch
FRI 22 AUGUST - The Tuning Fork, Auckland
For more information please visit www.jennymitchell.co.nz.
ABOUT JENNY MITCHELL
NZ Best Country Artist Winner and 2 x Golden Guitar nominee, Jenny Mitchell, is a storyteller from the deep south of New Zealand with impactful songs full of grace and grit. Her last album ‘Tug of War’ included the pivotal release of the 2022 APRA NZ Best Country Song ‘Trouble Finds a Girl’ and was described by Rolling Stone as an album, “worthy of every award it will inevitably collect.”
No stranger to the road, Jenny was recently awarded a scholarship to perform at Nashville’s iconic AmericanaFest and has toured Australia and New Zealand extensively over the last decade - supporting artists including Fanny Lumsden (AU), Tami Neilson (NZ) and Nadia Reid (NZ) along the way. Her most recent touring project, The Bush & the Birds Tour, travelled throughout NZ in support of conservation organisation; Forest & Bird. An ode to her late Grandfather’s love of the land, the tour generated over $2000 in donations for Forest & Bird.
Jenny grew up in a home and family of music and often tours with her sisters, The Mitchell Twins, and country music loving Dad, Ron Mitchell. After growing up with a musical diet of The Chicks, Hank Williams and Dolly Parton, Jenny penned her first songs at the age of 11 after a trip to Ireland where she connected with her Irish heritage and explored the immigration story of her Irish born Grandparents. A few years down the track, Jenny performed original work on the TV show New Zealand's Got Talent, was placed 3rd and went onto crowdfund and release her first album at the age of 15. In 2017, she was crowned the overall winner of the NZ Gold Guitar Awards which kickstarted the professional chapter of her career, leading to her Aotearoa Music Award Winning album 'Wildfires’ produced by Tasmania’s Matt Fell.
With a sound that No Depression describes as, “poetry that dominates a beautiful melody,” Jenny Mitchell is comfortable with a country twang or softly spoken ballad and is rapidly capturing fans across the globe.

events.description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.

events.id: Next Gen Cook Off-LTD., Level 1, 60 Dixon St-WOAP
events.name: Next Gen Cook Off
events.venue: LTD., Level 1, 60 Dixon St
events.long_description:
The Next Gen Cook Off returns for its fifth year, and things are heating up at Everybody Eats.
Every Monday in August, four of Wellington’s freshest young chefs will go head-to-head in a high-energy kitchen takeover, serving up epic three-course dinners using rescued food.

Each chef will be given the same protein, generously provided by Meat Direct, but everything else is a surprise—ingredients are revealed that morning, based on what’s come in. Menus are created on the spot, and dishes are served to a buzzing, hungry crowd. It’s fast-paced, creative chaos with serious culinary skills on display. Guests get a front-row seat to the action, while supporting a truly game-changing enterprise.

4 August — Jessie Gibberd, Loretta
Originally from rural Waikato, Jessie Gibberd made the move to Wellington to study, but it was the buzz of hospitality that captured her heart. Swapping textbooks for tongs, she left her degree behind to dive headfirst into the kitchen. Now a chef de partie at Loretta, Jessie brings a grounded, fresh perspective to one of the city’s most beloved eateries.

11 August — Felipe Molina, El Matador
Hailing from Chile, Felipe Molina is a professional chef with over 15 years of experience in kitchens around the world. Having worked in several countries and world-class restaurants, Felipe brings a global sensibility to his craft. With a passion for seafood, meats, and bold, expressive flavours, his cooking is shaped by travel and tradition, blending international influence with creativity on every plate.

18 August — Zane Gupwell, Graze
Zane Gupwell began his hospitality journey at just 15, washing dishes at a local café in Mount Eden. From there, he headed to Queenstown, learning from a wide range of chefs and kitchen styles before challenging himself with a move to Wellington. Since then, he’s worked at some of the city’s top restaurants and now brings his thoughtful, evolving style to Graze Wine Bar.

25 August — Lulu Temmuyin, Mr Go’s
Lulu Temmuyin is a chef who loves pushing boundaries, even when they’re unexpected. Lactose intolerant but obsessed with cheese, and not a fan of lamb but winner of a lamb cooking competition, Lulu is all about surprises. At Mr Go’s, she brings bold, sustainable flavour to the forefront, blending personality with punch in every dish.

Everybody Eats runs on a pay-what-you-can model, transforming food waste into gourmet meals and bringing the community together over good kai. The Next Gen Cook Off celebrates and champions this mission, proving that rescued food can be next-level delicious.

The Next Gen Cook Off is proudly supported by The Gas Hub.
events.description:
The Next Gen Cook Off returns for its fifth year, and things are heating up at Everybody Eats.
Every Monday in August, four of Wellington’s freshest young chefs will go head-to-head in a high-energy kitchen takeover, serving up epic three-course dinners using rescued food.
Each chef will be given the same protein, generously provided by Meat Direct, but everything else is a surprise—ingredients are revealed that morning, based on what’s come in.
Having worked in several countries and world-class restaurants, Felipe brings a global sensibility to his craft.
At Mr Go’s, she brings bold, sustainable flavour to the forefront, blending personality with punch in every dish.

events.long_description:
If you have tamariki aged 0-6, you’re invited to your local centre during Playcentre Open Week to experience early childhood education with a difference.

Come along for a free visit and support your tamariki to learn through play, while you meet other whānau in your community. From sand and water play, arts and music, to outdoor and messy play, there will be a range of resources and experiences on offer.

events.id: A Mother's Space-Burling Flats, 58 Bell St, Featherston 5710, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: A Mother's Space
events.venue: Burling Flats, 58 Bell St, Featherston 5710, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The root of our humanity lies with The Mother's. To support thriving life we are offering A Mother's Space as care and resourcing for ALL Mother's to gather.
Kate Williams and Lily Tanner are Innate Traditions Postpartum Care providers.
We are so honoured to share our offering!
This coming Monday 18th Aug we are in Featherston at the Kiwi Hall.
A Mother’s circle happens every fortnight on a Monday (2nd & 4th of every week). It is for ALL postpartum mothers, no matter the age of your children. You could be freshly postpartum or have older children and felt you are still needing repair, perhaps your postpartum time was not how you wanted or expected? OR you are feeling the disconnect of what it feels like to Mother in these times we are living in.
Whatever it is for you.....This is a S.P.A.C.E where you can show up just as you are. To be SEEN, HEARD, NOURISHED & SUPPORTED. Join in with the village wisdom of the Mothers.
These regular sessions are where we tend to:
Nervous system regulation / breath
Self care
Sharing & community building
Postpartum wisdom & support
Repair
Special guest speakers
Babies, of course, are welcome!
This yummy ‘retreat’ like session tours the Wairarapa- Featherston, Carterton, Masterton and back around again.
This week we are in Masterton at the Hōkai Tahi building 21 Worksop Road. 10 am start.
All welcome! Bookings are recommended but not essential, you can just drop in. $20 cash at the door.
Book here: https://classes.as.me/?appointmentType=77697735

events.id: Writers on Mondays: Ōrongohau | Best New Zealand Poems 2024-Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Writers on Mondays: Ōrongohau | Best New Zealand Poems 2024
events.venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
events.description:
Join editor and poet Nick Ascroft as he introduces a crackling selection of New Zealand poets from his edition of the annual online anthology Ōrongohau | Best New Zealand Poems.
James Brown, Robin Peace, Simon Sweetman, Stacey Teague, Philomena Johnson, Kiri Piahana-Wong, Zephyr Zhang, and others will read their work, and poems by the late Fleur Adcock, Vincent O’Sullivan, and Paula Harris will also be celebrated in this warm-up to Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day.
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre, Meow and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day and supported by the Letteri Family.

events.venue: 34 Moorefield Rd, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us and our doggy guests from Canine Friends Pet Therapy for Read to Kurī at the library. You can book a 15-minute session to sit with one of our friendly dogs and read your favourite book, or one you've found at the library.
Read to Kurī aims to help children improve their literacy, self-confidence, and self-esteem in a relaxed, non-judgemental environment. This programme is perfect for tamariki aged 5+ who would like to practice their reading skills while making a new canine friend at the library.
To book your session, please call the library on 04 477 6151, or email johnsonville.library@wcc.govt.nz with your preferred date and time.
Bookings are for 15 minutes only. After you have booked, library staff will be in contact informing you what time to arrive for your session.

events.id: Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners Block B-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners Block B
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Connect with other like minded people that have a love of dance.
Brazilian Zouk was developed in Rio de Janeiro in the mid 90s, and is now becoming more and more popular
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DfhRHnEAbak
..............
This is stunning to watch and even more fun to dance! It is based on the original Lambada dance but adapted to more modern music with a slow-quick-quick beat. It can be danced to a wide variety of music including R&B, Rock and Pop.
In this block of 5 classes you will discover the fundamental techniques, movements and sequences of Brazilian Zouk to get you up and running on the dance floor.
This includes:
Week 1: Passo basico
Week 2: Viradinha
Week 3: Io-Io
Week 4: Bonus
Week 5: Combination
They are designed so you can start this block as a complete newbie, or you can continue on as an existing student from the last block.
There are 4 blocks of classes (A, B, C, D) in the complete Fundamentals course. Once these are done, you can progress to the Improvers classes.
Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week term cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students.
- Ad hoc cost is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukFunB

events.id: Dine with a Doc - The power of plant-based nutrition and lifestyle interventions-1 Okowai Road, Aotea, Porirua 5024, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Dine with a Doc - The power of plant-based nutrition and lifestyle interventions
events.venue: 1 Okowai Road, Aotea, Porirua 5024, New Zealand
events.description:
Doctors For Nutrition and MTM Charity invite you to an evening of inspiration, education, and connection at our next ‘Dine with a Doc’ dinner.
Join us for a presentation on ‘The Power of Plant-Based Nutrition and Lifestyle Interventions for Preventing Chronic Disease’—an event designed to empower everyone from healthcare professionals to health-conscious community members.
You will also be the first to hear about the new MTM charity, and about their mission.
Through easy-to-understand explanations of key concepts - such as endothelial dysfunction, intramyocellular lipid accumulation, and calorie density - you’ll discover how WFPB eating can dramatically improve health outcomes and transform lives.
After the presentation, join us for a panel discussion and a Q&A session with Dr Haitjema and Dr Luke Wilson.

Lebanese-Palestinian American, born in Oakland California, Sammy Obeid double majored in Business and Mathematics at UC Berkeley and then turned down a job at Google to be a comedian. Now the host of 100 Humans on Netflix, he’s also appeared on NBC's Last Comic Standing and America's Got Talent, as well as TBS’s Conan, and is best known for his world record of performing comedy 1,001 nights in a row, a story featured in both Time Magazine and The New York Times.

events.id: Deep dive - Traditional Samba de Gafieira Part 2-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Deep dive - Traditional Samba de Gafieira Part 2
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Across six immersive sessions (the first being a practica), we'll Continue to learn the fundamentals of Traditional Samba de Gafieira.
We will continue to deepen your knowledge, continuing on learning the concepts started in the first block of Samba de Gafieira classes.
Week 1: Practice/party/catch up
Week 2: Sacada + Sacada Invertido
Week 3: Romario
Week 4: Pica Pau
Week 5: Esse + Esse saida
Week 6: Facao + Facinha
Samba de gafieira is the partnered version of Brazil’s world-renowned, samba no pe. Samba de Gafieira is danced to the Brazilian samba musical rhythms and must be distinguished from the ballroom Samba, danced in International Latin and American Rhythm ballroom dance styles.
Check out this demo : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JMGlfr3zA5w
It appeared in the 1940s and it gets its name from the Gafieira – popular urban nightclubs of Rio de Janeiro at that time. The dance derived from the Maxixe and followed the arrival of the Choro (another samba musical style). It left most of the Maxixe’s Polka elements behind but maintained the entwined leg movements of the Argentine Tango, although adopting a more relaxed posture than the latter. Many see this form of Samba as a combination of Waltz and Tango.
- Prepaid 6 week block cost is $98 ($90 without the practica) waged or $80 ($75 without the practica) for unwaged/students
- Ad hoc cost is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students, and if you want to pay for the practica separately its only $10
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk

events.id: Evening meeting - AGM; Tony Druce Memorial Lecture-101 Victoria St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Evening meeting - AGM; Tony Druce Memorial Lecture
events.venue: 101 Victoria St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Speakers: Ilse Breitwieser, Research Associate – Botanist; Rob Smissen, Senior Researcher – Botanist. Allan Herbarium, Manaaki Whenua – Landcare Research, Lincoln.
Call them billy-buttons, drumstick flowers, billy balls, sun balls (in Australia) or woollyheads and puatea in New Zealand, or with their scientific name Craspedia (Gnaphalieae, Compositae/Asteraceae), these everlasting daisies are conspicuous members of many plant communities in New Zealand and Australia but remain an outstanding taxonomic challenge.
In 1961, based on a small number of available herbarium specimens, HH Allan’s Flora of New Zealand volume 1 recorded just 6 species in New Zealand. However, the 1992 and 1993 checklists of Tony Druce, who made extensive field observations and collected numerous herbarium specimens, distinguished more than 45 undescribed entities that might warrant taxonomic recognition.
Morphological variation in New Zealand Craspedia is complex, making the definition and circumscription of species problematic. At least in part, this difficulty is the legacy of an extremely rapid and recent diversification of the genus in New Zealand—a scenario that produces challenges for genetic as well as morphological approaches to delimiting species.

Allan Herbarium, Manaaki Whenua – Landcare Research, Lincoln.

events.id: Love in Scent-WORLD Wellington, 29 Manners Street-WOAP
events.name: Love in Scent
events.venue: WORLD Wellington, 29 Manners Street
events.long_description:
Join fragrance aficionado Benny Castles for an immersive journey into the WORLD of love, told through the art of scent. In this exclusive olfactive experience, indulge in small bites and sip on a glass (or three!) of something delightful, setting the perfect mood for exploring the emotional power of fragrance.

Over the course of the evening, you’ll sample up to twelve unique fragrances, each one tied to a captivating love story that inspired its creation. Learn the intimate tales behind these scents and discover how they evoke the passions and emotions that shape our experiences of love. Whether you're a fragrance enthusiast or a newcomer, this sensory journey is sure to arouse your olfactory senses and deepen your appreciation for the art of perfume.

events.description:
The NZCBIA Building Construction Report, commissioned by the New Zealand Chinese Building Industry Association (NZCBIA) and led by renowned economist Shamubeel Eaqub, is fast becoming a respected voice in New Zealand’s property and construction sectors.
This year’s edition provides practical insights into key industry issues, with a particular focus on people, including workforce trends, productivity, training and upskilling, diversity, and the growing impact of AI.

events.id: Government Digital Transformation in Latin America - what can we learn?-15 Stout Street Wellington, Wellington 6011-Event Brite
events.name: Government Digital Transformation in Latin America - what can we learn?
events.venue: 15 Stout Street Wellington, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
We are excited to announce the latest in our series of talks on Digital Transformation, in partnership with Silverstripe.
María Inés Baque will be joining us online from Argentina to share her expert insights and experiences on the key goals, capabilities, opportunities and challenges for government digital transformation - with a range of use cases from around Latin America.
María Inés Baque is Government Transformation Advisor for Latin America, Canada, and the Caribbean (LCC) at AWS. She served as secretary of digital government and technology innovation in Argentina from 2016 to 2019. She coordinated the Digital Agenda 2030 and led the transformational efforts in the areas of digital services, digital inclusion, open government, open data and new technologies adoption.
Global awards and recognitions she has received include Innovation Lab, Tel Aviv, 20 exceptional GovTech Leaders (2020), Women Corporate Directors 2019 and The 100 Most Influential People in Digital Government, Apolitical, 2018.
She was co-chair of the G20 Digital Economy Taskforce for Gender Inclusion in 2018 that issued the Bridging the Digital Gender Divide report.
Before government, her career was in global IT and financial services enterprises. She focused on process reengineering, startups, IT management, outsourcing and business process operations.
You may attend in person at the MBIE offices (limited to 40 people - there will be some food courtesy of Silverstripe), or you may tune in online via Microsoft Teams (the link will be at the bottom of your order confirmation email). If you choose to attend in person please arrive at 11.50am so there is time for you to sign in, pick up some food, and be seated before we begin. There will be time for questions after the presentation.

She coordinated the Digital Agenda 2030 and led the transformational efforts in the areas of digital services, digital inclusion, open government, open data and new technologies adoption.
Global awards and recognitions she has received include Innovation Lab, Tel Aviv, 20 exceptional GovTech Leaders (2020), Women Corporate Directors 2019 and The 100 Most Influential People in Digital Government, Apolitical, 2018.
She was co-chair of the G20 Digital Economy Taskforce for Gender Inclusion in 2018 that issued the Bridging the Digital Gender Divide report.
Before government, her career was in global IT and financial services enterprises.

events.long_description:
We're delighted to have Sereana Naepi in the shop to talk about Oceans Between Us: Pacific Peoples & Racism in Aotearoa, which she edited and was published by Auckland University Press.
Oceans Between Us is both a testimony and a call to action. It documents the struggles of Pacific peoples and envisions a world beyond now. A rallying cry for justice, a demand for equity and a catalyst for change, this book is not about survival alone – it’s about thriving.
All welcome!

events.venue: Mitchell Street Lower Hutt, Wellington Region
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Draw It Out - Teens block course-level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Draw It Out - Teens block course
events.venue: level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A fun and deep way for teens (11-17 year olds) to learn to process their feelings.
Theme: Listening to your inner voice
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
Teenage years can often be filled with external influences, making it hard to listen to our own inner voice for guidance. This 4-session block course teaches teens how to use drawing to process hard feelings and access their own inner resources, which can be used at home as visual journaling.
Dates
This block course consists of 4 workshops:
4.15pm-5.30pm
Tuesday 19th August - Metaphors for feelings
Tuesday 26th August - Uncovering needs
Tuesday 2nd September - Unlocking self-compassion
Monday 8th September - Curiosity in direction
Cost
$184 total ($46 per session)
Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

events.id: Kiwibank business insights: The commercial advantage of sustainability-level 8/20 Customhouse Quay, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Kiwibank business insights: The commercial advantage of sustainability
events.venue: level 8/20 Customhouse Quay, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
The good news?
Embracing sustainability can help you do just that.
Co-hosted by Kiwibank, WellingtonNZ and the Sustainable Business Network (SBN).
What to expect: Insights from the Sustainable Business Network on the real, bottom-line benefits of sustainability A keynote from Mike Casey, Founder of Rewiring Aotearoa, on how electrification is helping Kiwi businesses cut costs and future-proof against rising energy prices Real-world examples and tips you can apply now The opportunity to connect with other business leaders tackling the same challenges About the hosts At Kiwibank, we're proud to be B-Corp certified, joining a global movement of businesses committed to balancing purpose and profit.
WellingtonNZ is committed to building a sustainable region - supporting initiatives that protect the wellbeing of the people and environment, both now and in the future.

events.long_description:

Comedian, writer, and lifelong teacher Neil Thornton (seen on TV3’s After Hours) brings you a fun low-pressure comedy workshop.

events.id: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point? This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction. Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.


Meet your host, Sivananda
Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.
6.15pm Tuesday 19th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

events.name: 6 Week Meditation Course
events.venue: Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 20 Alexander Rd, Raumati
events.description:
The goals we have set for this course are: - to understand the principles of meditation practice - to be able to sit comfortably and still - the ability to follow a basic meditation technique independently - to establish a regular home meditation practice - to be inspired to further develop knowledge and skills in meditation In our daily lives, we increasingly need more focus, inner clarity, and perhaps most of all, inner peace.
These qualities are inherent to us, though sometimes hidden by a busy mind.
This course will provide both theoretical and practical methods to reconnect with your Self.
Suitable for complete beginners, those returning to their practice after a break, or anyone seeking the support of the Sangha.
If you would like to attend the course online please email us at: kapiti@yogaindailylife.org.nz for the Zoom link.

events.id: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Escape to the Dramatic Coast: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
Are you looking for a unique and unforgettable day trip from Wellington?
Imagine yourself surrounded by breathtaking coastal scenery, watching playful seals in their natural habitat, and standing in the shadow of a historic lighthouse with panoramic ocean views.
As your dedicated travel and adventure tour guide, I offer exclusive, low-key private tours to Cape Palliser, perfect for individuals, couples, or families seeking a personalized and enriching experience.
What's in store for you:
Personalized Pick-up & Drop-off: Enjoy the convenience of being picked up and dropped off directly from your Wellington accommodation.
Scenic Coastal Drive: Relax in comfort as we journey through picturesque landscapes, including the stunning Remutaka Hill Road and the rugged Wairarapa coastline.
Marvel at the Putangirua Pinnacles: Explore the otherworldly rock formations made famous by "Lord of the Rings."
Encounter the Cape Palliser Seal Colony: Witness a thriving colony of New Zealand fur seals up close (from a safe and respectful distance).
Discover the Iconic Cape Palliser Lighthouse: Climb (or admire from below) the iconic red and white striped lighthouse and soak in the incredible views.
Flexible & Relaxed Pace: This is your private tour, so we'll move at a comfortable pace and can tailor the day to your interests.
Gourmet Options Available (upon request & additional cost): Elevate your experience with a pre-arranged gourmet picnic lunch or inquire about other bespoke dining options featuring local flavors.
Expert Guidance: Benefit from my local knowledge, insights into the region's history, geology, and wildlife, ensuring a truly engaging experience.
Perfect for Photography Enthusiasts: Capture stunning photos of dramatic landscapes and unique wildlife.
Who is this tour for?
This private Cape Palliser day trip is ideal for:
Individuals seeking a solo adventure.
Couples looking for a romantic and scenic escape.
Families wanting a memorable and educational day out.
Anyone who appreciates beautiful scenery, wildlife encounters, and a relaxed, personalized travel experience.
Those who value quality and are happy to invest in a private tour.
Date & Time: Flexible - Contact me to discuss your preferred dates and times.
Duration: Approximately 8-9 hours (can be adjusted slightly based on your preferences).
Price: Pricing is tailored to the number of people in your group and any additional requests (e.g., gourmet lunch). Please message me for a personalized quote.
Booking:
Send me a direct message to discuss your preferred dates, group size, and any specific interests you may have. I'm happy to answer any questions and create a bespoke itinerary for you.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to experience the magic of Cape Palliser on your own terms!

As your dedicated travel and adventure tour guide, I offer exclusive, low-key private tours to Cape Palliser, perfect for individuals, couples, or families seeking a personalized and enriching experience.

events.id: Battle of the Wine Regions-Rosella, 18 Majoribanks Street-WOAP
events.name: Battle of the Wine Regions
events.venue: Rosella, 18 Majoribanks Street
events.long_description:
The best winemakers from across New Zealand will battle it out for bragging rights, and raise money for a charity dear to Rosella's heart at the same time. 
For a second year, three winemakers will put their best grape-crushing foot forward to match a wine from their home region with each course in a five-course degustation menu. Guests will vote for the best-matched wine for each course, scores will be tallied up, and winners will be crowned! 
All profits will go to Heart Kids Foundation, a charity that Rosella's owners received a lot of support from when their son was born with a congenital heart disease. This is their chance to give back to this great charity and provide the support needed for other families going through the same situation.

events.id: I-Sarn Thai KanTok-Tuk Tuk Thai Kitchen, 15 Hartham Place North-WOAP
events.name: I-Sarn Thai KanTok
events.venue: Tuk Tuk Thai Kitchen, 15 Hartham Place North
events.long_description:
Join Daeng from Tuk Tuk Thai for a deeply personal culinary journey to the heart of E-Sarn, the north-eastern region of Thailand she once called home. This one-night-only event celebrates the traditional Kan-Tok style of dining – a communal meal served on handwoven bamboo trays and shared amongst family and friends. This event is made to be shared, the ticket price is for a shared menu for two. 

Growing up in the small town of Tha Bo near the Mekong Delta, Daeng’s childhood was filled with stories of rice farming, village generosity, and dishes cooked from what the garden offered. In E-Sarn, meals were acts of love, shared daily around the Kan-Tok with laughter, music, and warmth.

Now, Daeng invites you to gather at her table and experience the flavours of her upbringing. You’ll be served nine traditional dishes on a beautifully crafted bamboo tray, designed for sharing, just as they are in her village.

On the Kan-Tok:
Hor Mok Salmon – Steamed salmon in banana leaves, marinated with herbs, spices, and coconut milk
Mok Nor Mai with Pork Belly – Pork belly steamed with bamboo shoots
Larb Gai – A celebratory chicken mince salad with fresh herbs and toasted rice
E-Sarn Sausages – House-made, spiced and fermented in true north-eastern style
Nam Prik Tomato – Roasted tomato dipping sauce with chillies, garlic, and shallots
Som Tum – Green papaya salad with a sweet, sour, spicy kick
Sticky Rice – Soaked overnight and steamed in traditional bamboo baskets
Fresh and Steamed Seasonal Vegetables – To enjoy with sauces and mains

Dessert:
Kanom Chan – Thai layered jelly cake
Kanom Mun – Tapioca and coconut pudding

Pull up a seat at Daeng’s table and discover the stories, flavours, and traditions that shaped her childhood.
Single tickets or odd numbers unable to be catered to.
events.description:
Join Daeng from Tuk Tuk Thai for a deeply personal culinary journey to the heart of E-Sarn, the north-eastern region of Thailand she once called home.
This one-night-only event celebrates the traditional Kan-Tok style of dining – a communal meal served on handwoven bamboo trays and shared amongst family and friends.
Growing up in the small town of Tha Bo near the Mekong Delta, Daeng’s childhood was filled with stories of rice farming, village generosity, and dishes cooked from what the garden offered.
In E-Sarn, meals were acts of love, shared daily around the Kan-Tok with laughter, music, and warmth.
Now, Daeng invites you to gather at her table and experience the flavours of her upbringing.

events.name: Santiago to Buenos Aires
events.venue: Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln
events.long_description: Noble Rot sommeliers Maciej Zimny and Jessica Wood invite you to embark on their recent road trip through Chile and Argentina. They will indulge you with stories and share their experiences through these two fantastic wine countries alongside a South American themed five-course degustation menu including dishes they enjoyed on their journey. Relax and enjoy their tales and insight into why the wines taste the way they do, the key stylistic differences between the two countries, and learn from them first-hand the secrets of why Chilean and Argentine wines are ones to watch in the future.

events.id: Wellington Before9: Responsible AI - have we figured out what that means in practice?-Level 13/18 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington Before9: Responsible AI - have we figured out what that means in practice?
events.venue: Level 13/18 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for "Responsible AI - have we figured out what that means in practice?," an engaging Before9 (Breakfast event) discussing the latest strategic direction of the technology in Aotearoa New Zealand.
New Zealand's first national AI strategy has arrived, aiming to boost productivity and encourage the uptake of AI "with confidence." But as we move forward, a critical question remains: what does "responsible AI" actually look like in practice for businesses and organisations in Aotearoa? This panel discussion will delve into the nuances of the government's new strategy, exploring its impact on our collective journey. Our panel will unpack the challenges and opportunities presented by a "light-touch" regulatory approach and discuss how we can build a uniquely Kiwi framework for responsible AI in New Zealand.
Our panel will be made up of the following individuals:
Zoe Udy, Deputy Chair at TUANZ
Sasha Vlassoff, Senior Policy Advisor at InternetNZ
Plus one other
Zoe in particular will be able to give an update from our meeting with the Parliamentary cross-party caucus on AI.
We look forward to hosting you at this Before9.  This event is free for members of InternetNZ and TUANZ.  This is a number limited event to 30 individuals so make sure you register early.
Please note the formalities will start at 7:45am but you can arrive any time after 7:30am.

events.name: Wellington City Chorus – Women’s Barbershop
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
Wellington City Chorus is a group of dedicated and talented women (and one man) who perform one of the few musical art forms that originate in the United States - Barbershop Harmony.
Wellington City Chorus is a chapter of Sweet Adelines International.
This non-profit organisation is dedicated to teaching, learning and singing four-part harmony, barbershop style, through performances and teaching, perpetuating and creating a love for this style of A Cappella singing in our community.
Wellington City Chorus is fortunate to have David Brooks as our Director – skilled in and enjoys the craft of barbershop and willingly passes on his knowledge.
As previous national champions Wellington City Chorus has represented New Zealand on the international stage in Las Vegas, Hawaii, Denver, Baltimore and St Louis.

events.id: Site Visit - Studio of Pacific Architecture - Te Aro Double-Header!-19 Buckle Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Site Visit - Studio of Pacific Architecture - Te Aro Double-Header!
events.venue: 19 Buckle Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us on Wednesday 20 August, for an exclusive NAWIC members-only site tour of two very different but geographically close projects in Te Aro. The National War Memorial and FPC Martin Square are both undergoing major refurbishment - join us for a look behind the scenes!
National War Memorial: Refurbishing a Wellington Icon
Step behind the scaffolding and witness the National War Memorial Project – a complex seismic strengthening project where heritage sensitivity is of utmost importance. With construction works being carried out by Maycroft Construction, join us for the rare opportunity to explore a significant piece of the capital’s cultural fabric.
Known to many as the backdrop of ANZAC Day commemorations, this national memorial is undergoing a meticulous refurbishment to ensure its legacy endures for generations to come.
 What’s Happening On Site:
Seismic strengthening of the tower and bell frame 
Stone remediation to preserve its historic façade
Asphalt roofing works
The real challenge? Balancing modern engineering with heritage preservation. Every upgrade is being carried out with deep respect for the building’s historical significance.

Then, just around the corner, we will move on to another refurbishment project – at a much different scale and for a very different purpose!
 FPC Martin Square: from Workshop to Office Space
Leading industrial design-and-build specialists First Principles Constructors are celebrating seven years of innovation with a bold move - into a brand-new headquarters in central Wellington. Take a look inside the transformation of a former engineering workshop into the new HQ for FPC. With exposed services, raw materials, and an industrial aesthetic, this compact yet clever refurbishment shows how much can be achieved in a small urban footprint. Construction is well underway by Aoraki Construction, with completion coming up in September.
What’s Happening On Site:
•     Structural steel installation, new roofing, cladding, a new concrete mezzanine slab
•     Interior fit-out works
•     Full building services upgrades
 The Details:
🕒 DATE and TIME: Wednesday, 20th August, meet at 2.45pm for a 3.00pm start at the National War Memorial
📍 LOCATION: Meet at the National War Memorial (19 Buckle Street) to explore this site first. We will then walk over to 21 Martin Square as a group, for the next site visit.
🎟️ COST: Free to NAWIC members, with a maximum of 18 people on the tour, so please book your space consciously. Get in quick! You can join NAWIC here.
👷‍♀️PPE: Hard hat, hi-vis, steel-capped boots. (Spare hard-hats/hi-vis are available if required, please make sure you advise us of what you need on your RSVP.)
 🎉 After the site visits, unwind with drinks and nibbles sponsored by First Principles Constructors at a nearby venue (TBC) – a chance to connect, reflect, and chat all things design and construction.
🧡 Huge thanks to Studio of Pacific Architecture, Aoraki Construction, Maycroft Construction, and First Principles Constructors for teaming up to make this event possible.
Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.

events.id: Community Agency - a conversation with Markus Luczak-Roesch and Gerhard Reese-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Community Agency - a conversation with Markus Luczak-Roesch and Gerhard Reese
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Two scholars share their perspectives on Community Agency and discuss the links between the Global environmental and global mental health crises.
  Gerhard Reese
Gerhard Reese works as Associate Professor for Climate Change at Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University Wellington in Aotearoa / New Zealand. Before, he was Professor and head of the Environmental Psychology Research Unit at the University Kaiserslautern-Landau in Germany since 2016. He got his PhD in Psychology from Friedrich Schiller University Jena, Germany, in February 2010. His research focuses on individual, social and systemic catalysts and barriers of pro-environmental behaviour and the nature-health nexus. He attempts and sometimes succeeds to spend more time outdoors than indoors and he still is a serious competitor in Super Mario Kart.
Markus Luczak-Roesch
Markus Luczak-Roesch is Professor of Informatics and the inaugural Chair in Complexity Science at Victoria University of Wellington’s School of Information Management. He is also one of two Co-Directors of Te Pūnaha Matatini, Aotearoa New  Zealand’s Centre of Research Excellence in Complex Systems. He founded and leads the Complexity & Connection Science Lab, an interdisciplinary group developing theories and computational tools to understand how complex systems unfold over time. His research investigates how structure and meaning emerge in systems - from language and brain activity to online communities and the environment - using models that reveal meaningful coincidences and unexpected system-level behaviors.

events.id: (Re)generation next: The Poet Laureate steps down-Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: (Re)generation next: The Poet Laureate steps down
events.venue: Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate Chris Tse marks the end of his term in this exciting evening with fellow poets Ken Arkind, Cadence Chung, Gregory O’Brien, Chris Price, and Ruby Solly.
Reflections on the future
Join Chris at the National Library to mark the end of his time in the role with his reflections on the future of Aotearoa New Zealand poetry and readings from special guests.
"I left the doors to the past and the future unlocked ... "
Chris Tse’s three-year term as Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate ends on Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day, when the next Poet Laureate will be announced: https://www.nzbookawards.nz/nat.../2016-national-poetry-day/
About the speakers
Chris Tse (he/him) was born and raised in Lower Hutt, New Zealand. He studied film and English literature at Victoria University of Wellington, where he also completed an MA in Creative Writing at the International Institute of Modern Letters. In 2022, he was named the 13th New Zealand Poet Laureate. His poetry, short fiction, and non-fiction have been recorded for radio and widely published in numerous journals, magazines and anthologies. He has published several collections of poetry and his latest book Super Model Minority (2022) was longlisted for the Ockham New Zealand Book Awards 2023.
Ken Arkind is an American poet, author, performer, and educator originating from Steamboat Springs in Colorado. He holds the 2006 title of the American National Poetry Slam Champion and the 2010 title of Nuyorican Poets Cafe Grand Slam Champion. Ken now resides in Auckland and is a recent graduate from the Manukau Institute of Technology’s Creative Arts Programme.
Cadence Chung (she/they) is a poet, student, and musician from Wellington, currently studying at the New Zealand School of Music. Her poems started being published in her junior years of high school, and her debut chapbook anomalia was published by We Are Babies Press in April 2022. Her writing takes inspiration from antique stores, Tumblr text posts, and dead poets.
Gregory O’Brien is a poet, painter, author, curator, and editor. His most recent poetry publication is a collection of poems and paintings, House and contents (2022). Other recent publications include a book-length meditation on the Pacific, Always song in the water (2019) and the Ockham award winning book Don Binney: Flight Path (2023).
events.description:
Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate Chris Tse marks the end of his term in this exciting evening with fellow poets Ken Arkind, Cadence Chung, Gregory O’Brien, Chris Price, and Ruby Solly.
In 2022, he was named the 13th New Zealand Poet Laureate.
He has published several collections of poetry and his latest book Super Model Minority (2022) was longlisted for the Ockham New Zealand Book Awards 2023.
He holds the 2006 title of the American National Poetry Slam Champion and the 2010 title of Nuyorican Poets Cafe Grand Slam Champion.
Cadence Chung (she/they) is a poet, student, and musician from Wellington, currently studying at the New Zealand School of Music.

events.id: EYA Presents: The Bible and the Sacraments Bible Study-17 Boulcott Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: EYA Presents: The Bible and the Sacraments Bible Study
events.venue: 17 Boulcott Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
What are the Sacraments? Where do they come from? What do they mean? And why are they so central to our Catholic Faith?
In The Bible and the Sacraments, you’ll discover the deeply biblical roots of the Seven Sacraments and how they are more than mere Church rituals, but streams of life flowing from the living Body of Christ.
Throughout this study, you’ll discover how God has always dealt with His people through “sacraments,” and how the sacraments of the Old Testament find their ultimate fulfillment in the Seven Sacraments instituted by Christ and celebrated in the Catholic Church to this day.
Eucharistia Young Adults (EYA) introduces our second Bible study for 2025! This eleven-lesson Bible study by St Paul Center will delve into the beauty of the sacraments of the Catholic Church.
Please bring your Bible, journal, pen - and of course, your lovely self! Bring your friends, co-workers, family members, the more the merrier!
__________________
Every Wednesday | 16 July 2025 - 08 October 2025
St Mary's of the Angels Parish Hall
Everyone is most welcome!

Bring your friends, co-workers, family members, the more the merrier!

events.id: Perspectives on Aroreretini | ADHD: A Panel Event-Kelburn Parade Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
events.name: Perspectives on Aroreretini | ADHD: A Panel Event
events.venue: Kelburn Parade Wellington, Wellington Region
events.description:
Perspectives on Aroreretini | ADHD Join us on August 20 at 6:00pm for an insightful discussion on ADHD (Aroreretini) from a range of expert voices.
Whether you're a parent, educator, clinician, someone with ADHD, or simply interested in learning more, this event is for you!
The panel will explore how ADHD is understood and supported in Aotearoa, including myths and misconceptions, debates in the field, and potential ways forward.
We have assembled a panel who represent different areas of research, practice, and lived experience of ADHD.
We will have time for patai (questions) from attendees, followed by time to eat and connect with others.

events.id: The Art of Mending-157 Hataitai Rd, Hataitai, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: The Art of Mending
events.venue: 157 Hataitai Rd, Hataitai, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This class is cared for by the whimsical Aisha, a multidisciplinary artist with a passion for empowering the mending process. Each month on Wednesday evenings Aisha will introduce us to a different technique for reviving our beloved textile pieces. If you're like us and have a box of clothing in need of repairs that never seems to empty... this is the club for you. With three events a month we'll inspire each other to creatively care for those pieces we love! This club is also perfect for anyone who loves learning new skills. Techniques we'll cover are lino printing, patching, darning, felting, embroidery, beading, sashiko, fabric painting and more! All materials and tools are supplied at each class - but you are welcome to bring your own and we highly encourage bringing a textile item (or many!) to fix up.
In August we're lino printing!
Class 01: 13th August
In this class we'll get an introduction to lino printing on fabric and best practice for using this process to cover stains. Pre cut designs and all other tools are supplied. Please bring either clothing you would like to print on or some fabric scrap to make lino printed patches!
Class 02: 20th August
At this class Aisha will take us through the process of designing and cutting our own lino to print with! You're welcome to keep going with the pre cut designs as well. Lino and carving tools will be supplied.
Class 03: 27th August
This class will be open to what you want to work on! Bring in larger project items, print with the lino cuts you made in the previous week, or cut some fresh ones!

events.description:
Join us to help progress Wellington by bringing together science, tech & investors from across the city into an informal, fun and informative meet-up.

events.id: Whāia te mātauranga hei oranga mō koutou: A Review-3 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Whāia te mātauranga hei oranga mō koutou: A Review
events.venue: 3 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Nau mai, haere mai, hoki mai.
Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum is proud to present the Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum Legal Series, an informative lecture series about the purpose, historical significance and ongoing mahi of the Waitangi Tribunal held alongside the exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975-2025.
The Government recently announced a review of the Treaty of Waitangi Act 1975, which comes as the statute approaches its 50-year milestone on 10th October. The review is part of the coalition agreement between New Zealand First and National and will be led by an Independent Technical Advisory Group (ITAG), supported by Te Puni Kōkiri, to examine the whether the Waitangi Tribunal is “fit for purpose, not just for today, but for the generations to come.”
Joining us to discuss the topic of reform are Former Attorney-General and Treaty Minister Christopher Finlayson, and Matanuku Mahuika, who co-chaired the Waitangi Tribunal’s own Strategic Direction Review Group in 2024.
Tickets are $35 per session, or $25 for students and SuperGold Card holders, and include one drink and light kai. Doors open 5:30pm. The exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata will remain open to view until 8pm.
Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum
Wednesday 20 August | 6pm–8pm
Tickets $25–$35
This series has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.
Speakers:
Christopher Finlayson
The Hon. Christopher Finlayson served as an MP for 12 years, including as Attorney-General and Minister for Treaty of Waitangi Negotiations from 2008 to 2017. During his Ministerial career he also held a number of other portfolios. He is the co-author of He Kupu Taurangi: Treaty Settlements and the Future of Aotearoa New Zealand. He left politics in 2019 and now works for Bankside Chambers as a barrister.
Matanuku Mahuika
(Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Raukawa)
Matanuku Mahuika is one of Aotearoa’s leading Māori lawyers in private practice. He co-founded Kāhui Legal in 2003. Prior to establishing Kāhui Legal, Matanuku was a partner at Walters Williams & Co and in-house counsel at the Treaty of Waitangi Fisheries Commission.
This series has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.

events.id: Conservation Kōrero: Underwater Forests of Wellington-29 Waiapu Rd, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Conservation Kōrero: Underwater Forests of Wellington
events.venue: 29 Waiapu Rd, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Towering seaweed forests and colourful sponge gardens lie just beneath the surface of Wellington’s coastline. Like forests on land, these underwater habitats support a remarkable diversity of life, including treasured kaimoana species. Yet they face growing pressure from human activity and environmental change.
Dr Nicole Miller will take us on a visual journey through Wellington’s Blue Belt, exploring current conservation successes and challenges. Drawing on years of diving, photography and local restoration work, Nicole will highlight the beauty and fragility of these ecosystems and why it’s more important than ever to bring changes to the surface.
This event will be held in the Pāteke Room in the Visitor Centre with light refreshments provided. Doors open at 6:00pm, parking is available at both our Visitor Centre and overflow parking area on Birdwood Street.
Nicole’s seaweed artworks will be on display at Zealandia Te Māra a Tāne from 1 August to 30 September, with all profits supporting Explore Your Coast: www.exploreyourcoast.co.nz/docu.

events.id: Intro to Musical Improv | A PopRox Improv Course-61 - 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Intro to Musical Improv | A PopRox Improv Course
events.venue: 61 - 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Musical improv can be absolute magic. Whether it's a whole musical show, or single song that bursts out of an emotional scene, music adds so much to our improv.
This course for improvisers will give an introduction to musical improv. We'll cover basic song structures, how to get into a song from a scene, how to support a song through chorus work, and why and when we use music to add to our improv.
Participants should be confident in scene-work and have at least 2 years improv experience. This course will not teach you how to approach scenes and characters, so you should have a solid foundation which you can add to with this new toolbox of musical skills.
The course includes 6 workshops which will run 6:30pm to 8:30pm on Wednesdays from August 6th to September 10th. As it is an intro course, we do not anticipate a showcase for this course.
ABOUT THE TEACHERS
LIA KELLY is a theatre-maker and teacher based in Pōneke. She is an established director, actor, improviser and musician and has been a part of productions across the city over the last 10 years. She directed One Night Band which won 'Most Original Production' at the Wellington Theatre Awards 2023, and performs regularly as both a player and musician for POPROX.
ISAAC THOMAS has been an improviser and improv musician for a decade in Pōneke and Whakatū/Nelson. He's played with Body in Space, Playshop, Poprox and been musical director for musical improv powerhouse The Pāua Ballads. He has worked with almost every major improv company around the city accompanying them through improvised piano, guitar and vocals.
THE STANDY-BY LIST
PopRox firmly believes that improv is for everyone, especially when it comes to sharing skills and knowledge. So we're offering "the stand-by list" for all our workshops in 2025. We'll giveaway any spots remaining a few days before the first workshop of the course, on a first-come-first-serve basis. No need to provide a reason, no questions asked. If the entry fee is a barrier for you to come along, then simply email poproximprov@gmail.com and we'll pop you on the SBL. Everyone on the list will be notified whether there was a place available for them 3 days before the first workshop.

medium largely inspired by – and seeking to
channel – the primeval essence of the human experience,
flashes of illumination will descend the sky
from which there shall be no shelter.
Forged of an intense understanding between drummer
Fabian Wyrsch and guitarist Okoi Jones, the
project first took physical form in 2008. Before
long, the dualistic significance of their musical partnership
outshone any need for a bass player and
has since served to both challenge and empower the
band’s creativity. Following their 2010 live debut in
Zürich, BØLZER soon made a name for themselves
as the remarkable Swiss-Antipodean duo capable of
conjuring up mighty barriers of sound with nothing
but a ten-stringed guitar and an almost ritualistic
percussion style. The pair describe their own stage
experience as a form of spiritual rapture, an atavistic
vortex woven together from the profound union
of spectacle meeting spectator on a deeper plane.
events.description:
BØLZER [bœlˈtsr] ~ He who strikes like lightning – with sudden, decisive force or implications.
20/08 - Wellington; Valhalla 21/08 - Auckland; Whammy Bar Tickets on sale from: https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/97050/BLZER.utr An intuitive art project born from raw passion; musical ecstasy fueled by impulsive composition and enactment.
Whilst wielding a lyrical and musical medium largely inspired by – and seeking to channel – the primeval essence of the human experience, flashes of illumination will descend the sky from which there shall be no shelter.
Forged of an intense understanding between drummer Fabian Wyrsch and guitarist Okoi Jones, the project first took physical form in 2008.
Before long, the dualistic significance of their musical partnership outshone any need for a bass player and has since served to both challenge and empower the band’s creativity.
