events.id: Phases: Four-Part Sound Journey Through the Cycles of the Moon-26 Constable St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Phases: Four-Part Sound Journey Through the Cycles of the Moon
events.venue: 26 Constable St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Phases: A Gong Cycle in Four Moons
A 4-Part Sound Journey Aligned with the Lunar Rhythm
*$30 per session, or $100 for all four*
Float into a deep, immersive sound experience designed to align you with the rhythms of the Moon and the wisdom of the seasons.
Phases is a four-part sound bath series, each session attuned to a specific lunar phase and its accompanying zodiac sign — all cardinal, all initiatory. Through resonant soundscapes, guided meditation, colour, scent and intentional rest, you’ll be invited to explore the cycles of growth, release, reflection, and renewal within yourself.
Each session begins with a gentle meditation, followed by a sound journey that mirrors the energetic mood of the moon. These sessions are spacious, meditative, and restorative — open to anyone seeking connection with body, breath, and the unseen tides that move us. We will finish with silence and tea, to help integrate and ground.
All sessions will take place on the four Wednesdays of August, starting at 7pm.
The Four Sessions:
06.08 - 1. Waxing Gibbous in Capricorn – "Edge of Fullness"
A gong bath for expansion, tension, and the power of almost.
13.08 - 2. Waning Gibbous in Aries – "The Unravelling Light"
A sound ritual for release, gratitude, and gentle undoing.
20.08 - 3.Waning Crescent in Cancer – "Return to the Deep"
A meditative descent into rest, reflection, and inner shadow.
27.08 - 4.Waxing Crescent in Libra – "Kindling the New"
A soft emergence — a ritual for vision, hope, and gentle beginnings.

Whether you attend one session or the full cycle, each phase offers a way in — a space to listen more deeply to your inner world, to the moon, and to sound itself.
What to bring: A yoga mat or two, blanket, pillow, and anything that helps you feel comfortable lying down. **I recommend bringing extra cushioning as the floor here is concrete.**
You are welcome to bring a journal, crystals, or other ritual items.
No prior experience with sound journeys or astrology is necessary — just come as you are.

events.id: Redacted- Dixon Street Te Aro Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Redacted
events.venue: Dixon Street Te Aro Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
An exciting and immersive original production, Redacted is a bold devised theatre work created entirely by the Year 2 and 3 drama students.
Bursting with energy and imagination, this vibrant piece blends dance, dialogue, monologue, music, and abstract art to explore the current state of Wellington, the arts, and the shifting world around us.
Through a series of compelling vignettes and live art moments, the students reflect on their place within the arts landscape today, diving into themes of the universe, taonga, Superman, and freedom of speech.
Honest, dynamic, and deeply creative, Redacted showcases the extraordinary voices of tomorrow’s artists as they grapple with what it means to express themselves in a constantly evolving world.
Directed by Lyndee-Jane Rutherford and Gavin Rutherford

events.id: Nelson Mathematics Leadership Community 2025- The Ridgeway Nelson, Nelson-Event Brite
events.name: Nelson Mathematics Leadership Community 2025
events.venue: The Ridgeway Nelson, Nelson
events.description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

events.id: Honeymoon Around Asia-Chow, Level 1, 45 Tory St-WOAP
events.name: Honeymoon Around Asia
events.venue: Chow, Level 1, 45 Tory St
events.long_description:
A celebration of romance, adventure, and culinary delight. This five-course journey invites you to explore the diverse and vibrant flavours of Asia, each course representing a love letter to a different destination.

From Thailand’s spicy heat to Japan’s delicate sushi, Vietnam’s fresh herbs, Singapore’s bold flavours, and Korea’s comforting warmth, each dish tells a beautiful story of romance and culture. The atmosphere will be filled with house and disco beats, setting the stage for a playful, immersive experience. The interactive passport-style menus guide you through the adventure, while fun photo opportunities like a “Love Letters Wall” and the “Just Married to Dumplings” photo station let you capture the magic of the evening.

With mini cocktail pairings featuring creative, Asia-inspired concoctions, this event is all about connection, indulgence, and the joy of sharing a meal with those you love, whether it’s your partner, bestie, or fellow food enthusiast. Five courses, five destinations, and one unforgettable night of culinary bliss.

events.id: Snacks Amore-Amuse Snack Bar, 178 Willis Street-WOAP
events.name: Snacks Amore
events.venue: Amuse Snack Bar, 178 Willis Street
events.long_description:
When the host brings you bread, instead of a red flag...Snacks Amore!
Amuse Snack Bar invites food lovers to ditch the dating apps for one delicious night of light-hearted speed dating and snack-based bonding at their Euro-inspired aperitivo haven. Whether you are after a snack (human) or a snack (sustenance), you're guaranteed to leave with a full heart and a satisfied appetite.
Each attendee will enjoy 12 mini dates and 6 courses of Italian-inspired snacklets – cacio e pepe, agrodolce, pasta alla norma, porchetta, and zabaione, all served in perfect bite-sized form. A glass of Lambrusco kicks off the evening, with a cheeky mini tiramisu maritozzo to take home. Throughout the event, wines curated by the charming Richard Klein of Artigiano Imports will be on offer, alongside Amuse’s house spritz, Negroni, and Parrotdog Lager.
The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming – more aperitivo hour than high-pressure matchmaking. The Amuse team, also musicians, will guide the evening with playful icebreakers, musical moments, and a light-touch structure that makes meeting new people easy and enjoyable.
Two themed evenings allow guests to choose their best fit:

Evening 1: General Assembly
Grouped on the night by chosen generation:
• 5:30pm – Millennials (28–45)
• 7:30pm – Gen X (40–60)

Evening 2: Rainbow Night
Grouped by dating preference:
• 5:30pm – those seeking men
• 7:30pm – those seeking women

The event warmly welcomes all gender identities and sexual orientations. Attendees will be asked to indicate who they’re interested in dating at checkout, but gender identity remains private unless individuals wish to share it. Symbols and nametags on the night will help create a fun and inclusive vibe. Amuse Snack Bar is proud to be an LGBTQIA+ friendly space.

events.name: 200 Hour Vinyasa Yoga Teacher Training
events.venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
events.description:
AWHI Yoga and Wellbeing’s accredited 200hr YTT program is a comprehensive and thorough journey into becoming a 200 hr certified Yoga Teacher.
We are the only vinyasa yoga teacher training in the world that blends Te Ao Māori and ancient yoga wisdoms, offering a uniquely 'Aotearoa' experience while retaining universal relevance for teaching and practicing yoga in any part of the world.
Our training is suitable for individuals interested in becoming a yoga teacher, or those looking to take a personal journey towards deepening your own practice and knowledge.
Either way, we guarantee a transformative and life-changing experience that will deepen your relationship to yoga, others, Aotearoa and your self.
A $1,000 deposit reserves your spot.

events.id: Netherfield Ball-Homewood, 50 Homewood Ave-WOAP
events.name: Netherfield Ball
events.venue: Homewood, 50 Homewood Ave
events.long_description:
Step into the enchanting world of Jane Austen’s Pride and Prejudice at Homewood, where the timeless elegance of a Regency-era ball comes to life. This evening of romance, music, and culinary delight invites you to relive the iconic moments of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr Darcy’s fateful meeting.

Guests will be greeted with crafted cocktails inspired by love potions, showcasing ingredients from some of the finest distilleries in New Zealand and the United Kingdom. As the evening unfolds, indulge in a carefully curated selection of canapés, created with fresh ingredients sourced from Homewood’s own garden, evoking the flavours and charm of the Regency period.

The grand setting of Homewood, the esteemed residence of the British High Commissioner, will transport you to a bygone era. With the glow of garden lighting, live music filling the air, and an atmosphere brimming with romance, you’ll feel as if you’ve stepped into Austen’s world. Dancing will play a central role in the evening, allowing guests to immerse themselves in the grace and grandeur of the Regency social scene.

Whether you’re an Austen devotee, a fan of Bridgerton, or simply drawn to the allure of historical elegance, this event promises to captivate your imagination and senses. Don’t miss this rare opportunity to be part of a night filled with charm, sophistication, and timeless romance.
events.description:
Step into the enchanting world of Jane Austen’s Pride and Prejudice at Homewood, where the timeless elegance of a Regency-era ball comes to life.
This evening of romance, music, and culinary delight invites you to relive the iconic moments of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr Darcy’s fateful meeting.
Guests will be greeted with crafted cocktails inspired by love potions, showcasing ingredients from some of the finest distilleries in New Zealand and the United Kingdom.
As the evening unfolds, indulge in a carefully curated selection of canapés, created with fresh ingredients sourced from Homewood’s own garden, evoking the flavours and charm of the Regency period.
The grand setting of Homewood, the esteemed residence of the British High Commissioner, will transport you to a bygone era.

events.id: Take Up Space - HAMILTON - Any gender-Hamilton-Humanitix
events.name: Take Up Space - HAMILTON - Any gender
events.venue: Hamilton
events.description:
You don’t feel you’ve the right to pursue your dreams You don’t have the confidence to speak up and share ideas You’d love to dress differently but you’re scared what people will say.
You’re doing what’s expected of you, but it feels like you’re leading someone else’s life.
This workshop is for you If lack of confidence is holding you back If you’re struggling with leadership If you’ve been told you’re too much What we'll cover in the workshop Build a foundation that’ll empower you to take risks, overcome fear and self-doubt, and do the things you’ve always wanted to do.
A fun day of laughter and connection for anyone who wants to explore how they can take up more space in the world.
Meet your irreverent badass hosts Miraka (Shelly) Davies Described as the lovechild of Brené Brown and P!nk, aged 37, Shelly walked away from her family’s five-generation commitment to conservative Christianity and started the exploratory period of her life, also known as “fucking shit up.” A people pleaser in recovery, she infiltrates organisations on the pretext of giving writing training and subverts teams to question the rules, while using her hard-won lessons in badassery to inspire you to know yourself, love yourself, find power, and have joy.

events.name: The Disciplinary Process
events.venue: Te Awe Awe Street Palmerston North, Manawatū-Whanganui
events.description:
This course will cover how to effectively manage the disciplinary process.
This is where the disciplinary process followed has resulted in the employee taking personal grievance action, claiming they have been unjustifiably dismissed or disadvantaged.
Key audience: This course is suitable for HR practitioners and managers who are responsible for the disciplinary process in their organisations.
Learning outcomes Understand procedural fairness and justifiable reasons for initiating disciplinary action.
Improve supporting documentation such as letter-writing, note-taking and investigative materials.

events.venue: Utauta Street Waikanae, Wellington
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.

events.id: Electra Business After Five - 21 August 2025-10 Bath Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Electra Business After Five - 21 August 2025
events.venue: 10 Bath Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We're delighted to welcome Jerry Shearman from Central Economic Development Agency (CEDA) which connects people, place and business in Manawatū. 
 
Jerry, a former scientist with a passion for data and insights, believes strongly in evidence-based decision-making.  With over 15 years’ experience in senior leadership roles within the tertiary education sector, Jerry brings a wealth of expertise in strategic thinking, stakeholder engagement, and turning vision into action, as evidenced by some of the exciting things happening in the area which Jerry will share with us. 
 
Join us for an evening of insight and inspiration and hear one of the region’s most dedicated leaders talk about: 
Te Utanganui - designed to be New Zealand's third major distribution hub, complementing the Golden Triangle (Auckland-Hamilton-Tauranga) and the Christchurch-Rolleston node. Te Utanganui is a transformative multi-modal logistics and distribution hub located in Palmerston North, it serves as a vital link in the national freight network currently going through transformational changes connecting road, rail, air, and sea transport systems. 
Manawatū Regional Food Strategy, our Land Diversification initiative and the complementary capability between regions
Regional NZ - the need to work together, shared populations, future growth plans
Electra Business After Five
Thursday 21st August 2025  
5.30-7pm $10+bf
Te Takeretanga o Kura-hau-pō, Levin

events.id: Social Media Marketing for Small Enterprises: Visual Impact-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Social Media Marketing for Small Enterprises: Visual Impact
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Social Media Marketing for Small Enterprises: Visual Impact Whether you are just starting out or already running a business, having an online and social media presence is essential.
While most of us know in theory that we need a marketing plan, a social media strategy, a consistent post schedule, and engaging reels for TikTok, the reality is that every business is unique, and your approach should reflect that.
With attention spans shorter than ever, your audience will move on within seconds if they are not engaged—they see images first and then only start reading the text.
In this course, we will explore different types of content suitable for your specific needs and audiences, how to create it or where to source it, how to develop the right visual strategy for your online presence, what tools to use, and how to implement it immediately.
By the end of the course, you will have an outstanding online presence.

While most of us know in theory that we need a marketing plan, a social media strategy, a consistent post schedule, and engaging reels for TikTok, the reality is that every business is unique, and your approach should reflect that.
In this course, we will explore different types of content suitable for your specific needs and audiences, how to create it or where to source it, how to develop the right visual strategy for your online presence, what tools to use, and how to implement it immediately.
By the end of the course, you will have an outstanding online presence.

events.id: Sing Sing Film Fundraiser - Arts in Corrections Network-29 Wigan Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Sing Sing Film Fundraiser - Arts in Corrections Network
events.venue: 29 Wigan Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join Arts Access Aotearoa for a powerful evening of film and purpose as we screen the critically acclaimed movie Sing Sing — based on a true story of redemption, creativity and the transformative power of the arts within the prison system.
Sing Sing tells the story of incarcerated men who find hope and humanity through a prison theatre programme. It reflects the values Arts Access Aotearoa upholds: that the arts can break down walls, build confidence and create change, inside and out.
Tickets are $25 and proceeds support the Arts in Corrections Network.
Before the screening, you will hear from actor, playwright and musician Jamie McCaskill (of the Māori Sidesteps musical comedy group), and playwright and columnist Dave Armstrong. Together, they led a powerful theatre and storytelling course at Whanganui Prison, supporting and transformation behind the wire.
Come along and support us to continue this important work.
About Arts in Corrections
Arts programmes in prisons can be powerful pathways to healing and change. They help people restore their sense of identity, build resilience and develop skills that support rehabilitation and reintegration into the community. By nurturing creative potential and cultural identity these programmes foster personal transformation.
Arts Access Aotearoa leads a national network that supports Corrections staff and community educators and groups to design and deliver meaningful arts programmes in prisons and Community Corrections..

events.id: Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt
If you hear rejection when someone says "no" to you, or if you struggle to say "no" even when you want to - this workshop is for you.
Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket! Stay back to continue the connects over a nourishing meal.


In this workshop based on Nonviolent Communication (NVC) you will discover how to listen to feelings and needs that sit behind the "no" and how to connect to what truly matters to yourself and others. You will get to know some foundational tools of NVC, and practice on examples from real life. This session is interactive, and you will walk away with some understanding of NVC processes and materials to practice in your own time.


You will discover:
what stops you from saying "no" when you really want to
how to connect to what matters (to you and others) and find the needs behind the "no"
how to listen for needs, rather than look for conflict


Meet Helen & Anna, your hosts
Anna Banaś and Helen Williams are passionate, down-to-earth facilitators who bring warmth, depth, and a wealth of experience to their work in Nonviolent Communication (NVC). Anna is undertaking certification as an NVC trainer, a sociolinguist, and skilled group facilitator who has spent nearly 20 years supporting families, organisations, and communities to communicate with more clarity and compassion. Helen brings a rich blend of experience as a mindfulness teacher, mediator, coach, and yoga practitioner. Together, Anna and Helen create a safe, engaging, and supportive space where learning feels both empowering and nourishing. Whether you’re completely new to NVC or looking to deepen your practice, you’ll be in very good hands.
................................................................................................
Booking for Thursday is recommended!
For more details and to book please go here--
https://bit.ly/eventTickets

1/175 Vivian Street
Wellington

events.long_description:
Reiki Infused Sound Healing
Sink into a meditative sanctuary of stillness with Nizaad — a healing energy practitioner and space holder rooted in ancestral wisdom, sound, and ceremony.
Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert after the event - all included in your ticket!
This deeply calming experience weaves Reiki energy with the vibrational medicine of chakra-attuned crystal singing bowls, offering a journey inward through sound and sensation.
Held in a Reiki-activated field, it invites you to rest the body, quiet the mind, and shift brainwaves into a deeply relaxed state, supporting nervous system regulation and emotional balance.
Come as you are. Let the sound carry you into stillness, and the energy bring gentle release.
Mats, eye masks and pillows are provided but you are invited to bring anything extra to add comfort!
Meet Nizaad, your host
Nizaad holding a Reiki-infused Sound Journey designed to support deep rest and realignment. Blending the healing frequencies of crystal singing bowls alongside other sacred instruments, her sessions are rooted in the belief that sound and energy are medicine. Coming from a lineage of energy healers, she weaves gentle Reiki throughout the session to support subtle energetic balance and emotional release. Participants simply need to lie down and allow the sound and energy to wash over them, inviting a calm, restorative space to reconnect with the body and return to balance.

events.name: Fermented Quiz Night (Brewtown)
events.venue: 27 Blenheim Street, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Every Thursday fortnight is quiz night at one of Upper Hutt's best venues - Fermented at Brewtown!
Hosted by Sam from Gee Quiz and kicking off at 6.30pm, the quiz offers five rounds of trivia that's not too hard, not too easy, but includes content that relates to you and your crew!
So if you've got some street smarts, a good attitude, and a dash of luck, you'll be a good chance on the night. Add to the mix some bonus games, great food & drink, a stack of prizes, great banter and laughs aplenty, it's the place to be on a Thursday for a rollicking good time!
We advise booking in your team here, specifying you are coming to quiz night: https://fermented.co.nz/reservations

events.venue: Utauta Street Waikanae, Wellington
events.description:

Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.

By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Saluti e baci! A Taste of Sicily-Tonic Bistro, 8 Kitchener Street, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Saluti e baci! A Taste of Sicily
events.venue: Tonic Bistro, 8 Kitchener Street, Martinborough
events.description:
An evening of Sicilian wine and tapas with Tonic and Lucas Monge of Del Mundo Imports.
Since 1851, five generations of the Rallo family have produced some of Sicily’s finest wines at their Donnfugata winery.
In recent years they have innovated winemaking and sustainability practices on the island while showcasing traditional varietals such as Nero D’Avola, Grillo and Zebibbo.
Join Tonic and Del Mundo’s Lucas Monge for an exploration of Sicily via wine and antipasti/dessert pairings.
Thursday, 21 August, 6:30pm Registration via Tonic’s website.

Brace yourself for an evening dripping with glamour, sparkle, and a whole lot of cheek as you soak in the skyline of Wellington's most unique rooftop hideaway
DIRTY LITTLE SECRET!
Slip into something fabulous, grab your favorite drink, and get ready for an extravagant night of DRAG BINGO! We've got cocktails that'll make you blush, and more laughs than you can shake a feather boa at!
Expect live drag performances to make your heart race, dad jokes that'll have you in stitches, and beats from our fabulous local DJs that'll keep you moving all night long! Book your table for 7.00pm, balls dropping 7.30 at the latest!

Oh, why not order some our epic drink and kai specials!

events.venue: 26 Constable Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Another year, more offerings from the heart.
For over four years, Sam and I have been weaving and holding space—bringing our gifts into places that seed new ways of being together, in connection, with love, and with fresh beginnings.
This time, we return to facilitate a dreamscape of sound and story.
A space to meet yourself in stillness and curiosity.
Together, we’ll weave a world of story and voice—a space to heal, to remember, and to meet both your shadows and your light.
Think of it as a meditation, similar to Yoga Nidra, but with our unique touch.

events.id: Awesome Astro: A practical introduction to night sky photography-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Awesome Astro: A practical introduction to night sky photography
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Learn how to photograph the night sky with this three-part workshop.
Always wanted to capture the Milky Way but don't know where to start? Or you've tried and the results haven't been amazing?
We've designed this workshop for beginner astro photographers: to take you from zero astro knowledge to being able to capture at least one awesome astro photo to impress friends and family.
Wellington-based astro and landscape photographer Chris McKeown, and supported by Sony Advocate Rebecca McMillan, will guide you through what's required to plan, shoot, and process stunning images of the incredible night sky in Wellington.
We will start with an online introductory tutorial briefing on Sunday 17th August (evening), to discuss settings and camera gear, answer questions and confirm the meetup location for the Thursday evening workshop.
On Thursday 21 August we will meet from 7.30pm on Wellington's South Coast to capture the night sky. (A rain check date will be advised if required, and we have pencilled Friday 22 August). The following evening we will host an online tutorial to demonstrate how to process your images, with time for Q&A.
We also have the opportunity to access Sony cameras for the workshop: please get in touch with the organisers at least two weeks ahead of the event if you would like to borrow gear for this workshop.
This is a ticketed workshop via Sony Scene.
events.description:

events.id: Sachi | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Sachi | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
One of New Zealand's most celebrated live acts, dance music duo SACHI have today announced two shows across Pōneke and Tāmaki Makaurau.
Tickets for SACHI’s shows in Wellington and Auckland will be available to purchase by the General Public on Tuesday, July 15 at 12pm local time.
My Live Nation members will also be able to secure tickets during the presale which commences on Monday, July 14 at 1pm until Tuesday, July 15 at 11am local time.
Fans can register for access at livenation.co.nz.
Each of the EPs’ title characters represents a different phase of SACHI’s discography — from their introduction on Lunch With Bianca, to establishing themselves internationally on Nights With Ruby (created while living in LA pre-pandemic), to the full-circle evolution of their most refined and lustrous body of work to date, Breakfast With Ella.

events.id: The Wedding Trio-The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Wedding Trio
events.venue: The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Way back in January 2023, Jake, Dan and Mark formed an instant rapport on the bandstand of a garden party.
With a nod to famous saxophone trios such as the Sonny Rollins band of A Night at the Village Vanguard and Lee Konitz' Motion, The Wedding Trio reinterprets classic jazz standards and original compositions by Jake Baxendale, utilising the space afforded by the absence of a chordal instrument to investigate groove, polyphony and interaction, all in the spirit of freewheeling, rambunctious fun that any good wedding party will conjure up!

events.id: Textiles and Queerness in a NZ Film! Went Up The Hill at NZIFF Wellington-10 Kent Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Textiles and Queerness in a NZ Film! Went Up The Hill at NZIFF Wellington
events.venue: 10 Kent Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
Hi queer friends who love crafts-have I got the film for you! NZ feature film Went Up The Hill will have its Wellington Premiere at the NZ International Film Festival on 21 August at the Embassy at 830pm-get your ticket now!
Come along and be amongst the first to see NZ feature film Went Up The Hill from queer NZ filmmaker Sam Van Grinsven.
Tickets to the Wellington screening are available for $26 at the NZIFF website:
https://www.nziff.co.nz/.../te.../went-up-the-hill/
The film is also screening at NZIFF in centres around the country including Auckland, Christchurch, Dunedin amongst others!
Shot in Canterbury and funded by the NZ Film Commission, the film stars Vicky Krieps (The Phantom Thread) and Dacre Montgomery (Stranger Things) in a poetic ghost story that centres on two queer characters-a woman and her dead wife’s estranged son -as they are each haunted by her spirit. The film premiered to critical acclaim as a Special Presentation at Toronto Film Festival in 2024 where Sam was hailed by Hollywood Reporter as already having the ‘control of a master’ in a film that is ‘captivating', ‘elliptical' and 'technically stunning’.
Sam Van Grinsven has a passion for queer interpretation of genre and seeing queer characters within spaces that historically have not been explored as diversely.
Here's the trailer link-we hope you can join us!

events.name: LHPC Antenatal Class 8 2025
events.venue: 12 Britannia Street Lower Hutt, Wellington 5012
events.description:
Lower Hutt Parents Centre ispart of a national voluntary-led, not-for-profit organisation who provide high quality ChildbirthEducation Classes (Antenatal Classes), Baby & You Classes and other Parent EducationClasses for Hutt Valley families.
We are here to help.
Our comprehensive Antenatal Classes lead by qualified Childbirth Educators will help you prepare for labour, birth and the early days with a newborn.
From time to time a 'weekend intensive' course which runs for two full days is held on consecutive Saturdays.
Courses cost $220 (including booking fee) The course covers: • Nutrition and exercise during pregnancy • Labour signs and stagesWe • Pain relief options and interventions • The birth process • Breastfeeding and newborn care • Transition to Parenthood and practical parenting • A tour of Hutt Hospital maternity unit, either physical or virtual tour We encourage you to enrol early to ensure you get a spot.

events.id: Beervana-Sky Stadium, 105 Waterloo Qy-WOAP
events.name: Beervana
events.venue: Sky Stadium, 105 Waterloo Qy
events.long_description:
New Zealand’s boldest, hoppiest, and most delightfully weird beer festival. This is no ordinary tasting event, it’s a full-blown sensory adventure where brewers go wild, food gets fancy, and the unexpected is always on tap. 

Expect more than 60 breweries pouring over 300 unique brews—from hazy IPAs and fruited sours to beer cocktails and non-alcoholic surprises. 

But Beervana isn’t just about the beer. It’s a feast for all senses: think whitebait fritters from Boulcott St Bistro, Korean fried chicken, Mahurangi oysters. Add in live music, quirky brewery stands (yes, there’s a Best Stand vote), and unexpected entertainment and you’ve got a festival that you'll come away from with a greater knowledge of great beer, a belly full and plenty of fun memories with your mates.

events.id: 96 Originals-Logan Brown Restaurant, 192 Cuba St-WOAP
events.name: 96 Originals
events.venue: Logan Brown Restaurant, 192 Cuba St
events.long_description:
Celebrate a quarter-century of culinary excellence at Logan Brown’s 29th anniversary lunch, where the past meets the present in a delicious fusion of food and stories. Join Steve Logan and Shaun Clouston, alongside original Logan Brown team members Francois Febvre (La Cloche) and Shepherd Elliott (previously of Ti Kouka, Leeds Street Bakery, Shepherd, Concord and The Test Kitchen), for a special afternoon filled with fantastic kai and plenty of memories.

As the doors of Logan Brown first opened in 1996, it quickly became one of Wellington’s most beloved dining destinations. Now, this unforgettable event offers a chance to reminisce with the chefs who helped shape the restaurant’s legacy, sharing tales from the early days while serving up a feast of flavours inspired by their storied careers.

For any longtime Logan Brown fan or someone curious to the whakapapa of Wellington food, this is a celebration of the friendships, milestones, and moments that have defined one of New Zealand’s most iconic dining experiences. Expect a menu that reflects Logan Brown’s rich history, prepared with passion and paired with great conversation, laughter, and a few tall tales.

events.id: DILLI-24-Loretta, 181 Cuba Street-WOAP
events.name: DILLI-24
events.venue: Loretta, 181 Cuba Street
events.long_description:
A North Indian feast crafted by long-time Loretta head chef Chandrika Khullar.
Named after her hometown of Delhi and her home postcode, this special menu is a deeply personal tribute to her upbringing and a childhood immersed in the rich culinary traditions of North India. Chandrika brings the heart and soul of Delhi to Wellington with a generous, share-style multi-course menu featuring bountiful vegetarian plates and an exceptional lamb raan.

Expect an explosion of flavour, with exotic spice blends, saffron, citrus and native berries woven into every dish. In North India, condiment is king, and this feast will be served with a vibrant array of chutneys, pickles and relishes. To complete the experience, Chandrika has also designed a beautifully curated drinks menu to complement the bold and fragrant dishes.

events.id: 2025 Big Breakfast & Charity Auction for Big Brothers Big Sisters-42 Udy Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: 2025 Big Breakfast & Charity Auction for Big Brothers Big Sisters
events.venue: 42 Udy Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand
events.description:
Join Big Brothers Big Sisters of Wellington and Guest Speaker Glen Denham on Friday 22 August at the Petone Club, Udy Street, Petone for a delicious buffet breakfast, exciting live auction, raffles and more!
Glen Denham is the Principal of Wellington College, where he channels his lifelong passion for teaching and school leadership.
Before transitioning into teaching, Glen was a national basketball player, earning a spot as a Tall Black for 16 years during the 1980s and 1990s.
As team captain for 13 of those years, he was regarded as one of New Zealand’s top players and a key figure in the country's basketball legacy.
His journey from professional athlete to educator has shaped his dynamic leadership style, blending discipline, resilience, and teamwork with a deep commitment to nurturing youth.

events.name: Skill Share: Home Automation with Home Assistant
events.venue: Level 1, 33 Arthur Street, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand
events.description:
Build your own smart home—no experience needed.
Curious about automating lights, sensors, or heating in your whare?
Heard of Home Assistant but not sure where to start?
This hands-on skill share is for beginners, hobbyists, and time-poor tech lovers who want to learn the ropes without the overwhelm.
We’ll explore: How to set up Home Assistant and connect it to your devices ESP32 boards, Shelly WiFi switches, and basic sensors DIY tips for automating heating, lighting, and more Real-world setups that actually work in Aotearoa homes How to maintain (or improve) the all-important WAF Bring your questions, projects, or a sense of curiosity.

events.id: It's in the Ballot - HDC – Waiopehu General Ward-In-studio- Bath Street Levin, Manawatū-Whanganui Region-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - HDC – Waiopehu General Ward-In-studio
events.venue: Bath Street Levin, Manawatū-Whanganui Region
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: DEBRA NZ Conference and Family Camp 2025-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: DEBRA NZ Conference and Family Camp 2025
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Kia ora DEBRA New Zealand whanau !
Save the dates - DEBRA NZ Conference and Family Camp, Wellington, Friday 22 - Sunday 24 August 2025.
We are very happy to announce that we are planning a get-together for the NZ EB whanau and a few Aussie families in Wellington in August. We really hope you can join us - it will be wonderful to see you!
This event is a great opportunity to meet other families, connect with old friends and make wonderful new ones, learn from each other and from valuable talks about EB issues, and have time to relax and enjoy a couple of days in Wellington city - the creative capital! We're keen to hear about any particular topics you would like to hear about.
Everyone is welcome including extended family and friends, caregivers, and healthcare professionals.
Dates: Friday 22nd August (check-in from 3pm with informal meet and greet from 5.00pm), to Sunday 24th August (finishing 2pm after a farewell lunch)
Event location: Wellington City, venue to be confirmed
Registration will be launched in early May - please stay tuned for further details!
Your registration fee will cover the conference, meals and children’s activities from Friday evening to Sunday lunch time, but it does not cover accommodation (amount to be confirmed), travel or airport transfers.
DEBRA NZ will provide some limited assistance with accommodation and travel costs if needed, subsiding flights for the person attending with EB.
Please contact debra@debra.org.nz if you would like to apply for this support.
There will be more information soon.
We need an idea of numbers so please get in touch as soon as possible!
Email: debra@debra.org.nz with any questions and let us know if you are interested in attending.
Nga mihi nui,
Anna, Lea and the DEBRA NZ team
debra@debra.org.nz

events.long_description:
Join us at the VBC Upstairs Bar, 5pm Friday 22 to see the splatty, wild fruits of our August RUCKUS!
RUCKUS is Barbarian Productions’ creative practice week for independent artists at our home, the Vogelmorn Bowling Club. We celebrate the messy nature of creative live performance and give participants a warm, fun, community-centric space to work on their ideas.

Bring your mates!!!!

events.id: 2025 Poetry Competition | Open mic poetry night-Iver Trask place, Paraparaumu, Paraparaumu-Facebook
events.name: 2025 Poetry Competition | Open mic poetry night
events.venue: Iver Trask place, Paraparaumu, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
It’s not Tomorrow | Āpōpō yet, but it will be soon. Our libraries are celebrating Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day with an Open Mic Night at Paraparaumu Library.
This year we received 219 poems for our annual ‘If you’re a poet we want to know it’ competition and we'll be announcing the winners at the event. You'll also be able to purchase your very own copy of the 2025 print edition of Tomorrow | Āpōpō, an anthology of poetry entered in this year's competition.
Come along to share a poem or simply enjoy the lyrical lines penned by our local poets at this friendly and inclusive event.

events.id: Unity Night-15 Dufferin Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Unity Night
events.venue: 15 Dufferin Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Unity Night is a special evening dedicated to bringing our school community together in a shared celebration of the diverse identities, talents, and stories that make us who we are.
It’s a chance to pause, reflect, and enjoy an evening of entertainment, connection, and cultural pride.
The night will showcase a range of student performances, from music and dance to spoken word and cultural expression, offering a platform for students to share their voices, heritage, and creativity in front of their peers, families, and teachers.
Midway through the evening, guests will have the opportunity to take part in a karaoke session, an open, fun-filled space where anyone can step up and sing, laugh, and join in.
Whether you're there to support a friend, enjoy the performances, or take in the vibe, Unity Night promises to be a warm and memorable occasion.

events.id: The Kava Experience-20 Parumoana Street, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Kava Experience
events.venue: 20 Parumoana Street, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Bula Vinaka and Welcome to Kava Culture, New Zealand’s newest destination for authentic Fijian Kava!
We are thrilled to invite you to another relaxing Kava Experience night. Whether you're a curious newcomer or a seasoned kava enthusiast, our dedicated team will warmly guide you through every step of this unique journey.
At Kava Culture, we offer a premium, traditionally brewed kava experience designed for wellness-focused individuals seeking natural relaxation. We pride ourselves on sourcing our kava directly from small Pacific Island farms, ensuring unparalleled quality and authenticity.
Immerse yourself in the rich traditions of the Pacific as you enjoy our exquisite kava in our calm, serene location at Kaitahi, beautifully illuminated by ambient lights. This is more than just a drink; it's an opportunity to connect with others, promote genuine stress relief, and celebrate ancient island culture with modern comfort.
Join us for a night filled with community, connection, and tranquility. Let Kava Culture transport you – no passport required!
Choose your journey:
* Mini Experience: $30 (1.5 hours)
* Full Experience: $50 (3 hours)
We can’t wait to welcome you!

events.id: Glow in the dark titiwai tours - New Zealand glow worms-Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Glow in the dark titiwai tours - New Zealand glow worms
events.venue: Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A fascinating tour into the world of titiwai, New Zealand's glow worms, in Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā. This outdoor night-time tour takes about an hour, and all are welcome to join. If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 7 years and older.
Meet at the Founders’ entrance to Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā on Glenmore Street. Please bring your ticket, a torch, and an umbrella if it’s raining. We'll see you there!
This tour is operated by the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden.
Glow Worm Tour Ticket Refund Policy
• No Refunds: We do not offer refunds for Glow Worm Tour tickets.
• Ticket Transfers: If you can’t attend your booked tour, we will put you on a future tour, subject to availability. Please contact us as soon as possible to arrange this.
• Weather Conditions: Tours operate rain or shine. In the event of extreme weather or unsafe conditions, we will reschedule your tour or provide a refund.
For any changes or enquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at Treehouse@wcc.govt.nz or call 04 499 1400.
events.description:

events.venue: Old St Paul's, Wellington
events.description:
Wellington’s iconic Old St Paul’s (OSP) will play host to a transcendent new series in August, partnering with the Pyramid Club to present Altared States, a unique electronic music experience.
This series will immerse attendees in soundscapes that transcend the ordinary, offering a chance to disconnect for a moment from the modern world.
About the Artists Ludus is the captivating musical venture curated by Emma Bernard.
Stephen Gallagher is an Emmy award-winning composer and music editor who has worked on an extensive range of projects, from global blockbusters to television and contemporary dance.
It’s in that space of beholding where transformation and connection occur, and Chambers is a master alchemist, likening that stretch of attention in music to growing a garden: “There’s a lot of searching, reaching and eventual blossoming in my music – it feels like coming up from underground, like a tulip bulb.” About the Venue Built in 1866, Old St Paul’s is a prime example of timber Gothic Revival architecture and one of Aotearoa’s most important historic places.

events.long_description:
Friday Laughs is a two hour comedy showcase of some top Kiwi talent, right in the heart of Wellington.
With headline act, Kura Forrester
Kura Forrester is an actor, writer and comedian, a face you have definitely seen on the telly including Kiwi shows such as: Golden Boy, Shortland Street, Super City and The Adventures of Suzy Boon.
Winner of the 2019 Billy T Award, Kura is fast becoming one of the standout comedian actors of New Zealand.
And MC Lesa Macleod-Whiting - 2025 Billy T Award nominee
Lesa is a Wellington-based writer, improviser and comedian. She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest. She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.
Winner – Best Newcomer – 2020 Wellington Comedy Awards Nominated – Best Newcomer (Lower North Island) – 2020 NZ Comedy Guild Awards
Along with
Sandy Burton
Alayne Dick
Leki Lyons
and Mike Fowler

The Undercurrent presents Tarns Hood: Poetry Showcase

Tarns Hood has been performing poetry in Pōneke for a decade!

With 4 showings at NZ Poetry Slam, including 2nd best slammer in 2017, then back to back Wellington Poetry Slam Champ 2019/2020 and most recently 2024 Wgtn Poetry Slam runner up, come and see this non-published, residency rejected Performance poet peel off a set of collected, memorized and animated pieces.

If you've never witnessed what Tarns can do, join us on National Poetry Days' Poetry Night!

Friday August 22nd
Doors 8pm/ Gig 8:30pm
$10 entry online & on the door

Complimentary snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

events.id: Body Ocean-Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Body Ocean
events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Body Ocean, a dynamic force in the realm of electronic music, specialises in crafting immersive and kinetic house music. Their sonic journey explores the interplay between organic and artificial elements, navigating contrasts between personality and dissolution, as well as the push and pull of extraversion and introspection.

With an impressive catalogue of releases on influential labels such as Size, Black Book Records, Mad Decent, Dirtybird, Box of Cats, and STMPD RCRDS, Body Ocean has firmly established themselves as a notable presence in the electronic music scene. They've also left a lasting mark with remixes for acclaimed artists including Steve Angello, Valentino Khan, Alison Wonderland, Ane Brun, and Mija.

Their commitment to pushing sonic boundaries and exploring diverse musical dimensions sets them apart — fuelling a growing reputation as innovators within the industry.

As they gear up for 2024, Body Ocean is poised to captivate dancefloors with a compelling fusion of sound and a vision that looks firmly to the future of electronic music.

Catch Body Ocean live at Meow on Friday 22nd August — support to be announced.

events.id: Lunch Speaker Series-Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln-WOAP
events.name: Lunch Speaker Series
events.venue: Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln
events.long_description:
Noble Rot invites you to enjoy a relaxed lunch in style. While away your afternoon with a leisurely three-course menu as they keep the wine flowing amongst you and your friends. They've lined up two incredible guest speakers at the forefront of the wine industry to entertain you with their stories, knowledge and insights into current trends in a relaxed but intimate atmosphere. You'll wish all learning was done this way. It’s the perfect excuse to treat your friends, your mum or your date.
 
Guest Speakers & Dates:

Saturday 9th — ‘Small Region, Big Sky’
Katherine Jacobs and her husband Jeremy embarked on a dream to produce some of Martinborough’s finest wines from their special vineyard in Te Muna, and they’ve achieved great success! Katherine will speak about upcoming trends, big dreams and hidden secrets in our favourite region’s wine scene.
 
Saturday 23rd — ‘A Rosie Afternoon’ 
Enjoy the company of Rosie Finn of Neudorf Vineyards, second generation of one of New Zealand's most prestigious wineries in Nelson. You’ll have the opportunity to ask Rosie all about current trends as she combines the story of her family winery’s historic roots and its impact on the landscape of New Zealand fine wines.

events.id: The Napier Escape-Paekakariki-Facebook
events.name: The Napier Escape
events.venue: Paekakariki
events.long_description:
Saturday 23rd August 2025 – Learn, Indulge or Explore in Napier
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options.
A Deco Deep Dive
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.

Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options. Choose from the following to enhance your day:
A Deco Deep Dive
The City’s Art Deco heritage is a defining feature of the city, shaped by a remarkable chapter in its history. After a devastating earthquake in 1931 levelled much of the city, Napier was rebuilt in the architectural style of the time—Art Deco.
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
Sip, Savour, and Soak in the Views
Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.
Crab Farm Winery was established in the early 1980’s with the first vintage under the Crab Farm Winery label released in 1987. The land at Crab Farm has been in the Jardine family for over 100 years. Originally purchased without viewing beforehand – Hamish Jardine’s great grandfather was alarmed to find his new land was actually partially underwater. With tidal pools, rushes and hundreds of Crabs, the family jokingly named it ‘Crab Farm’.
Napier at your Leisure
Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace. Wander among world-famous Art Deco buildings, stroll the scenic Marine Parade, or relax at a local café with a Hawke’s Bay treat. Visit MTG Hawke’s Bay for a dose of culture, browse boutique shops, or admire the colourful street art. It’s your chance to soak up Napier’s unique charm your way.
For all timetable, pricing & more information - head to www.steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/the-napier-escape/
events.description:
Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Choose from the following to enhance your day: A Deco Deep Dive The City’s Art Deco heritage is a defining feature of the city, shaped by a remarkable chapter in its history.
The land at Crab Farm has been in the Jardine family for over 100 years.

events.id: Michelin Star to Martinborough-Union Square, 10 Memorial Square-WOAP
events.name: Michelin Star to Martinborough
events.venue: Union Square, 10 Memorial Square
events.long_description:
Join celebrated Chef and Union Square owner Adam Newell for a once-in-a-lifetime culinary experience. Take a journey through four decades of his exceptional career, including his Michelin-starred tenure at the renowned Fulham Road Restaurant in London. This exclusive event will offer an intimate exploration of Chef Newell's evolution as a chef and restaurateur, showcasing iconic dishes from four pivotal periods in his career.

Set in the elegant Napoleon dining room inside the historic Martinborough Hotel, each course represents a defining moment in Chef Newell’s career. Paired with fine wines selected by in-house Sommelier Carl Fraser, this evening is designed to be a feast for both the palate and the mind.

Course 1: 1980s – Claridge’s Hotel, London
A taste of the refined sophistication from one of London’s most prestigious hotels.
Course 2: 1990s – Le Gavroche, London
A nod to the classic French techniques that helped shape Chef Newell's early career.
Course 3: 2000s – Zibibbo, Wellington
A celebration of New Zealand’s finest ingredients and a significant step in his culinary journey.
Course 4: 2010s – Union Square Bistro, Martinborough
Reflecting his achievements at Union Square, the course that represents his current culinary vision.

This evening offers guests a unique chance to experience the evolution of one chef's journey through extraordinary dishes paired with wines that elevate each moment.

events.id: Feed Your Senses-Foxglove Bar & Kitchen, 33 Queens Wharf-WOAP
events.name: Feed Your Senses
events.venue: Foxglove Bar & Kitchen, 33 Queens Wharf
events.long_description:
Step into an immersive experience where nature’s core elements — stone, clay, wood, water, fire, and air — are brought to life through a dynamic fusion of artistic mediums. Explore interactive installations and captivating performances that engage all of your senses with visual art, sculpture, sound, and more. Throughout the evening, enjoy six unique canapés and six meticulously crafted drinks, each inspired by the work of a different artist. Each exhibit reflects the raw power and beauty of the natural world, as local artists push boundaries to bring these elements to life in real-time.

As you journey through Foxglove’s Secret Wardrobe, you'll be surrounded by live artistry unfolding around you, creating an environment filled with raw creativity and vibrant energy. Aphrodisiac-inspired canapés and expertly paired beverages complement the visual experience, bringing each artist’s medium to life while celebrating Wellington’s rich and diverse creative community.

This culinary and sensory pairing will transport you deeper into the world of artistry, blending food and creativity in unexpected and delightful ways.

This event goes beyond simple exhibition — it’s a celebration of Wellington's local talent where the boundaries between food, art, and sensory experience are beautifully blurred. Whether you’re an art aficionado or a culinary enthusiast, this immersive experience promises to engage your senses in an unforgettable way.

Leathercraft classes are running right through to December. If you've always wanted to try your hand at making something out of leather, but didn't know how, this is your chance. 23 August : Beginner Workshop

11 Oct : Advanced Workshop
15 Nov : Beginner Workshop

How to book your spot:
Go to www.theleathery.co.nz
You will be able to choose your preferred date and purchase your spot.
Gift vouchers are available.

We look forward to assisting you in creating your masterpiece!.

events.id: NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series- 2025 Round 4 - Faultline Wellington-192 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series- 2025 Round 4 - Faultline Wellington
events.venue: 192 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Get your gains in the capital for the NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series grand finale. NiBS at Faultline in 2024 was the biggest climbing event ever in NZ so don’t miss out.
The NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series is all about having fun and giving it a go! Whether it’s your first climbing competition or you're a seasoned pro, you'll find challenges suited to your skill and confidence level, all within a friendly and supportive atmosphere.
Once the self-scored main rounds are done, the top 6 ranked female and male competitors in the open category advance to the finals. This is where the energy and music volume ramp up and we get to witness some incredible climbing from the best in the game.
Summary of Changes in 2025
- New online registration and scoring platform
- Scoring change, points awarded to each boulder divided by the number of successful tops
- Age group changes to reflect IFSC categories
- Finals format updated to 2025 IFSC Boulder rules
- Youth round (U11, U13, and U15 and caregivers) on Sunday morning
Please read the rules and info page below for more details on the changes: https://www.nibs.nz/rules-and-info
Don't forget to unleash your creative genius and set your own route using our amazing new logo! Try it here:
https://www.nibs.nz/routesetter

Come on down and spend some time viewing the art located on the lower ground of the Johnsonville library at Waitohi.

events.id: COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish-100 Tinakori Road Wellington, Wellington 6011-Event Brite
events.name: COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish
events.venue: 100 Tinakori Road Wellington, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
Join us for a relaxed, hands-on workshop where you'll create your very own ceramic butter dish in a working pottery studio. Over two inspiring hours, you'll learn the basics of hand-building with clay, guided step-by-step by a ceramic artist.
Enjoy fresh coffee and a home-baked morning tea as you get creative with shaping, decorating, and embellishing your piece. You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we'll take care of the firing process. Your finished butter dish will be ready to collect approximately four weeks later.
This small group workshop is perfect for absolute beginners—no experience needed. Come solo and meet like-minded creatives, or bring a friend for a fun and mindful morning.
You’ll be amazed at how calming it is to get out of your head and into your hands!

events.id: Mahi Ready Day-7 Colombo St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Mahi Ready Day
events.venue: 7 Colombo St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Are you job hunting at the moment? Are you fixing up your CV and not sure where to start?
Come along to Mahi Ready Day: A friendly, supportive, community-led event to help you build confidence and practical tools for finding work.
You can drop in any time between 10am and 2pm to chat with one of our helpful facilitators, or listen to a talk about career prepared-ness.
Everyone is welcome!
Timebank members can pay using time credits, and everyone else is welcome to contribute koha.
Workshops & stalls including (keep an eye on this event for more updates and a full programme!)
CV & Cover Letter help
Practice interviews
LinkedIn headshots
Style and clothing advice
Employment red flags to look out for
Online and tech support
Here's what's on (+more to be announced)
Here are some examples of what's on:
10:30am - 11.15am - Talk: Showcasing Your Strengths: Turning Skills and Experience into Employment
Job hunting can feel overwhelming, especially in this very tough market. This will be a relaxed, mana enhancing, practical session where you can ask questions in a safe environment. Angelique has hired people for over 30 years and will share insider tips on how to write a good cover letter, what makes a CV stand out and how to prepare for interviews.
11:30am-12pm - Talk: Employment red flags
Dhilum from Community Law Wellington and Hutt Valley will lead this session on what to look out for when it comes to employment, in particular for people in ethnic and migrant communities - including discrimination, unpaid wages and visa precarity.
12:30pm-1.10pm - Making a Living as a Freelancer
Roger has been working 'portfolio' for many years and prefers the freedom that this style of work provides. He has run workshops & coached 00's of people working in this way originally under the NEWORK Centre banner. He will share some tricks on how to find work & also to juggle several roles simultaneously.
10-11am & 1-2pm - Professional Headshots
Need a new LinkedIn profile pic? Starting a public facing role? Setting up a portfolio? David will be offering professional headshots and can make you feel at ease while taking a great photo of you!
10am-2pm - CV & Cover Letter Support
Get some advice and support on how to make your job application stand out in a crowd.NB: Bring a paper copy of your CV and Cover Letter, or make sure you can access it through your email account on one of our laptops.
10am-2pm - Practice interviews
Come and practice your interview skills with Lisa - a friendly, supportive face with years of experience interviewing job candidates.

events.id: Threads & Treasures: Indigo Workshop + Market-Thunderpants HQ, 42 Naples St, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Threads & Treasures: Indigo Workshop + Market
events.venue: Thunderpants HQ, 42 Naples St, Martinborough
events.description:
Craft and recycle market including a drop in indigo dying business and other potential fabric design.
www.thunderpants.co.nz/ We’re a small, ethical, family-owned and operated company, based in the Wairarapa, producing New Zealand made cheeky goodness for your bum (and other areas) from regeneratively grown Australian cotton.
The Thunderpants story began in Nelson in 1995, when we were design students frustrated by irritating undies.
The challenge was on to create the ultimate comfy undie that wouldn’t go up your bum… Now, twenty years on, Thunderpants has grown to produce nearly 50,000 Thunderpants garments a year including kids clothes, swimwear, yoga pants, leggings, tops and camis.
Our focus has always been on producing underwear and clothing of exceptional quality and design using fun colourful prints and this ethos permeates all aspects of the clothing we produce.

events.description:
Kua raranga tahi tātou he whariki mō āpōpō Together we weave the mat for future generations Nau mai haere mai, all are welcome to attend Ōtari Raranga wānanga (classes).
- Three hour weaving class with experienced kaiako - Access to tools and harakeke - Harakeke is provided for your first two classes and then the tikanga is that you should hauhake (harvest) for yourself.
- If you are unable to harvest for class, we have a $20 ‘Please harvest for me’ option in addition to your ticket at least two days before class.
Important information - It is important that everyone turns up on time for karakia - At our discretion tickets are fully refundable or transferable - For tikanga purposes beginner ticket sales close two days before wānanga giving us time to hauhake (harvest) for you - If class numbers are too low, we may have to cancel (and will offer a refund or transfer) so please check your emails before class - We offer concession tickets for students, unwaged, seniors, and those with disabilities.
Teina - General - $25 Teina - Concession - $15 Teina - Koha - $7 Two Class Pass - Two back to back dates only: $50.00 Optional - ADD ON - Please harvest for me: $10 (10 rau only) after first two classes - 3 days notice required Note: Eventfinda fees apply Donations, Tax Credits and Corporate Gifting - We accept koha to support Ōtari Raranga Weavers via Shared Lines Trust.

events.id: A Woody Fruit-fest - Guided Walk-Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: A Woody Fruit-fest - Guided Walk
events.venue: Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
In this 60-minute downhill walk we will enjoy one of the legacies of Wellington’s previous summers, namely the large ‘smorgasbord’ of woody fruit structures. A close-up look at these structures will reveal a wide variety of mechanisms for fruit formation, protection, and dispersal.
Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.
This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: Dateline's Fundraising Extravaganza ft Ladyhawke DJ, French For Rabbits, Wiri Donna & more-92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Dateline's Fundraising Extravaganza ft Ladyhawke DJ, French For Rabbits, Wiri Donna & more
events.venue: 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Brace yourselves for the mini fest of Winter 2025.
Wellington’s stubborn driven indie-rocker’s, Dateline, are putting on one final show this year in a desperate effort to fundraise some money to get themselves on tour in September/October.
Since 2018 Dateline has existed in different iterations while bandleader Katie Everingham was located in different parts of Aotearoa. Settling in Te Whanganui-a-tara in 2022 gave Everingham the opportunity to grow Dateline into a well-oiled and rehearsed creative machine alongside musical geniuses Hikurangi Schaverien-Kaa, Phoebe Johnson and Reuben McDonald. Refining their song writing and live performance has helped the band produce an incredible and energetic live show that is ready to be taken on the road.
After being invited to support The Beths on tour through the UK, parts of Europe and Scandinavia the band knew that they had to grab the opportunity by the proverbial horns. They have most of the ingredients to make the experience happen and fruitful, bar one, money. Despite this they said yes to the invite and are now figuring out how to make the dream a reality.
The conundrum of how to fund the international 25 date tour led to the decision to frantically arrange a fundraising extravaganza at Meow Nui, thrown together in one month with minimal planning or time to adequately promote the gig! Fantastic! Due to the love and support of a lot of local legends who have volunteered themselves to participate, the fundraising scheme has morphed from a desperate idea into a desperate reality. Come along for one of the best evenings of entertainment you’ll witness all August.
As well as showcasing the songs they’ll be taking on the road, Dateline will be joined by talented musical acts such as Wiri Donna, French For Rabbits, Wellington's favourite saxophone playing tree - Woody, Dateband, Flute Journeys and Ladyhawke (DJ set). There will also be compelling performances from dance troupe BTD bitches and performance artists Twin Snag. This will be a night to remember.
Please for the love of god, buy a ticket, invite everyone you know and come to the show so I, I mean, Katie doesn’t bankrupt herself desperately clinging to the hopes of being a sometimes-touring musician.
Tickets available at Ticketek
events.description:
Brace yourselves for the mini fest of Winter 2025.
Wellington’s stubborn driven indie-rocker’s, Dateline, are putting on one final show this year in a desperate effort to fundraise some money to get themselves on tour in September/October.
Since 2018 Dateline has existed in different iterations while bandleader Katie Everingham was located in different parts of Aotearoa.
Despite this they said yes to the invite and are now figuring out how to make the dream a reality.
This will be a night to remember.

events.name: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga August 23rd of August
events.venue: 28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness.
Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc.. Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.
Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years.
He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer.

events.id: 5 And Still Live ! - The Fifth Anniversary of Mouthfull Radio-57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: 5 And Still Live ! - The Fifth Anniversary of Mouthfull Radio
events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
5 years of Mouthfull Radio


Half a decade ago, we were in the midst of a global pandemic, visiting digital rooms with friends around the corner, making sourdough, and watching the daily news. We were also making experimental attempts into the world of radio, with the birth of Mouthfull’s first international streaming server, playing music 24/7 (and live events a few times per week).
If we travel even further back in time, 2017 was the debut of the “Mouthfull Radio” episodic series (~20eps) - but we consider the ongoingness the real thing to celebrate.
Moving forwards into the presence now, and through an immense richness of events, music, zines, connections, pop ups, and storytime. It is a joy to make community contemporary radio !


5 Years goes so fast, and so we shall honour this time with a great celebration in the capital city of Aotearoa! We will bring together all of the elements of Mouthfull you have known to love; make some books, make up some new dance moves with friends, and make our ears glisten in the sounds of live and selected music.


Lineup:
*ºJuniper May
*ºStar Time
*ºajhoneysuckle (tāmaki)
*ºMystery Waitress
*ºDJ B.Lo (whākatu)
*°Benny Salvador *Just added*


We are also releasing our first ever compilation !!! And we will celebrate and commemorate by opening this event with a premiere listening session, playing the album all the way through. You can purchase a copy at the show or on bandcamp (preorders open August 1st).


This is a fundraiser to support the sustainability of Mouthfull. We are only able to pay the bills due to events like this, and are fundraising to support a long awaited update of our digital infrastructure to enable future support. THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT - you can support us by purchasing a ticket (extra donation if you are balling), a tshirt, a raffle ticket, or a zine - it all goes to the same goal of enabling each other.

events.id: Soup & Solidarity-13 Garrett St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Soup & Solidarity
events.venue: 13 Garrett St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for a relaxed, creative evening as craft solidarity books for both Ramallah (our sister city) and Gaza, to show our allyship from here in Aotearoa.
We’ll provide scrapbooking materials, but we encourage you to bring your own treasures. Items like stencils, photos, poems, and Aotearoa-inspired artwork are all welcome.
Join us to highlight shared culture through art, music, hopeful messages, and reflections on solidarity here at home.
This drop-in session continues the spirit of our Nakba Day gathering - connecting, reflecting, and expressing care. Expect warmth, soup, bread, tea, incense, beautiful music, and space to stay until late. This event is open to all ages.

events.venue: 172 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
S-ence returns to the Cuba St Tavern Courtyard with another lush audio offering for your mid-winter blues.
Two [Suite] Gallery Courtyard maestros that missed joining the Active Oasis at Cuba Dupa are back behind the S-ence decks.
Takas and Mish join Jen and Coda for a night of House, Nu Disco, Indie Dance, Techno and beyond.
Takas needs no introduction - this boy can play any where, any time, any how. It's going to be great to see him take the courtyard on an epic party journey as only Takas can.
Mish has graced the decks of S-ence and the Suite Courtyard and the Radio Active airwaves on the Housing Project and Late Late Breakfast Show. He's an old school and nu school house head, so get ready to dance.
Jen has been champing at the bit, having been DJing with the brakes on the last few sets. With a late set on the cards for this S-ence expect some heat!
Coda as usual will bring his bag of tricks to delight the dancefloor.
Make an evening of it and come for a late afternoon drink and repas (meal : ) and get into the groove when the beats start.
Early doors, early night.
S-ence feat:
Takas
Mish
Jen Kyle
Coda
Saturday 23 August - 7pm to 1am - $10 on the door
Lock in the date for your dose of sonic essence.
House through to techno and beyond.

events.venue: Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
Clayton Taylor and Nathan Torvik bring us The Early Bobs, their heartfelt homage to Dylan’s golden years.
Think harmonicas, blistering guitar breaks, and especially a voice that fans say “does Bob better than Dylan”.
From the Dust Bowl ballads to the biting protest songs, they’ll take you from 1961 to 1979 with authenticity, soul, and a whole lot of magic.
If you love Dylan—or just good stories wrapped in unforgettable tunes—these are your guys.
Believe me – this really is excellent stuff.

events.id: The English Locust & Antü Mãrama Play The Shed-46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The English Locust & Antü Mãrama Play The Shed
events.venue: 46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.description:
The English Locust is the folk/blues solo project of Wellington musician Jim Bailey.
The English Locust describes his sound as " Bob Dylan if he was goth", fusing the melancholy poeticism of groups like the Smiths and Joy Division with the musical stylings of folk and Delta Blues.
With his solo project The English Locust, he was a regional finalist in this years Battle of the bands, being the only soloist to make it that far in this years competition.
The group's ethos is represented by the name - Antü is the Mabudungun word for sun, while Mārama is the Te reo Māori word for Moon.
Antü Mārama is a synthesis of the group's diverse backgrounds and musical experiences, united by a love of playing music, and a desire to share the rich folk tradition of Latin America with a local audience.

events.description:
One of New Zealand's most celebrated live acts, dance music duo SACHI have announced two shows across Pōneke and Tāmaki Makaurau.
Dominating festivals not only in New Zealand but around the world, their success has even seen the pair become the first New Zealand act to play at Belgium’s Tomorrowland festival — one of the most prestigious electronic music festivals in the world.
After back-to-back New Zealand festival headline sets this past summer, SACHI are working towards their highly anticipated new music, which promises to return to the heart of their rave-oriented roots while always continuing to keep their audience guessing — they might even get a sneak peek of this magic during these upcoming tour dates.
