events.id: The Morning Shift - IS THAT US?! World Tour (sort of...) | Wellington-111 Wakefield St, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Morning Shift - IS THAT US?! World Tour (sort of...) | Wellington
events.venue: 111 Wakefield St, Wellington
events.long_description:
After humble beginnings in a garage, to a record-breaking rise to the top of the podcast charts, Aotearoa’s favourite trio — Jordan Vaha'akolo, Brook Ruscoe, and Marc Peard — are taking The Morning Shift to the people. This August and September, they’ll be bringing eight massive shows across Aotearoa and Australia in their first-ever LIVE tour.
Real people, real talk and now real life. Expect all the stuff you love from the podcast: deep kōrero, big laughs, a few tears, spontaneous/questionable singing, plus whatever Jordan decides to overshare that night. The live show brings the podcast to life, with that signature Morning Shift energy that turns commutes into therapy sessions and takes gym workouts to another level.
Tickets go on sale Friday 4 July at Midday NZST.

events.name: Ritual Heaps / Field Enhancement / Loam
events.venue: 272 Taranaki Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Ritual Heaps is psychic defence music. Durational synth fortifications from Whanganui/Te Awakairangi.
https://ritualheaps.bandcamp.com/
__
Field Enhancement draws inspiration from many different styles of music such as IDM, noise, drone, minuteless, psycore, techno and ambient. Much of the sound involves heavily manipulated and distorted textures, arrhythmic drums and scifi like synths, not keeping to any strict style or bpm.
https://acoldplace.bandcamp.com/track/glitchmylifeback
__
Loam, aka Daniel Cuzens, is a drone artist and guitarist in the heavy post-rock vein. Inspired by sci-fi film soundtracks they utilise synths to create enveloping and immersive sound worlds.
https://loamdrone.bandcamp.com/album/sonder-monolith

$17.50 presales available via UTR
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.id: The Shake-'Ems | Rogue & Vagabond-18 Garrett St, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Shake-'Ems | Rogue & Vagabond
events.venue: 18 Garrett St, Wellington
events.long_description:
From amidst the wreckage of our capitalist wasteland they rise, like a phoenix soaring through a bowl of molasses... The Wellington City Shake-em-on-Downers ARE BACK proving themselves to be the most resilient life form on the planet, giving even the cockroaches a run for their money. Middle New Zealand's favourite dadaist swing cult phenomenon are back with a vengeance, serving up a fiery primordial soup of fresh tunes for your listening and dancing 'pleasure'. Prepare for the stupidest gags, hottest horn solos, stonkiest grooves and pea-brained banter as we reign supreme in the battle of wits and people's attention against the existential crisis rectangle, otherwise know as the iPhone. Don't miss this exuberant show, or you may regret it for the rest of your miserable life.
----------------------------------------
Grab your tickets online from Under the Radar!
General Admission: $15 +BF ($20 on the door)
Students/Unwaged: $10 +BF ($15 on the door)
LIVE at The Rogue & Vagabond, Wellington - Saturday 23rd August.
----------------------------------------
Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/ShakeemonDown

Youtube:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCX29VHaEGi9ZxRZX20aQIQ

events.id: Daffodil Day Motor Show-Manaia Rd, Masterton-Facebook
events.name: Daffodil Day Motor Show
events.venue: Manaia Rd, Masterton
events.long_description:
Daffodil Day Motor Show 2025
Sunday 24 August – Masterton Motoplex
Gates open from 8.00am (registered vehicles), Public from 10.00am
Got a classic car, bike, tractor or something with a bit of grunt? Bring it along!
Entry is just $10 per vehicle, with prizes up for grabs across 14 categories including Best British, Best Bike, Best Tractor, and more. Static engines welcome too.
Pre-register now at www.waivcc.nz and go in the draw to win a prize.
Pre-registered vehicles get preferential parking on the dragstrip.
All proceeds support the Wairarapa Cancer Society.
Just want to come for a look?
Bring the whānau for a great day out. There’ll be coffee and food carts, local stalls, and a kiddies barrel train to keep the little ones entertained.
Koha entry for the public.
Whether you're showing a vehicle or coming to enjoy the day, this is one not to miss.
Proudly supported by:
Wairarapa Vintage Machinery Club
Wai Wheels
RamRodders
Fagan Motors
Masterton Motorplex

events.id: Sealed Autocross - Round 3 - The Lost Duck-Manaia Rd, Masterton-Facebook
events.name: Sealed Autocross - Round 3 - The Lost Duck
events.venue: Manaia Rd, Masterton
events.long_description:
Neil's Wheels presents the continuation of our Autocross. With Winter now here, we're switching to Tarmac on the back half of the Masterton Drag strip. So no rain delays!
This is the final Round of a 3 Round Rubber Duck Series and is a WMSA Kim Naylor Round!
Online entries via Motorsport NZ and are open!
If you don't have a Motorsport NZ Login, get in touch and we'll be happy to help you out, nearer the event time we will upload a form you can fill out.
Treaded tyres only, so semi slicks are okay. No full slicks!
Helmet and overalls requirements haven't changed for events of this level. Just make sure you're wearing cotton or wool under it, and leather shoes please.
To avoid any refuelling rule headaches we suggest you bring your car with enough fuel already in it. There is a few choices of petrol stations close by in Masterton.
No competition licence required.
Car club membership required unless this is one of your first two events ever.
Please follow official guidance when travelling over the drag strip, and do so at low speed and maximum care when entering the track.
The pits are our usual spot on the grass. We are not to use the concrete pads.
$60 entry plus to possibility of some lunch provided. Will confirm nearer the day.

events.id: Advanced Claw Setting in Two Days-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Advanced Claw Setting in Two Days
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
This two-day class is designed for advanced students and focuses on teaching a range of claw setting techniques, along with straightforward construction methods to securely hold gemstones of various shapes and sizes.
The emphasis is on mastering the techniques rather than creating polished, finished jewellery pieces.
Students are encouraged to bring along their own particular tools, metal and stones if they would like to.
Students will then move on to faceted stones and be shown how to construct their own settings in a number of styles, and how to secure their stones in settings.
The workshop will also look at how to use pre-made claw settings to best advantage.

events.id: Art of the Bloom-Ventana Creative Collective, 8 Kitchener St, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Art of the Bloom
events.venue: Ventana Creative Collective, 8 Kitchener St, Martinborough
events.description:
Step into the cozy charm of the Ventana studio and spend a hands-on crafternoon learning to create your very own voluminous, oversized crepé paper flower—a sculptural statement piece that’s equal parts art and joy.
In this immersive workshop, you’ll be guided through every step of the process from choosing the perfect colour palette to cutting, curling, shaping, and assembling each petal by hand.
It’s a meditative, rewarding craft that requires patience, but with the right techniques (and a few of my favourite tricks!
), you’ll be amazed at what you can create.
Date & Time: Sun 24th Aug - 10am-1230pm Location: Ventana Art Space 7 Kitchener Street, Martinborough

events.id: Sea Glass Rings - One Day Jewellery Making Workshop-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sea Glass Rings - One Day Jewellery Making Workshop
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
An opportunity to engage in creative recycling by turning seaside flotsam into precious wearable treasures.
Finish up with your choice of polish, including high lustre gloss, steel brushed satin, or darkened antique finishes.
If you can, please beachcomb and bring along some sea glass options - ideally around 1cm wide, and with a flat back.
Techniques: - Create a ring with one bezel set foraged sea glass ‘gem’ - Use jeweller’s callipers to measure and prepare metal - Use jeweller’s saws or snips to cut and shape metal - Use files and sanding to refine and smooth metal edges and surfaces - Use jeweller’s flame torches to solder join metal pieces - Use Dremel & bench polishers to refine & finish metal casts into wearable jewellery Project : 1 Ring with sea glass (silver, brass and copper options) Materials: Sea Glass, Copper, Brass, Sterling Silver One hour lunch - bring a packed lunch to have in our historic home or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.
Daylong workshop options on either Sunday 20 July or Sunday 24 August.

events.id: Breaker bay Raranga-150 Breaker Bay Rd, Breaker Bay, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Breaker bay Raranga
events.venue: 150 Breaker Bay Rd, Breaker Bay, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Breaker Bay Hall, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Open session: 1:00pm – 5:00pm (pack down starts at 4:30pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.
events.description:
Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Breaker Bay Hall, warmly invites you to: Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome.
We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
• An old towel • Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke • Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools • Some tools are available to borrow • Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required • Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke Koha appreciated, not required If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.

events.id: House Candle Holder Clay Workshop-The Art and Living Space, 17 Bradey Road, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: House Candle Holder Clay Workshop
events.venue: The Art and Living Space, 17 Bradey Road, Porirua - Mana
events.description:
A fun, relaxing and creative workshop to make a magical clay house which can be used with real or fake candles.
We will use my hand drawn templates, white clay, slab building and modelling techniques, and imprint with fabrics to produce stunning clear glazed white houses.
Also includes the option of adding some dashes of colour accents using underglazes and coloured slips.
I love making houses!
You can add birds, cats, window boxes or whatever inspires to your creation.

events.id: Jewellery Making In 4 Weeks - Sunday Afternoons-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery Making In 4 Weeks - Sunday Afternoons
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
This inspiring Sunday afternoon jewellery blocks are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment!
The course starts on Sun 24 August and runs for 4 weeks until Sun 14 September, 2pm-5pm.
Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on quickly to working in silver.
An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items.
Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.

events.id: Kids Rock 4 Palestine-9 Edward Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Kids Rock 4 Palestine
events.venue: 9 Edward Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kids Rock For Palestine
One Day. One Stage. One Cause.
This event is organised by kids in Pōneke to raise funds for kids in Palestine.
Join us for a one-day-only music fundraiser where young voices take centre stage to amplify hope and raise money for children in Palestine.
This isn’t just a concert, it’s a movement. Under-18 musicians, solo artists, and bands (some joined by over-18 allies) are coming together to rock out with purpose, showing that music knows no borders and compassion has no age limit.
These young performers are using their talents to stand in solidarity with kids just like them who are living through unimaginable circumstances.
Organiser Eddie 12: "We see children in Palestine who are being bombed and shot and are starving. We kids want to help. So that is what we are doing."
There will be stalls and crafting available for kids attending - Please come and support so we can raise money for Gaza's families.
100% of proceeds go directly to emergency aid and child-focused relief in Palestine - Convoys of Good and Kiwi Trust for Palestinian Childrens Relief.
Witness the next generation of artists and activists sharing the stage and raising their voices. Please support them with your attendance. Show them young people can make a difference.
Be part of an event where music becomes action, and community becomes change.
Do you want to volunteer to help? Email aotearoa2gaza@gmail.com
ALL UNDER 18s MUST ATTEND WITH A PARENT OR GUARDIAN.

events.id: Huntress x A Lady Butcher : Whole Hog Workshop + Wine-Martinborough 5711, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Huntress x A Lady Butcher : Whole Hog Workshop + Wine
events.venue: Martinborough 5711, New Zealand
events.description:
What to Expect: Huntress Experience: Guided by "The Huntress", Jannine Rickards, a passionate advocate for sustainable living and wild wine, you’ll be introduced to a deep, meaningful connection between the land, the food we consume, and the wines we enjoy.
Alongside her teachings, you’ll discover how Huntress Wines reflect indigenous food-growing practices and how each bottle celebrates the connection between the land’s cycles and the wines that grow from them.
Wine Pairing: As you absorb all the knowledge from the Huntress and Butcher, you’ll enjoy expertly paired wines throughout the experience.
Huntress Wines have been carefully chosen to complement each stage of the workshop, with a focus on organic, terroir-driven bottles that reflect the spirit of the land and match exquisitely with the charcuterie selection prepared.
This is a one-of-a-kind workshop that celebrates sustainable practices, the art of butchery, and the symbiotic relationship between the food we eat and the wine we drink.

events.id: It's in the Ballot - SWDC - Martinborough Community Board - In-studio- Texas Street Martinborough, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - SWDC - Martinborough Community Board - In-studio
events.venue: Texas Street Martinborough, Wellington
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Kath Irvine talks Fruit Trees: Winter-58 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Kath Irvine talks Fruit Trees: Winter
events.venue: 58 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.description:
Top of the fruit tree to-do-list at this time of year, is to check your fruit trees for health and vigour before they get going again in spring.
With that knowledge in hand, you'll be able to decide whether or not your trees need compost or mulch and whether to prune them now or in summer.
I'll show you how to prime them for the season ahead and set the scene for good health - get out ahead of pests, disease and poor vigour - its way easier and a lot more fun!
Coffee + tea + home baking for sale from 2.30.
Talk starts at 3.

events.id: Tony Yan Tong Chen-Waikanae Memorial Hall, 7 Pehi Kupa St, Waikanae-Event Finder
events.name: Tony Yan Tong Chen
events.venue: Waikanae Memorial Hall, 7 Pehi Kupa St, Waikanae
events.description:
Born in Auckland, Tony Yan Tong Chen has performed throughout New Zealand, North America and Europe.
Winner of New Zealand's Wallace International Piano Competition in 2019, Tony has since been placed in a number of other International competitions.
His Waikanae concert will open with Beethoven's concise Opus 90 Sonata.
A delightfully playful Chopin Waltz then introduces Chopin's great Bb Minor Sonata - the one frequently known as "the Funeral March Sonata" and considered to be one of the greatest piano sonatas ever written.
The next part of the concert will be devoted to the music of Alexander Scriabin, a Russian composer whose early music was greatly influenced by Chopin.

events.id: AGM - Annual General Meeting-Percival Road, Paraparaumu Beach-Facebook
events.name: AGM - Annual General Meeting
events.venue: Percival Road, Paraparaumu Beach
events.long_description:
This is to formally advise all members of the upcoming Annual General Meeting (AGM) of the Kapiti Softball Club.
Details of the AGM are as follows:
Date: Sunday 24 August
Time: 4.00pm
Venue: Te-Atiawa park, Clubrooms
In line with our Club’s constitution, this notice is being provided at least three weeks in advance of the meeting. A formal agenda, the Annual Report, and Financial Statements will be available on the day, and will be made available on our website after the AGM.
If you wish to submit any remits or notices of motion, these must be received in writing by the Secretary no later than Sunday 17 August 2025.You can send these to info@kapitisoftball.co.nz
Committee Vacancies
This year, several current committee members have indicated they will not be standing again. While all roles are open to nominations and elected at the AGM, we especially want to highlight the following upcoming vacancies:
• Treasurer
• Club Captain
• Junior Convenor
This is a big change for our club, and we encourage any members who are interested in helping shape the future of our club to consider putting their name forward. If you'd like to learn more about what's involved in any of the roles, feel free to reach out for a chat.
Quorum Reminder: As per our constitution, at least 10 members must be present for the AGM to proceed, so we would greatly appreciate your attendance and support.

events.id: Greta O’Leary and Goodnight My Darling - River Dark Tour-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Greta O’Leary and Goodnight My Darling - River Dark Tour
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
This August 24th join alt-folk songwriter Greta O'Leary & Te Whanganui a Tara artist Goodnight My Darling for one intimate and special show at San Fran, performing new and recently released works in celebration of emergence and O’Learys debut record 'River Dark'.
‘A folk-rooted aesthetic that feels almost gothic’ (RNZ).
River Dark' is O'Leary's debut.
I was in the field below the house, I was at the pond with the dog, I played make believe longer than most.
I was taught to be quiet.” ***************************************** Goodnight My Darling is the vision and project of up and coming Te Whanganui a Tara based singer-songwriter Maxine Macaulay.

events.id: Jewellery-making in 4 weeks on Sundays, Mixed levels - Wellington-65 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Jewellery-making in 4 weeks on Sundays, Mixed levels - Wellington
events.venue: 65 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This Sunday afternoon block is a short course on jewellery-making. It starts on Sun 24 August and runs for 4 weeks until Sun 14 September, 2pm - 5pm.
Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on to working in silver. An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items. Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.
These blocks are also a nice way for existing students or more advanced makers to work on more challenging projects and join friendly classes in our well-equipped warm studio!
Basic materials are supplied and there are extra materials available to purchase as you need in class.
This block is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. NOTE: Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
Our booking system asks for full payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this
Course fee $280, Early bird pricing $252 till 27 July.

events.id: Terry Shore-The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Terry Shore
events.venue: The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Terry Shore has been a real stalwart around the local Wellington music scene for over 30 years, playing his own original music both solo and with the Volun Terry Band.

He has 5 albums, 2 more on the way, and 3 EP's to his credit since releasing his first Poly Rhythm album in 2010. For the last 20 years he has run a programme on Wellington Access Radio showcasing unknown songwriters called Terry's Songwriters Show which airs on Saturdays at 2:30pm.

Terry has written memorable original catchy pop songs such as Anything, Dancing On The Line Island Love, Galactica Calling, The Daleks Are Coming In and many more.

He will be playing at the Undercurrent on Sunday 24th August from 5:30pm performing his originals with electric acoustic guitar and MP3 backing tracks. Stay on after the Sunday Jazz and see Terry for a good entertaining show!

Sunday 24th August
5:30pm
$15 online/ door
$20 for entry and CD

Complimentary snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

events.venue: 8 Chews Lane, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
An intoxicating night of poetry reading at elixir, Pōneke's most enchanting boutique cocktail bar, featuring a diverse cast of queer poets including special guest essa may ranapiri!
Come enjoy some fine food and drink and equally fine writing in the heart of the city, the Sunday after Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day, for a classy way to top off a weekend of literary events in style.

events.id: The Zimmermans play Bob Dylan-St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
events.name: The Zimmermans play Bob Dylan
events.venue: St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki
events.description:
Join Aotearoa's pre-eminent Bob Dylan tribute band for a night of rollicking rockin' folkin' funkin' songs from the Bobster - recognised as one of the worlds greatest songwriters.
We have 2000 plus songs to choose from so no - we're not doing them all, just a selection of his greatest hits, some deep cuts into obscurity, and ones we think are worthy of an airing.
Our ten piece band is packed to the gunwales with drums, guitars, brass section, singers, and keyboards to replicate the sound of the man, but also provide our own interpretations of some songs.
Our band members come from all manner of musical outlets, from the Mockers and Let's Planet to the Balkanistas and the Wooden Box Band.
Don't think twice, Lay your lady lay down and get your ticket now cos - y'know This Wheel's on Fire and there ain't no stoppin' the Dylan train.

events.id: Gong Bath at Lotus Centre, Paraparaumu-91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Gong Bath at Lotus Centre, Paraparaumu
events.venue: 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
*Limited door sales for $25* *Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket for maximum comfort and warmth* Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being.
The rhythmic patterns and overtones of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.

events.id: PopRox Improv Monthly at Circa Theatre-1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: PopRox Improv Monthly at Circa Theatre
events.venue: 1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Pōneke’s best dressed improv company PopRox are excited to bring their signature format back to Circa in 2025 after a year of sold-out shows in 2024.
Featuring an hour and 15mins of hot improvisers, long-form narrative work and more laughs than you have lung capacity for, this show is sure to have you “frequently laughing so hard [your] chest hurts” — Wellingtonista. Seated cabaret style in the iconic Circa Bar, PopRox is the perfect way to end your week with a laugh! Be sure to book early as shows will sell-out.
“This company is so talented at what they do, and you’re missing out by not being there to see it.” — Theatreview
“Each of the performers are at the top of their game” – Wellyott
“Some of Wellington’s best improv comedians on fire.” – The Post”
7pm – 8.15pm Sunday nights | First show Sunday 30 March
DATES: 30 March, 27 April, 25 May, 27 July, 24 August, 28 September, 26 October, 23 November
Circa Theatre’s new cafe, bar and brasserie Chouchou
$15 – $35 per person (concession and group prices available)

Featuring an hour and 15mins of hot improvisers, long-form narrative work and more laughs than you have lung capacity for, this show is sure to have you “frequently laughing so hard [your] chest hurts” — Wellingtonista.
Seated cabaret style in the iconic Circa Bar, PopRox is the perfect way to end your week with a laugh!
Be sure to book early as shows will sell-out.
“This company is so talented at what they do, and you’re missing out by not being there to see it.” — Theatreview “Each of the performers are at the top of their game” – Wellyott “Some of Wellington’s best improv comedians on fire.” – The Post” 7pm – 8.15pm Sunday nights | First show Sunday 30 March DATES: 30 March, 27 April, 25 May, 27 July, 24 August, 28 September, 26 October, 23 November $15 – $35 per person (concession and group prices available)

events.id: The Life of Henry the Fifth-1 Kent Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Life of Henry the Fifth
events.venue: 1 Kent Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
A young man, once revelling in freedom and reckless camaraderie, is thrust into the role of a king, burdened with the fate of England.
Victory or ruin rests on his shoulders, yet his newfound power isolates him, leaving him lost, uncertain, and deeply unsettled.
Betrayed by friends, mistrusted by his men, and taunted by those who seek his downfall, Henry’s journey is both severe and profoundly relatable.
Shakespeare crafts a world where soldiers fight without knowing why, where the battlefield sees vagrants and children stand shoulder to shoulder, where uncertain rulers navigate a landscape devoid of guidance from the past. It is a world that, despite its historical setting, feels unnervingly close to our own.
With only ten dynamic performers, this is Henry the Fifth like never before: stripped back, sharp, and driven by the raw intensity of Shakespeare’s text.
Expect fast-paced storytelling, immersive staging, and a production that puts the audience at the heart of the battle.
Full show duration: 95 min including a 15 min intermission.
“This production epitomises what can be achieved when talent, teamwork, hard work, opportunity and passion combine.’”
NZ Herald on The Tragedy of Macbeth

events.long_description:
Certified Better Business Analyst (CBBA) – Wellington (Two-Day Certification Course, Exam and Certificate)
Ready to take your business analysis career to the next level? The CBBA course is Wellington’s practical, industry-recognised certification for anyone serious about growing their BA capability and impact.
What you’ll get:
In-depth BA skills: Master the full business analysis lifecycle—from strategy and stakeholder management to requirements and solution delivery.
Certification that counts: Walk away with your Certified Better Business Analyst credential, backed by local employers and the BBAI community.
Real-world learning: Work through Wellington-focused case studies, hands-on exercises, and group discussions designed for today’s public sector and business environment.
Career connections: Meet fellow BAs, connect with local leaders, and get personalised advice on your next career step.
Who should attend?
Practicing business analysts ready for certification and career growth
Project professionals, change leads, and digital specialists wanting deeper BA expertise
Wellington-based professionals looking for a recognised BA qualification and community
Next cohort: End of August, Wellington CBD
Spaces are limited. Reserve your spot and join the region’s growing network of Certified Better Business Analysts!

events.id: FULLY BOOKED - Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: FULLY BOOKED - Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.

events.id: Leadership Unlocked: collaboratively solving complex school challenges -WLG- Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Leadership Unlocked: collaboratively solving complex school challenges -WLG
events.venue: Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Join us for a one-day workshop designed to elevate your leadership skills by delving into complex problem-solving and equity-focused educational strategies.
Developed and led by Dr. Jacqui Patuawa and Distinguished Professor Emeritus Viviane Robinson, this workshop builds on your existing expertise in leading learning, focusing on the use of double-loop thinking to address underachievement.
As Mumford et al. (2000) stated, “effective leadership behaviour fundamentally depends upon the leader’s ability to solve the kinds of complex social problems that arise in organisations.” In this session, you will: Build trust and foster respectful dialogue.
Accurately identify and analyse challenges affecting student outcomes.
Develop effective solutions that promote equitable educational success.

events.id: XTrail Spring - Skyline Scramble--41.276183, 174.755357-Facebook
events.name: XTrail Spring - Skyline Scramble
events.long_description:
The Skyline trails deliver a signature Wellington run — native bush, panoramic peaks, and rolling ridgelines. All 3 courses begin in the lush surroundings of Otari-Wilton’s Bush, New Zealand’s only native botanic garden, and wind their way up to the summit of Johnston Hill. The short course offers a rewarding climb and scenic descent, while the long course adds a little extra vert and extends your adventure along the iconic Skyline Track, with sweeping views over the city, coast, and beyond. With flowing trails and plenty of natural beauty, it’s a proper taste of Wellington’s wild backyard.
https://barefootxtrail.co.nz/

events.id: Wellington Rowing Club AGM, Lotto 8’s & Season Opening-Wellington Rowing Club-Facebook
events.name: Wellington Rowing Club AGM, Lotto 8’s & Season Opening
events.venue: Wellington Rowing Club
events.long_description:
The Wellington Rowing Club Annual General Meeting (AGM) and opening of the season will be held on Sunday 24 August 2024, 12 noon, at the WRC Function Centre.
We look forward to seeing you all at the Club at 9:30 for Lotto 8’s (weather permitting).
Following the meetings, a light lunch will be provided. This is also WRC’s opportunity to unveil the Function Space renovations to the membership.

Information about the AGM
The WRC AGM will commence at 12noon, in the WRC Function Centre. There will be provisions for online attendance.
At this year’s AGM, we have several board and committee positions that we will be seeking to fill. Many hands make light work, and we all depend on volunteers to keep the club growing and thriving. A variety of experience levels, skill sets, and perspectives are needed for a well-functioning club.
The positions to be filled this year are:
-Club Captain (2-year term, Officer role)
-Vice President (2-year term, Officer role)
-Club Treasurer (2-year term, Officer role)
-Club Secretary (2-year term, Officer role)
-3 Committee roles (1-year term, non-Officer role)
-3 Board members (2-year term, Officer role)
Officers of the must consent in writing to being an officer and certify that they are eligible and not disqualified from holding office as described under section 36B of the Charities Act 2005.
The Club by-laws outline the current role descriptions, can be found here, note that the roles can be tailored to suit individuals’ skill sets and experience. Mentoring and support can be provided to develop individuals in these positions.
If you are interested, but have further questions- please reach out to the people holding the current role or any of the board or committee members to discuss.

It's that time of the year again!
Come along to hear about what we have managed to achieve in the 2024/25 financial year, our goals for the future, and listen to our fantastic line-up of guest speakers!
There will be a catered lunch, as well as tea and coffee breaks - if you have any dietary requirements, please send us a message on here or to admin@retina.org.nz so we can accommodate you.

events.venue: 19 Beach Rd, Paekakariki 5034, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Chair Yoga – Free Taster Session

I’m excited to invite you to a gentle, supported movement class designed especially for people over 60.
In this free taster session, we’ll explore:
Gentle chair-based yoga
Simple strength & balance exercises
Calming qi gong practices
This is a relaxed, friendly class — perfect whether you’re brand new to yoga or looking for a safe, enjoyable way to move.
With 25 years of teaching experience (and being 52 myself!), I understand the importance of movement that’s kind to our bodies while still helping us feel stronger and more confident.
Come give it a try — your body will thank you.

events.id: Writers on Mondays: Anna Jackson and Rachel O'Neill-Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Writers on Mondays: Anna Jackson and Rachel O'Neill
events.venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
events.description:
Nina Mingya Powles calls Anna Jackson’s Terrier, Worrier ‘a remarkable and playful book on language, anxiety, poetry, and the strangeness of being a person’.
Somewhere between a diary and a collection of poetic essays, it takes Jackson’s work into previously uncharted territory.
Equally off the charts is filmmaker, writer, and artist Rachel O’Neill’s Symphony of Queer Errands, a delightfully riotous musical fantasia and an irreverent ode to queer joy.
Chris Price will pilot the conversation between these adventurous voyagers in unknown seas.
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre, Meow and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day and supported by the Letteri Family.

Nina Mingya Powles calls Anna Jackson's Terrier, Worrier 'a remarkable and playful book on language, anxiety, poetry, and the strangeness of being a person'. Somewhere between a diary and a collection of poetic essays, it takes Jackson's work into previously uncharted territory.
Equally off the charts is film-maker, writer, and artist Rachel O'Neill's Symphony of Queer Errands, a delightfully riotous musical fantasia and an irreverent ode to queer joy.
Chris Price will pilot the conversation between these adventurous voyagers in unknown seas.

Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. Admission is free and all are welcome. The series is supported by the Letteri family.

events.id: Our Beloved Indigenous Vegetation - Guided Walk-Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Our Beloved Indigenous Vegetation - Guided Walk
events.venue: Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
In this approximately one-hour downhill walk we will obtain a perspective on several native plants from the ubiquitous, such as our well-known cabbage tree, kōwhai and podocarps, to lesser-knowns such as shrubby toroaro/mingimingi, Bartlett's rātā, Three Kings kaikōmako and Three Kings vine/akapukaea. We will also discuss the phenomenon of species radiation exemplified by Hebe and Kauri.
Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn.
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.
This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: Beginner Jewellery Making In 8 Weeks - Mondays-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Beginner Jewellery Making In 8 Weeks - Mondays
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
It starts on Monday 25 August and runs for 8 weeks until Monday 13 October, 5.30-pm - 8 pm.
We start with basic ring making in copper or brass, students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.
Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top).
Once your first setting is completed you can move to working in silver and produce another stone set ring with more interesting design elements.
Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, up to 8 grams of sterling silver, an extra $8 for stones and fine silver and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals.

events.id: Governance Reporting for Effective Decision-Making!-Microsoft, Level 13 , 10 Brandon Street.-Humanitix
events.name: Governance Reporting for Effective Decision-Making!
events.venue: Microsoft, Level 13 , 10 Brandon Street.
events.long_description:
Note: This is a Hybrid Event:
In-Person Location: Microsoft, Level 13 , 10 Brandon Street, Wellington.
Online: The Zoom link will be sent out the day before the event.
About this event:
About this event:

Effective governance reporting is essential for successful project, programme, and portfolio delivery. Join us for an exclusive webinar where two industry experts—each representing leading software tools—will share insights on how to optimize reporting processes, enhance decision-making, and track progress with precision.

This session will explore critical elements of governance reporting, including the dashboards and key information decision makers need to ensure transparency and accountability. Our speakers will showcase best practices for structuring reports, selecting the right performance indicators, and using real-time data to drive strategic outcomes. Learn how to streamline reporting workflows, reduce manual effort, and leverage technology to provide stakeholders with clear, actionable insights.

Whether you're managing a single project, a programme, an entire portfolio, PMO, or a member of any delivery governance committee, this webinar will equip you with practical strategies and the right tools to improve oversight and control. Gain valuable knowledge from experts in project governance and software solutions that support effective reporting.
About the Presenter:
About the Presenters:

Youssef Mourra is the founder, Director, and Principal Consultant at Nonsuch. He delivers consulting across all the layers of Project, Programme and Portfolio Management (P3M) in organisations of any size and type. He is known for developing practical and pragmatic solutions that help organisations achieve their desired business outcomes and to execute their strategies.

Bruce Aylward is the "Chief Everything Officer" of Psoda, isn't your average tech CEO. His journey took him from the starry skies of rocket science to revolutionizing cloud-based project management software.
PDU's Available:
PDU's Available: Total = 1.5 PDU's
• Ways of Working - 0.5
• Power Skills - 1
Course Identifier: PMINZ202584
PDU Claim Code:012988AK4J
Hosted by: PMINZ Leaders in Project Delivery Special Interest Group and the Wellington Branch of PMINZ

events.id: Inaugural Professorial Lecture - Professor Angela Ballantyne-23 Mein St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Inaugural Professorial Lecture - Professor Angela Ballantyne
events.venue: 23 Mein St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description: Inaugural Professorial Lecture "Making things right". What does it mean to make things right? Medicine and science often turn to bioethics for concrete solutions to ethical challenges. But in reality, there is rarely a single, obvious ‘right’ answer. Human systems are inherently messy, and challenged by a legacy of injustice, unequal distributions of power, and declining social trust. This talk will describe the potential for bioethics to help clarify and navigate ethics dilemmas; pragmatically inching us closer to making things – if not right, then at least – better.

events.id: Niko Ne Zna Live at Vogelmorn Hall (Wellington)-13 Vennell St, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Niko Ne Zna Live at Vogelmorn Hall (Wellington)
events.venue: 13 Vennell St, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington, get ready! It’s been a minute!
Fresh off a sold-out show in Auckland, Niko Ne Zna returns to the capital for a night of explosive Balkan brass at Vogelmorn Hall.
Expect bold brass, infectious rhythms, soaring vocals, and a dancefloor that won’t quit. This nine-piece powerhouse delivers their signature high-energy performance — featuring brand new songs in preparation for their upcoming third studio album, as well as all the hits you know and love.
Two powerful sets of Niko Ne Zna Balkan brass inspired music
Delicious food available
Cash bar featuring local beers from Kererū Brewing, as well as wine and spirits from the Balkans
A party like no other!
With trumpets, saxophone, trombones, sousaphone, tapan (bass drum), snare drum, percussion, and vocals in multiple languages, Niko Ne Zna blends hypnotic melodies, driving rhythms, and theatrical flair into an unforgettable live experience. Whether on the street, in a club, or on a festival stage, their shows are part gig, part spectacle — all heart.
They’ve wowed crowds at WOMAD, featured in What We Do In The Shadows, and played to packed houses across New Zealand and Australia.
Come early, grab a bite, enjoy a Kererū brew, and be part of something special.
Doors at 6pm.
“It’s like being dropped into the hot and spicy lands of a faraway country.” — wellingtonlivemusic.com
“Straight to the dancefloor.” — Elsewhere
“Driving rhythms, an intoxicating effect.” — Taranaki Daily News
www.nikonezna.com

events.id: Steps To Success - The recipe to competing at your best-10 Surrey St, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Steps To Success - The recipe to competing at your best
events.venue: 10 Surrey St, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Steps To Success is a seminar, helping you become the best athlete possible. No matter your level, weather you are a beginner, an amatuer or a pro, this workshop has the recipe to start competing at your best.
What:
This seminar is a fundraiser to get the Rocking Robins Top team to Nationals this year in Rotorua.
When: August 29th 2025 6pm
Where: Tawa Fitness Portal
Cost: $25 Per ticket
Bonus: Each ticket comes with a $5 voucher to the Fitness Portal Cafe.
Sausage Sizzle: There will be a sausage running during the sausage sizzle so you won't go hungry.
What is this event?
Rotate through each 20–30 min session (with 5-min breaks between):
1. Mindset & Visualization – Mental prep and performance focus with Jordan
2. Physical Prep & Recovery – Injury prevention, recovery tips, and training smarter with Devin
3. Nutrition for Success – Fuel your body right with Olivia
BBQ will be running on the night so be sure to bring your loose coins!!
Proceeds from this event go towards helping the Rocking Robins top team get to national in October!!
Meet your hosts:
Jordan Shearer: Coach. Trainer. Space-holder for rebels, dreamers, and high end performers.
Jordan is the founder of Being You, a coaching practice grounded in authenticity, connection, courage, simplicity, and going rogue. She blends her background in mental health, life coaching, and human behavior with no-fluff, deeply human approach to performance. Having competed herself, Jordan understands the pressure that comes with stepping out, showing up, and giving your best when it counts. Jordan has coached competitive gymnastics, doctors, dancers, and first responders (to name a few) - people who need to stay mentally strong in high-performance spaces.
Devin Glover: Owner and Founder of The Fitness Portal Limited. Devin has been a personal trainer for 10+ years, and has competed either Nationally or Internationally in the following sports: Underwater Hockey, Olympic Weightlifting, Rock N Roll Dancing, CrossFit, Swimming and has dabbled in endurance sports like Ironman and Road cycling.
Olivia White: Hailing from South Africa, Olivia knows how to put in the work when it comes to training and performing at her best. Competing at the world champs in Power Lifting, to now taking on every other challenge that comes her way. Olympic Weightlifting, CrossFit, Hyrox and many more athletic endeavors, Olivia knows that fueling your body is just as important as training it. Being a qualified nutrionist, Olivia is going to walk you through the do's and don't of eating to compete.

events.id: Unity Book Club: Before the Winter Ends-57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Unity Book Club: Before the Winter Ends
events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Melissa and Eden host our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.
For the month of August we will be discussing Before the Winter Ends by Khadro Mohamed.
In the cold Wellington winter, Omar’s grades are slipping, his mum is unwell and his best friend is growing distant. Two decades earlier in Mogadishu, Asha and Yasser are falling in love and starting to build a life together while a burgeoning war threatens to take it away.
Before the Winter Ends explores the relationship between mother and son across Aotearoa New Zealand, Somalia and Egypt as they search for understanding and try to bridge the distance between them. Khadro Mohamed’s debut novel is a stark portrayal of how the past illuminates the present and how grief shapes a family.
Limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner, rather than later and tell your friends and whānau. Drinks and snacks are provided.

events.id: Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
You don’t need more hours in the day — you just need to stop spending them on the wrong things.
You’re busy. I get it. There’s just no time for the things that you really want to do, right?
"Buy Back Your Time" is a 1-hour interactive workshop for anyone who wants to reclaim their time, energy, and focus — without burnout or hustle culture.
In this session, you'll learn:
Why time management is really attention management
How to shift from reacting to designing your days
Practical tools to create space for what actually matters
How to identify & eliminate your biggest time-wasters
You’ll walk away with a simple plan to buy back your time — and start investing it in your goals, your growth, and your life.
Meet your host, Nava
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!
6.15pm Tuesday 26th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

events.id: Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection
The Men’s Circle is a free, supportive gathering for men to connect, share openly, and grow together. Whether you're navigating life changes, seeking community, or simply wanting a space to be heard, you're welcome here.
Expect honest conversations and the kind of connection that’s rare but necessary. No pressure to speak—just your presence is enough. We follow a respectful, non-judgmental format that prioritizes safety, confidentiality, and authenticity.
Optional Plant-Based Dinner
Stay afterwards for a nourishing, plant-based dinner and dessert ($15). Sharing a meal is a powerful way to extend the connection beyond the circle. This gathering is not run for profit—Andre is simply passionate about creating spaces for genuine connection.
What to Expect in the Circle:
Gathering in Circle: We sit in a circle to foster a sense of unity and equality.
Centering In: A short meditation or silence helps us arrive and ground.
Talking Object: A shared object moves around—only the person holding it speaks.
Optional Sharing: Speak if you feel moved. You’re always welcome to pass.
Active Listening: No interruptions, advice, or feedback—just presence.
Confidentiality: What's shared in the circle, stays in the circle.
Our Shared Agreements:
Speak from the “I”: Share from your own experience, not on behalf of others.
No fixing or judging: This is not a space to solve, but to witness.
Be present: Share what’s alive for you right now.
Respect and trust: We uphold a culture of care, confidentiality, and non-judgment.
Meet Andre, your host
Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. Over the years, Andre has come to value the power of sitting in circle—of men coming together in honesty, vulnerability, and presence to witness and support one another. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.

events.id: Sound Healing Experience-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Sound Healing Experience
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia
It’ll be a transcendent evening of Sacred Harmonic Sounds, where multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia will guide you through a deeply restorative sonic experience. Plus - there will be an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!
Let the vibrations of Gongs, Crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other ancient instruments wash over you—melting away tension, quieting the mind, and opening a doorway to inner stillness.
With Claudio’s masterful soundscapes, you’ll not only hear the music but feel it resonating through your body, inviting profound relaxation and a reconnection to your heart. No prior meditation or yoga experience is needed—just come as you are and let the sound carry you into a space of deep peace.
What to Bring?
Yoga mats, blankets & cushions are provided but you are also welcome to bring your own yoga mat and any extra cushions or any other comforts for the ultimate experience!
Why You Won’t Want to Miss This
A rare opportunity to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing sound
A deeply immersive, meditative experience—perfect for relaxation and renewal
Limited spaces
Meet Claudio Escutia, your host

events.long_description:
Yoga Nidra: Nervous System Reset
A deeply soothing experience of rest and regulation — followed by a delicious plant-based dinner.
This guided Yoga Nidra session invites you to slow down and settle the body, mind, and breath. Through gentle awareness practices and calming visualizations, Emma will guide you into a state of deep rest where your nervous system can begin to unwind and reset.
The space will be thoughtfully prepared to support stillness and ease, with soft lighting, grounding scents, and a soundscape designed to evoke a sense of safety. All comforts are provided — mats, blankets, bolsters — though you're welcome to bring anything personal that helps you feel completely relaxed.
Whether you're feeling depleted, overstimulated, or just in need of a pause, this is a chance to come home to your body and recharge from within.
After the session, stay to enjoy a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, included in your ticket — a gentle way to nourish, connect, and carry the calm into your evening.
Meet Emma, your host
With a 100-hour trauma-informed Yin Yoga certification and a background in the corporate world, Emma brings both groundedness and empathy to her teaching. Her approach is slow, intentional, and centered on creating a space where your body feels safe to relax and release.

events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
The most joyful children’s literature event of the year is surely the New Zealand Book Awards for Children and Young Adults ceremony, and we’re inviting you to join the celebration at the characterful Pipitea Marae in Wellington on Wednesday 13 August.
You’ll be greeted by a singing group of talented Pōneke rangatahi and there’ll be live music throughout the evening. But most importantly, you’ll get to meet the 47 gifted children’s writers, illustrators and translators who are finalists in this year’s awards, and applaud the winners as they are announced.
Tickets (which include food and refreshments at the post-ceremony function) are on sale now via Humanitix for $52.00 plus booking fees. This is a popular event with a limited number of seats, so secure your place today and enjoy this wonderful showcase of the very best books of the year for young New Zealand readers.

events.id: BOOK LAUNCH! Downstream from Nowhere by Johnny Crawford-126 Vivian Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: BOOK LAUNCH! Downstream from Nowhere by Johnny Crawford
events.venue: 126 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join 5ever books for the celebration and launch of Johnny Crawford's 'Downstream from Nowhere'!
Trades Hall, 124 Vivian Street
Friday 29 August 2025
6:30PM - whenevz
Free entry, all welcome, nibbles and drinks available, accompanied with sentimental words and live serenades.
~~~~~~
In the two centuries since the first Pākehā set foot in what would go on to be known as the Messines Valley, it has seen its fair share of history. Music Festivals. Failed settlements. Paranormal phenomena.
As the stolen land passed through the hands of church and state and capital, each left its mark. ‘Downstream from Nowhere’ follows this course through the eyes of the valley’s least reputable visitors.
~~~~~~
"Crawford sends us running straight into a tornado of intergenerational colonial mindsets, jingoistic historicism, and pop-cultural epochs, with a goat's head in one hand and a kebab in the other" - Jordan Hamel
Art by Miriam Collins, Sam Low and Nabilah Husna Binte Abdul Rahman. Cover designed by Achille Segard.

events.id: August Club Night: Ben Reddiex, Department of Conservation-3 Collina Ter, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: August Club Night: Ben Reddiex, Department of Conservation
events.venue: 3 Collina Ter, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This month we will hear from Ben Reddiex who leads DOC’s efforts to manage introduced wild animals, including deer, goats, pigs, tahr, and chamois. He will speak about the National Wild Goat Hunting Competition, a collaborative initiative between DOC and our organisation. Ben will also provide a brief update on DOC’s broader work in this space, including progress on Herds of Special Interest and recent collaboration around deer management in the Ruahine Forest Park.
The report back from the Conference will also be presented and Joe Hubmann will talk about Japan's largest sika deer. Club night doors open from 7:00pm. Talks start 8:00pm.

events.id: Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – Vogelmorn-93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – Vogelmorn
events.venue: 93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – big hearts, remarkable songs – on stage, with a collection of brand new tunes.
Doors at 7
Music at 7.30
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com
-----------------
Tom Cunliffe writes folk songs like short films; vivid, offbeat, and full of heart. Based in Tamaki Makaurau, Auckland, he crafts lyrical worlds, with a guitar tuned sideways and a voice that balances gravity with joy.
Cunliffe has supported a number of internationally renowned artists including M. Ward, Grace Cummings, and Reb Fountain, bringing his mix of warmth, wit, and slow-burning intensity to stages near and far.
-----------------
Ali Whitton is an Aotearoa-born, Yorkshire-raised and now Wellington based singer-songwriter who is stepping into his own as an artist. Ali is an artist who refuses to let go, blending raw storytelling with a sound shaped by decades of experience and dedication to his craft.
Performing for years under the name Lost Bird, Ali built a reputation for writing heartfelt, melancholic folk-pop, playing everywhere from Wellington bars to stadium stages — including opening for Ed Sheeran in Auckland in 2018.
Now, after years of performing behind an alias, Ali is stepping forward under his own name, embracing his identity as an artist with an invigorated sense of purpose, and tackling his artistry with newfound confidence and clarity.
-----------------
Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours.

events.id: CMNZ Series: Takács Quartet (Wellington)-Old Public Trust Building, 131 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: CMNZ Series: Takács Quartet (Wellington)
events.venue: Old Public Trust Building, 131 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Celebrating their 50th anniversary in 2025, the Takács Quartet are among the world’s top tier chamber ensembles.
PROGRAMME
* Joseph Haydn | String Quartet in G minor, Op. 74, No. 3 “The Rider”
* Nokuthula Ngwenyama | Flow
* Ludwig van Beethoven | String Quartet No. 9 in C major, Op. 59 No. 3
ARTISTS
Edward Dusinberre, Violin
Harumi Rhodes, Violin
Richard O’Neill, Viola
András Fejér, Cello
Lauded for their recordings of Joseph Haydn’s String Quartets, the Takács Quartet will open their programme with Op. 74, No. 3, known as The Rider – a reference to the galloping licks in the finale, and will finish with Ludwig van Beethoven’s glorious No. 9, Op. 59 No. 3, Razumovsky.
Between these two tōtara of the string quartet repertoire, the Takács Quartet will present a new work - Flow by American solo violist and composer, Nokuthula Ngwenyama, that seeks to express the creation of the universe as it expanded out from a primeval atom 13.7 billion years ago.
Come in and out of silence
Tone swirling in the balance.
Nothing, then everything
Waving into space.
Then light
And after a longer while
Air.
And now sixteen strings manually animated
Vibrating through time.
Nokuthula Ngwenyama
events.description:
3 “The Rider” * Nokuthula Ngwenyama | Flow * Ludwig van Beethoven | String Quartet No.
Edward Dusinberre, Violin Harumi Rhodes, Violin Richard O’Neill, Viola András Fejér, Cello Lauded for their recordings of Joseph Haydn’s String Quartets, the Takács Quartet will open their programme with Op.
3, known as The Rider – a reference to the galloping licks in the finale, and will finish with Ludwig van Beethoven’s glorious No.
3, Razumovsky.
Between these two tōtara of the string quartet repertoire, the Takács Quartet will present a new work - Flow by American solo violist and composer, Nokuthula Ngwenyama, that seeks to express the creation of the universe as it expanded out from a primeval atom 13.7 billion years ago.

events.id: Debt Club EP Release Show W/ Model Home & Wiri Donna-Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Debt Club EP Release Show W/ Model Home & Wiri Donna
events.venue: Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Debt Club celebrate the release of their debut EP “Taste For Stout” with a special show in Pōneke, joined by friends and powerhouse live acts Model Home and Wiri Donna.
Formed in 2023, Debt Club have quickly made their mark with a dynamic, guitar-driven sound that blends anthemic hooks with thoughtful lyricism. Following the release of singles “Little Lines” and “Windows,” both featured on “Taste For Stout”, the band are set to mark this milestone with their biggest show yet.
Ōtautahi legends Model Home bring their kiwi take on midwest emo, earning massive attention with their 2023 debut album “…And Nobody Made A Sound” and a bunch of student radio hits.
Wiri Donna, led by Bianca Bailey, are a commanding indie rock force whose high energy shows and acclaimed EP’s Being Alone and In My Chambers have made them one of Aotearoa’s most exciting live acts.
San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.id: Hobnail at Kapiti Playhouse-7 Ruahine Street, Paraparaumu-Facebook
events.name: Hobnail at Kapiti Playhouse
events.venue: 7 Ruahine Street, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Hobnail are celebrating the release of their new album "Three Part" with a national tour. “Three Part” (out July 2025) is the 8th album from Wellington’s Hobnail. The new album features Hobnail’s take on songs by some of their favourite Kiwi and Australian bands and songwriters, including Don McGlashan, Barry Saunders, the Waifs, Nick Cave, and more.. These versions highlight the vocal and instrumental interplay between these 3 exceptional musicians.
Hobnail are a Wellington institution. They have played shows everywhere from Pittsburgh to Paekakariki, New Plymouth to Norfolk Island, Auckland to Amsterdam, Germany to Gore, the Canadian Praries to the Canterbury Plains. They are 3-time finalists at the New Zealand Music Awards (Best Folk Album and Best Country Song twice).
"Refreshingly down-to-earth and lovely with vocals so tightly knit they could be family"

events.id: Iron-Atlas House, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Iron
events.venue: Atlas House, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Iron
By Rona Munro
Directed by Campbell Wright
27th August - 8th September
The Gryphon Theatre
Iron follows the rekindling of a relationship between Josie and her estranged mother Fay who is currently serving a life sentence for killing Josie's father. Josie seeks to understand the events that she barely has any memory of, while Fay attempts to live life vicariously through her. As the play develops, we discover how incarceration has affected all of the parties involved, including the prison guards.
The Cast
Faye - Karen Anslow
Josie - Ivana Palezevic
Guard 1 - James Bayliss
Guard 2 - Helen Mackenzie-Hughes

events.name: Monteverdi Vespers
events.venue: 17 Boulcott Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for our major project of the year! This will be the first time this groundbreaking work has been performed in Wellington for over a decade.

Juxtaposing Renaissance melodies and polyphony with the rich virtuosity and colour of Baroque instruments, intimate vocal solos with a choir and orchestra of unprecedented grandeur, and dazzling opulence with striking emotional and spiritual depth, this will be an unmissable performance


We are thrilled to be joined by an incredible orchestra of top musicians from the NZSO and leading international artists! Come hear the striking tones of cornetti, dulcian, archlutes, Baroque recorders and more!


N.B. There will be a pre-concert talk at 7pm.

events.name: Homegrown Road Trip Wellington: Hori Shaw, Shane Walker, Te Wehi
events.venue: 69 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
SOLD OUT
Some of today’s most exciting homegrown talents are heading on tour – Hori Shaw and Shane Walker, with support from Te Wehi, are heading to 10 Kiwi towns and cities this winter.
The tour, the Homegrown Road Trip, will head to Gisborne, Whakatāne, Tauranga, Kaitaia, Hamilton, Rotorua, Napier, Palmerston, New Plymouth and Wellington over four weekends in June, July and August.
Hori Shaw, Shane Walker and Te Wehi are arguably three of the most popular Kiwi artists in music right now, with all three taking the top three spots on the Official Top 20 Aotearoa Singles Chart. Te Wehi’s cover of Allen Stone’s Unaware; Hori Shaw’s Back in My Arms; and Shane Walker’s Coasty Girl have all reached number one on the charts and are currently charted at 1, 2 and 3.
Now, all three are joining forces for the Homegrown Road Trip.
Homegrown Road Trip is Hori Shaw’s first headline tour in NZ, and with hearty supporters for all three artists all around Aotearoa, these shows are all highly anticipated.
Homegrown Road Trip Tour dates:
Thursday, June 26: Gisborne – Sugar Bar.
Friday, June 27: Whakatāne – Boiler Room.
Saturday, June 28: Tauranga – Rusty’s.
Thursday, July 3: Kaitaia – Awanui Hotel.
Friday, July 4: Auckland – Darby St Station.
Saturday, July 5: Hamilton – The Factory.
Thursday, July 31: Rotorua – Social Club.
Friday, August 1: Napier – Cabana Bar.
Saturday, August 2: Palmerston North – Royal Hotel.
Friday, August 8: New Plymouth – Crowded House
Saturday, August 9: Wellington – The Grand

events.id: MINUIT : The Reunion Shows | PŌNEKE (Wellington)-92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: MINUIT : The Reunion Shows | PŌNEKE (Wellington)
events.venue: 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
SOLD OUT!!!!
After over a decade away, legendary NZ electronic act Minuit are back – and bringing their iconic live show to Wellington.
..................................................................................................
This reunion makes us very happy because we thought it might never happen – ‘the Kiwi band with the French name’ are back together for a series of shows.
Singer, Ruth, describes the gigs as: "a chance to dance, laugh and sing (in my case, often the wrong words), together live one more time."
Minuit (minwee) became a must-see live act through the 2000s. Fronted by the enigmatic Ruth Carr, her coy persona ignites while bandmates Ryan Beehre and Paul Dodge forge rib-rattling beats around her.
Their debut album, The 88, released in 2003, achieved gold status in New Zealand, quickly followed up by the 'I Hate Guns' EP.
Over the following decade, the trio toured their synths and samplers from Helsinki to Hanoi crafting their own refreshing sound – storming The Crystal Method's club night in LA, the FabricLive birthday bash in London, and headlining the Hanoi Music Festival in Vietnam. Along with festivals and shows up and down Aotearoa.
Having been retired since 2014, we’re excited to announce that Minuit are back onstage for a limited number of reunion shows.
These reunion performances will pay tribute to classic tunes from all four albums 'The Boy with the Aubergine Hair', 'Except You', 'Fuji', 'Menace', ‘Aotearoa’, ‘I Hate Guns’, ‘A Room Full of Cute’, 'Last Night You Saw This Band', ‘25 Bucks’ – everything gets a look in, plus a couple of other surprises.
The show will be supported by Western Haikus and JOLA BURNS.
Minuit has a heart. And it beats loud. Real loud.
events.description:
After over a decade away, legendary NZ electronic act Minuit are back – and bringing their iconic live show to Wellington.
This reunion makes us very happy because we thought it might never happen – ‘the Kiwi band with the French name’ are back together for a series of shows.
Singer, Ruth, describes the gigs as: "a chance to dance, laugh and sing (in my case, often the wrong words), together live one more time."
Minuit (minwee) became a must-see live act through the 2000s.
And it beats loud.

events.id: Cairo Knife Fight + Sheeps Live at Meow-17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Cairo Knife Fight + Sheeps Live at Meow
events.venue: 17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
After ten years, Cairo Knife Fight is finally returning to New Zealand for a limited series of intimate shows. Known for their powerful live performances and genre-bending sound, the duo
is set to bring their unmistakable energy back to local stages.
Since their last performances in New Zealand, CKF has continued to push musical boundaries, earning Billboard chart success with tracks like “Churn” and “Nothing at All.”
Their latest EP, Dream Season, showcases the band's ever-evolving sound—fusing intricate live looping,
intense rhythms, and ambient textures. This homecoming is more than a tour—it’s a full-circle moment for one of NZ’s most innovative exports.
Joining CKF at Meow will be Wellington based Sheeps. Described as Art Rock for the end times, Sheeps are definitely the right band at the right time to partner CKF in 2025.
Don’t miss the return of Cairo Knife Fight. It’s been a long time coming.

events.id: Otago Mathematics Leadership Community 2025- Union Street East Room G. Dunedin,-Event Brite
events.name: Otago Mathematics Leadership Community 2025
events.venue: Union Street East Room G. Dunedin,
events.description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.
