events.id: Homicidal Pacifist - Dust Off Your Guillotines-Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Homicidal Pacifist - Dust Off Your Guillotines
events.venue: Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Created and performed by Sameena Zehra

This sold-out Pōneke favourite returns for one night only at Hannah Playhouse!

Three haunted sock puppets leading government. Shit-for-brains liberals peddling ‘both sides’ fucknuggetry as the people march for peace and their governments pour gasoline on fire. And WT actual F is a ‘lesser’ evil? Sameena Zehra is back to explore whether it's time to dust off your guillotines (even for a pacifist, it’s definitely time) with dark comedy and delicious storytelling that will make you gasp and guffaw as you channel your inner homicidal pacifist to pen a culling list of your own.

“As a piece of political theatre, this is one of the more entertaining and potentially moving with a flair for the dramatic... a remarkable raconteur with amazing stories to tell…” - Nicholas Holm, The Post

Audience care and considerations: This show is accessible to blind and low vision audiences without the need for audio description. The venue is fully accessible. Sameena may occasionally raise her voice, but won’t shout. There is some direct audience interaction, but if you avert your gaze or shake your head, you will not be engaged directly. Contains adult themes, political and confrontational material, and coarse language.

General admission - choose your price: $8 - $100

events.id: Sika Sound Journey-Raumati South Memorial Hall, 16 Tennis Court Rd, Raumati-Event Finder
events.name: Sika Sound Journey
events.venue: Raumati South Memorial Hall, 16 Tennis Court Rd, Raumati
events.long_description:
This powerful experience is like a soundtrack that is crafted to go with your life.

Something between an ancient ceremony and a movie soundtrack.

Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket. Be prepared to drop into a deep space.

Door sales will be available if there is space. Advanced booking is recommended.

Sika's Sound Journeys are truly unique. They are sonic explorations that feature didgeridoos, drums, flutes, voice and orchestral elements. A collection of foraged sounds from objects he has recorded in nature, add even more textures. Many of his sounds are completely unrecognisable and abstract. Immersed in this cocoon of abstract sound, we can find ourselves in the most surprising places in our mind. In this timeless realm, beyond the normal limitations of rational reality, anything is possible.

An epic adventure deep inside yourself.

Journey to worlds within worlds on incredible sound waves.

Sika creates a safe space to relax deeply and connect with our inner guidance. This Sound Journey begins and ends with a short guided visualisation.

There will be two journeys with an interval. Most people choose to lie down, so once again, please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket to get really comfortable.

A journal is also recommended.
events.description:

events.name: Vespro della Beata Vergine of 1610 (Monteverdi's Vespers)
events.venue: 17 Boulcott Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Our major project for 2025 is the brilliant Vespro della Beata Vergine of 1610 by Claudio Monteverdi.
Featuring cornetti, dulcian, archlutes and recorders, this collection of music for the office of Vespers has not been performed here in Wellington for a decade.
We will be joined by top musicians from the NZSO and abroad for this sumptuous work N.B.
There will be a pre-concert talk at 7pm.

events.id: BANDIT QUEEN @ The Boathouse, Nelson-326 Wakefield Quay Nelson, Nelson Region 7010-Event Brite
events.name: BANDIT QUEEN @ The Boathouse, Nelson
events.venue: 326 Wakefield Quay Nelson, Nelson Region 7010
events.long_description:
BANDIT QUEEN is NZ's finest (likely only) tribute to the music of The Decemberists.A Tribute to the Decemberists? BUT WHO ARE THE DECEMBERISTS?
Hailing from Portland Oregon, The Decemberists is an indie-alt folk rock band that write epic songs and have 9 studio albums to their credit. They are renowned for their musical style and unique storytelling with many song lyrics based on historical incidents and folklore. Perhaps drawing musical influence from the likes of The Beatles, Tom Waits, REM, Morrisey, their songs are exquisitely constructed and effortlessly combine folk-rock with elements of pop creating the infectious sound that is The Decemberists.
And who is BANDIT QUEEN? Experienced Christchurch based musos - Tim Kent (vocals, acoustic guitar); Justin 'Rusty' White (lead guitar); Jo-Anne Davern Fuller (vocals, keyboard); Chiara Lowe (violin, vocals); Adam Lowe (bass); Mark Newburn (drums, percussion).
The members of BANDIT QUEEN are passionate about this project and invite you to come experience and enjoy the eclectic music of USA indie-rock band THE DECEMBERISTS.

events.id: Is It Off?-Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Is It Off?
events.venue: Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Created and performed by Mamaeroa (Mo) Munn

This sold-out Pōneke favourite returns for one night only at Hannah Playhouse!

An oversharer with a splash of OCD, comedian, improviser and playwright Mo Munn was once called “unhinged” by a reviewer - and now she’s made it her whole personality! In her first solo hour, Mo squishes stand up, experimental and improvised comedy together for a rapid-fire whiplash of a show! Think one woman comedy buffet, packed with chaotic jokes, outlandish stories and a touch of spectacle. Fresh from debuting at the NZ International Comedy Fest, and taking home two comedy awards, Is it off? will keep audiences on their toes, delivering a comedy experience more hectic than a high school rave.

“… her show goes off in a very good way. It deserves to travel far and wide, as long as the oven is up for that." - John Smythe, Theatreview

" She jabs and slices at her audience and draws laughs instead of blood.... Thematically it's perfect" - Wellyott

General admission - pay what you can: $8 -$40

events.id: PIG DESTROYER-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: PIG DESTROYER
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
PIG DESTROYER boil metal down to its muscle, sinew, and bone-razor-sharp guitar, percussive pummelling, and alone, stark howl-and use them to commit a vicious assault.
The lyrics paint loathsome, frightening images of pitch-black self-hatred and the frailty of the human experience.
These musical manifestations only serve to cement their already legendary status.
Having not been in Australia and New Zealand since 2008, PIG DESTROYER’s long overwaited return has just one goal.
To unnerve the unprepared with a deranged, grisly intensity which very few, if any, can match San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.id: Leadership And Management Part 2-AREA Meetings and Events, 1 O'Reily Ave, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Leadership And Management Part 2
events.venue: AREA Meetings and Events, 1 O'Reily Ave, Wellington
events.description:
Learn how to make the transition from buddy to boss and lead a successful team.
As John F. Kennedy once said, “leadership and learning are indispensable to each other”.
Our Leadership & Management courses are designed to help you get the best performance from yourself and your team, providing you with the skills and techniques to become better than you ever perceived you could be.
The Leadership & Management Part 2 workshop will equip leaders and managers with the skills to build high performing and highly motivated teams; the skills to communicate effectively as a leader, become more self-aware, provide coaching and mentoring, deal with conflict in a constructive and productive manner along with developing ways to solve problems as a team.
This workshop also gives participants an understanding of the key concepts of leadership and leadership styles along with how to choose and implement a leadership style that is authentic and beneficial to both the organisation and the teams they serve.

events.id: The Mind, Body, & Climate Change-Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Mind, Body, & Climate Change
events.venue: Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Mind, Body, & Climate Change 
Explore how young minds can drive change by understanding the links between climate change, well-being, and action.

Free kai. Big ideas. Good vibes.
Ready to connect the dots between your own well-being and the planet’s future? We’re talking real talk, fresh perspectives, and a whole lot of inspiration — without the boring lecture vibe.
Devamrita Swami — world-travelling monk, renowned strategist, social observer, and all-round thought-provoker — is back at Vic Uni. He’s spoken at universities all over the globe, and now he’s here to flip the way you see climate action and mental health.
And yes… free plant-based dinner is on us:
– Loaded nachos (salsa, taco ‘meat’, sour ‘cream’ & ‘cheese’)
– Strawberry & peanut butter milkshakes
– Caramel & chocolate donuts
Come for the food, stay for the conversation. Vibe with good humans, share some laughs, and leave with fresh ideas you’ll actually want to act on.
When: Tues 16 Sept, 5:45 pm
Where: Vic Uni, Kelburn Parade — MacLaurin Building MCLT103 (up the steps from the Hub). We’ll have people outside pointing you in the right direction. Lost? Text us: +64 20 4191 5046
Click ‘Get Tickets’ to save your seat (and your donut).

events.name: FUTUNA LECTURE SERIES 2025 WELLINGTON- TUESDAY 16TH SEPTEMBER
events.venue: 34 Mulgrave Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
The Futuna Lecture Series commenced in 2011 and has been one of the main annual events on the NZ Architectural calendar for the last 14 years.
The additional support of these new sponsors is very much appreciated and ensures that the Futuna Chapel Trust can continue to attract speakers to NZ of a similar calibre to that of the 2025 Futuna Lecture, Francis Kéré.
The Trust takes this opportunity to thank Metalcraft Roofing for their support of the Futuna Lecture Series from 2012 - 2024.
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work and well as that of the Kéré Foundation.
The Trust will donate 20% of the ticket income to the Kéré Foundation to support the work of Francis Kéré in Gando, Burkina Faso.

events.id: Compliance made SME-asy: Health & Safety Essentials with MD Safety Consulting-Holloway Street, Carterton 5713, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Compliance made SME-asy: Health & Safety Essentials with MD Safety Consulting
events.venue: Holloway Street, Carterton 5713, New Zealand
events.description:
Are you a small business owner or manager wanting to improve your health and safety practices but not sure where to start?
Join Mallory from MD Safety Consulting Ltd, for a 90-minute interactive workshop designed specifically for small businesses like yours.
This workshop will cut through the confusion and provide practical, easy-to-implement strategies to help you meet legal requirements, keep your team safe, and build a strong safety culture.
What You’ll Learn: Health & Safety Compliance & Documentation – The essential documents you need (without unnecessary admin) Hazard & Risk Management – How to identify risks, assess them, and control them effectively Worker Engagement & Training – Simple ways to involve your team and ensure proper safety training Emergency Procedures – Creating an easy-to-follow emergency plan tailored to your business Incident Reporting & Investigation – How to report and learn from incidents to prevent future harm What You’ll Get: Practical tools & templates to apply immediately in your business Resource sheet linking to free NZ-based safety tools A chance to ask questions and get expert guidance Mallory understands the challenges of running a small business, and is passionate about helping business owners navigate health and safety in a way that is simple, effective, and realistic.
Whether you're starting from scratch or refining your current systems, this workshop will give you actionable steps to improve safety and compliance in your workplace.

events.id: etu | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: etu | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
San Fran
AUSTRALIA/NZ
PRESENT
ETU
SUNFLOWER TOUR
Thursday 18 September 2025 Doors 7:30 PM

etu is a Tongan-American singer, songwriter, and storyteller whose music bridges cultures and generations. Blending island harmonies with mainstream aura, etu’s sound is deeply rooted yet powerfully contemporary. His debut album ‘Sunflower’ is a heartfelt exploration of identity, belonging, and gratitude — a celebration of Pacific pride and resilience. etu’s performances are more than just about the music — they’re tailored spiritual & personal experiences that uplift, connect, and inspire. From concerts in the South Pacific to major festival stages, etu is on a mission to bring light to his people and share their stories with the world.


"This tour is more than me playing songs – it’s about bringing the spirit of the islands to every stage," says etu. "I want people to leave feeling seen, uplifted, and part of something bigger than themselves." 

With songs in English, Tongan, Samoan, Fijian, and Chuukese, Sunflower is a rich tapestry of sound and storytelling – a heartfelt exploration of belonging, gratitude, and resilience.

events.id: Paraparaumu Makeup Masterclass - 21.09 @9.15 am-Aorangi Road, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Paraparaumu Makeup Masterclass - 21.09 @9.15 am
events.venue: Aorangi Road, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.long_description:
About this event
Join Nikki, a Professional Makeup Artist & Colour Expert with over 14 years of experience, for an engaging and practical Makeup Masterclass. Nikki and her team focus on enhancing natural beauty and making makeup easy for everyone.
As we journey through life, our skin and style evolve. The best way to update your look and learn techniques that suit your unique face shape, style, and colouring is to attend one of our masterclasses. Whether you're a performer on stage, a busy professional, or a multitasking mum, this class will teach you how to apply your makeup quickly, flawlessly, and with confidence.
During the class, Nikki will demonstrate step-by-step techniques on a model while you get to apply your own makeup. You'll have access to professional products and tools to follow along and create your flawless everyday look. It’s fun, interactive, and designed for all skill levels.
"I can’t wait to share my knowledge with you and help you create a makeup routine that leaves you feeling fabulous and confident every day!" – Nikki
What You Need to Know:
No equipment required! We’ll provide all makeup products, brushes, and mirrors.
Bring a willingness to learn and a positive attitude.
Classes are capped at 12-15 participants to ensure personalised guidance.
Arrive 10–15 minutes early to get settled.
Please come with a clean, makeup-free face so you can get the best results.

events.id: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Manawatu-Masonic Hotel, 249 Main Street, Palmerston North Central, Palmerston North-Humanitix
events.name: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Manawatu
events.venue: Masonic Hotel, 249 Main Street, Palmerston North Central, Palmerston North
events.description:
Why this matters: In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill.
Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability.
This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind.
By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

events.name: Foundations of Leadership - Extended
events.venue: 157 Lambton Quay #Level 13 Wellington, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
The purpose of this course is to provide you with a solid foundation in leadership principles and practical skills to apply in real-world situations. 
By understanding these fundamental aspects, you will be better prepared to take on leadership roles and inspire your people. 
The course spans two days, covering eight modules that focus on the most important knowledge a new leader requires. These modules deliver hands-on skills rooted in leadership theory. 

Key audience
This course is suitable for people who are new to leadership and would like the theory and practice that provides a foundation for a successful leadership career. It is also beneficial for those who have been in a new role for a while that requires some leadership expertise. 

Learning outcomes
Understand the basic concepts of leadership
Develop effective communication skills as a leader
Learn how to confidently empower your people and build effective teams
Demonstrate good decision-making and problem-solving skills
Identify effective ways to manage conflict as a leader
Understand the importance of self-awareness and continuous development

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Course details
Duration: Two day, in person course.
Time: 9am–4pm, both days

Course includes:
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch, and afternoon tea.
To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

events.description:
From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable.
Over the past two decades, he has produced albums for other artists, launched numerous side projects, built an extensive solo career as a singer, guitarist, and bandleader, and founded his own record label.
His story is one of relentless, boundary-pushing creativity.
In 2024, Bjork re-formed the Brant Bjork Trio, teaming up with Michael Amster (Nebula, Mondo Generator) on drums and longtime friend—and desert rock pioneer—Mario Lalli on bass.
Born on the beaches of Australia by Andy Fernando and brought to life in the Californian desert, Full Tone Generator brings the heat with a powerful blend of riff-heavy rock and raw energy.

events.id: Waikanae Makeup Masterclass - 27.09 @9:15 am-28 Utauta Street, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Waikanae Makeup Masterclass - 27.09 @9:15 am
events.venue: 28 Utauta Street, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand
events.long_description:
About this event
Join Nikki, a Professional Makeup Artist & Colour Expert with over 14 years of experience, for an engaging and practical Makeup Masterclass. Nikki and her team focus on enhancing natural beauty and making makeup easy for everyone.
As we journey through life, our skin and style evolve. The best way to update your look and learn techniques that suit your unique face shape, style, and colouring is to attend one of our masterclasses. Whether you're a performer on stage, a busy professional, or a multitasking mum, this class will teach you how to apply your makeup quickly, flawlessly, and with confidence.
During the class, Nikki will demonstrate step-by-step techniques on a model while you get to apply your own makeup. You'll have access to professional products and tools to follow along and create your flawless everyday look. It’s fun, interactive, and designed for all skill levels.
"I can’t wait to share my knowledge with you and help you create a makeup routine that leaves you feeling fabulous and confident every day!" – Nikki
What You Need to Know:
No equipment required! We’ll provide all makeup products, brushes, and mirrors.
Bring a willingness to learn and a positive attitude.
Classes are capped at 12-15 participants to ensure personalised guidance.
Arrive 10–15 minutes early to get settled.
Please come with a clean, makeup-free face so you can get the best results.

events.id: Biochar Big Day Out 2025-255 Otaki Gorge Road, Ōtaki, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Biochar Big Day Out 2025
events.venue: 255 Otaki Gorge Road, Ōtaki, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Char curious? Keen gardener? Orchardist? Lifestyler? Climate Champion? BBQ enthusiast? 
Come one, come all to this one-off opportunity to spend a day making biochar in a magical orchard, forest and garden. Thank you Kapiti Coast District Council (KCDC) and Paekākāriki Orchards and Gardens (POG) for sponsoring this event so we can offer subsidised tickets as part of Sustainable Spring!
You will:

Morning sessions (9.30-12)...
Sipping coffee and learning the basics of Biochar. 
Getting hands-on exploring the property and learning to source good burn material (stuff you can find in your own backyard or lifestyle block).
Building a char toilet - great skills for civil defence emergencies, or just camping!
Ignite the Char-B-Que and BIG 600l kiln, learn how to feed the flames and trap the carbon.
Cooking using char!
At lunchtime (12-1)...
Enjoy a BBQ lunch cooked on the Char-B-Que. 
Learn all about the magic of biochar and how to use it to fight climate change, feed your garden. 
After lunch sessions (1-3)...
Quenching (pour cold water on) a kiln and processing char by drying and crushing it.
Making a home fireplace mini kiln using a biscuit tin (please bring a tin if you have one or koha for some extra we will source and bring from op shops).
Making a char water filter.
At the end of the day (3 pm)
Grab some biochar to take home (BYO container e.g. ice-cream tub or a small bucket
The big kiln will be quenched later in the day (around 4pm). For those keen to level up their learning on the kind of kilns used for large lifestyle blocks and small farms you are welcome to stay on and participate in a small advanced group dicussion and actvities between 3 and 4.30pm. 
Important things to note: 
Sustainability: 
We encourage carpooling to the event. Please bring your own reusable cup for hot drinks
Health and Safety:
 Please note there will be tree nuts and hazards onsite such as hot kilns and flames. So please take the necessary precautions by wearing non-flammable (cotton, wool, natural) materials and bring any personal medication that you need. We will have a health and safety volunteer onsite.

Family Friendly:
 It is a family-friendly event (kids under 18 are free) but they must be supervised by their parent or guardian at all times due to the hazards on site. 
Workshop Leaders 
John Wraight - CharPae 
Our CharPae Operations manager and ‘inhouse’ Biochar subject matter expert John Wraight has been making and using Biochar for many years and has delivered a number of successful workshops using these kilns. He is a BioChar Network member. He leads local CharPae burns, Char-B-Ques and kiln hire.
Holly Norton - CharPae 
Our CharPae Project manager has been making and using Biochar for the past 2 years. She co-leads these workshops and has additionally been exploring char use in sustainable construction and civil defence. She is currently on a mission to use Biochar to transform a tennis court into a thriving kai production space. She is this event's coordinator should you have any questions.
events.description:
Enjoy a BBQ lunch cooked on the Char-B-Que.
Learn all about the magic of biochar and how to use it to fight climate change, feed your garden.
Making a home fireplace mini kiln using a biscuit tin (please bring a tin if you have one or koha for some extra we will source and bring from op shops).
At the end of the day (3 pm) Grab some biochar to take home (BYO container e.g. ice-cream tub or a small bucket The big kiln will be quenched later in the day (around 4pm).
For those keen to level up their learning on the kind of kilns used for large lifestyle blocks and small farms you are welcome to stay on and participate in a small advanced group dicussion and actvities between 3 and 4.30pm.

events.id: Folk Bitch Trio-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Folk Bitch Trio
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Folk Bitch Trio Debut headline show in Te Whanganui-a-Tara/Wellington Melbourne’s alluring Folk Bitch Trio have announced their debut album release tour of New Zealand, playing headline shows in Auckland, Wellington & Christchurch.
Now Would Be A Good Time, the debut album by Folk Bitch Trio, tells vivid, visceral stories.
It wasn’t long before she messaged Peverelle and Sinclair, asking if they’d be interested in starting a “folk bitch trio.”  As soon as they started singing together, their connection deepened, and “the chemistry of being inspired by each other was evident from the get-go,” says Sinclair.
Listening to Folk Bitch Trio, it’s clear that this is a band of three distinct points of view, with contrasting and complementary backgrounds and visions.
Sinclair is the self-proclaimed jester of the group, but her taste skews dark, gothic, baroque and dramatic, expressed as a love of opera and ballet as well as musicians as wide-ranging as Patti Smith, Nirvana and Tchaikovsky.

events.name: Draw It Out - Teens workshop 29 Sept
events.venue: level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.description:
Theme: Strengthening self-resources Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
This single workshop helps teens to use drawing to access their inner resources, because often they have the guidance within, and just need help to bring it out.
Dates This is a single workshop: 4.15pm-5.30pm Monday 29 September – Strengthening self-resources Cost $46 total Included in each session You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance.
With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

events.id: Draw It Out - Adults workshop 29 Sept-level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Draw It Out - Adults workshop 29 Sept
events.venue: level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.description:
A gentle yet powerful tool for wellness (adults 18+) to access inner guidance.
Date This is a single workshop 6.15pm-7.30pm Monday 29 September Cost $46 total Included in each session You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance.
With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

events.id: Albi And The Wolves - 1st October-Hilltop Private House Concerts, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Albi And The Wolves - 1st October
events.venue: Hilltop Private House Concerts, Wellington
events.description:
Gate opens 7pm Music Starts 7.30pm Wednesday 1st October 2025 Auckland based Albi and the Wolves set fire to stages and fill hearts with hope with their energetic and relatable alternative indie folk songs.
Proud albino frontman Albi (Chris Dent), Pascal Roggen and Michael Young have crafted a stage show brimming with energy yet with pauses for reflection.
The trio has a huge sound created simply by acoustic guitar, electric violin, double bass and three voices.
Since 2014, Albi & the Wolves have gone from strength to strength touring Australia, New Zealand and Rarotonga.
In 2018, they took home the Best Folk Artist Award at the NZVMAs.

events.id: Bec Sandridge Presents: Always A Fan AU + NZ Tour-Secret Location, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Bec Sandridge Presents: Always A Fan AU + NZ Tour
events.venue: Secret Location, Wellington
events.description:
Very special guests TBA Bec Sandridge is hitting the road with her band to celebrate her bratty new single Always A Fan.
Expect melodrama, bigger hooks, fuzzed-out guitars, and a few unsolicited overshares—delivered with grit and polish.
Known for her theatrical, no-holds-barred live show, Sandridge has played Falls Festival, World Pride, Groovin the Moo, Indiestad and London Calling, toured the UK and Europe, and supported Mitski, St. Vincent, Saah Blasko, Yungblud, Ladyhawke, Kimbra, and Tegan and Sara.
Her new single Always A Fan—co-produced with Nick Zaharias (MAY-A, The Buoys)— featuring collaborators like Tony Buchen (G Flip, Smashing Pumpkins), Dave Jenkins Jr (Daniel Johns, Vera Blue, and multi-Grammy-winner Cian Riordan (St Vincent, Billie Eilish, Lana Del Rey).
Her 2024 Great Southern Nights show was the first in the series to sell out.

events.id: Tami Neilson: Neon Cowgirl Tour-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Tami Neilson: Neon Cowgirl Tour
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
New Zealand’s own international country star, Tami Neilson, is back.
Fresh off a tour around the United States she presents the Neon Cowgirl Tour.
Her glorious voice and powerful live performances have won admiration and support from some of country music’s biggest names and fans worldwide.
Tami will perform songs from her new album ‘Neon Cowgirl’ along with songs from across her entire career.
Her latest album (out 11 July) is one of the year’s most highly anticipated releases.

events.id: 5Rhythms workshop with Natalie Poole - Archaeology: Uncovering the Bones-98 The Parade, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: 5Rhythms workshop with Natalie Poole - Archaeology: Uncovering the Bones
events.venue: 98 The Parade, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
events.description:
A full 5Rhythms® weekend workshop in Paekākāriki, Wellington, New Zealand Join us for a deep dive into the skeletal landscape of the body—where form and movement provoke the memory of our animal, and mineral cells/selves.
In this weekend immersion, we’ll uncover the bones—exploring the structure, strength, support, and vitality that arise when we embody our bony architecture.
Through the 5Rhythms map, we’ll trace, align, and articulate the inner scaffolding that grounds our shapes, holds us upright, and upon which we can align our sense of self.
Her approach weaves embodied storytelling, deep listening, and transformative movement.
All willing movers are welcome.

events.id: TIM FREEDMAN-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: TIM FREEDMAN
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
DOORS 6:00 pm SHOW START 6:30 pm Tim Freedman is the lead singer, songwriter and pianist of legendary Australian folk rock group The Whitlams.
He will perform the best of his renowned nine album repertoire with pedal steel and electric guitarist Ollie Thorpe.
Since 2022 a reinvigorated Freedman has led The Whitlams in a resurgence, touring heavily and releasing two new albums “Sancho” (2022) and the Americana tinged “Kookaburra” (2024).
Between band tours he has started performing smaller country towns in duo mode, and this piano/pedal steel configuration has developed delicate atmospherics to suit the poignant narratives in Freedman’s songs.
In September The Whitlams will performs three shows with the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra.

events.id: Fur Real: Mastering the New Pet Rules for Stronger Tenancy Outcomes [Wellington]-Level 1/60 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Fur Real: Mastering the New Pet Rules for Stronger Tenancy Outcomes [Wellington]
events.venue: Level 1/60 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
🔑 What You’ll Learn: What the new presumptive pet rights really mean for you How to strategically structure tenancy agreements with fair and enforceable pet clauses What reasonable grounds for refusing a pet look like in practice What you can legally ask about a pet during the application process How to vet pet-owning tenants and manage risk with confidence The roles of pet bonds, landlord insurance, and the Tenancy Tribunal How to balance your legal obligations with business expediency and long-term tenancy success 🧠 Workshop Includes: ✔ 3.5 hours of expert-led training ✔ Light morning tea ✔ Real-life scenarios and interactive activities ✔ Guest insights from insurance and proptech professionals ✔ Take-home clause templates, checklists, and Tribunal-prep tools 👩‍🏫 About Your Trainer Sarina Gibbon is the Director of Tenancy Advisory Ltd, a boutique consultancy specialising in residential tenancy strategy.
With a reputation as one of New Zealand’s most trusted tenancy experts, Sarina brings 15+ years of experience helping landlords, property managers, tenants, and community housing providers not just meet legal standards—but exceed them.
Attendees will also receive: ✅ A 3-month subscription waiver for agencies who sign up at the event ✅ Early access to Renti Academy and a one-month cancellation policy for trial sign-ups ✅ Bonus prize giveaways at each session Renti’s smart tenancy tools are the perfect complement to the new pet provisions—come see them in action!
While Initio won’t be attending in person, they’re contributing: 📘 A free downloadable eBook on pet-related damage and insurance coverage 🎥 A BONUS video Q&A session answering common insurance questions 📋 A co-branded post-event checklist on pet-proofing your rental and protecting your investment These resources will be made available exclusively to ticket holders—ensuring you walk away with long-term tools and practical know-how.
Sign up to our other sessions at Auckland, Christchurch or Dunedin.

events.id: English in the Community: Johnsonville - Beginners+ (ESOL Level 1-2)-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: English in the Community: Johnsonville - Beginners+ (ESOL Level 1-2)
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
English in the Community: Johnsonville - Beginners+ (ESOL Level 1-2) English in the Community courses help you to learn more English, get to know your community and meet new people.
The groups aim to help you use what you already know, learn more from your tutor and the other students and feel more at home in your local community.
To enrol in these courses, please contact the CEC office on 04 385 8919 or cec@whs.school.nz.
By the end of the course, you will: • Feel more confident speaking English in everyday situations • Be able to understand more English • Have learned new words and basic grammar • Know more about living in New Zealand and your local community The courses are free for NZ residents and citizens.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.description:
Assertiveness - Stand Up for Yourself An opportunity to learn basic practical skills to assist you in learning to communicate in an assertive healthy manner.
Come prepared to participate in class, as well as be working on assigned activities between classes.
We'll work both individually and as a group using this environment to help us grow as we learn.
By the end of the course, you'll be able to: Use a strategy to identify your own feelings, and to express what you would like Have an increased understanding of your own and other peoples’ anger, dealing with that in a more assertive manner Use strategies to allow you not to be manipulated by other people Speak in a way that commands respect and to begin to learn how to say “no” Begin interacting more effectively in your personal relationships and the workplace Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Storytelling On Stage Live storytelling is an artform unto itself, requiring different skills and techniques from standup comedy or prose writing.
In this four-part workshop, you’ll learn: - Creative writing exercises and daily practices to to find meaningful stories from your life - Tools for crafting a compelling personal narrative - Techniques to build suspense, drama, and humour into your stories - Stagecraft and performance skills to heighten and polish your delivery By the end of the class you'll have - One or more polished 5-10 minute stories to showcase on stage - Dozens of ideas to expand upon for future stories - Writing practices to improve your life as a creative - Less stage fright and more confidence as a speaker Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.name: Jewellery Making - Precious Stones in Cast Rings
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Jewellery Making - Precious Stones in Cast Rings Expanding on our classic Lost Wax Cast Rings class,  in this course you get the opportunity to learn and experiment even further by adding precious gemstones to the cast jewellery making process!
All materials are supplied in your booking so you won't end up with surprise costs.
Included in your course: Use of a range of jewellery wax types to create 2 practice rings then 1  main project ring 5 facet-cut precious gemstones to set across your 3 rings (choose from rubies, spinels and sapphires in a range of colours) Industry standard casting services that we will send your wax models away to so they can be transformed into brass, bronze and sterling silver rings 2 original practice rings cast in bronze or brass 1 main project ring cast in Sterling Silver During sessions 1-3 you will be guided to sculpt a range of wax ring models and embed precious gemstones, finishing one ring each session ready for casting.
Casdt jewellery techniques and fabrication jewellery techniques can also be combined to great effect, which makes this course a fantastic option for beginners and experienced makers alike.
By the end of the course you will be able to: Evolve your jewellery making abilities with new and exciting klost-wax methods Design and create original sculptural ring designs Carve hard jeweller’s wax ring master designs to fit a chosen finger size for casting Sculpt soft jeweller’s wax master design to fit a chosen finger size for casting Form soft jeweller’s wax to create unique designs ready for casting Set faceted gemstones in wax for ‘cast-in-place’ setting methods File, sand and polish metal casts into finished jewellery Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Electrify Wellington: how to save money on your energy bills feat. Mike Casey-Level 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Electrify Wellington: how to save money on your energy bills feat. Mike Casey
events.venue: Level 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It keeps getting more expensive to heat our homes and water, cook our meals and get around. But there is a way to avoid those rising costs and Electrify Wellington will show you how.  
Most Wellington homes could be saving thousands on their energy bills each year, while also slashing emissions, simply by upgrading their gas and petrol machines to the electric equivalents available today - and ideally powering them with solar and batteries for more self-sufficiency in case of power cuts or natural disasters.
Wellington has crossed the “electrification tipping point” where homes, farms and businesses can now save money and reduce their emissions by going electric. It’s a massive win-win and a lot of people don’t know about the potential savings that are hiding in their cupboards, kitchens and driveways. 
Rewiring Aotearoa is trying to change that and we’re supporting grassroots action across the country. Community electrification groups are popping up all over the place and helping to raise awareness about the benefits for their local region and helping locals through the process. Now, it’s time to bring the buzz to Wellington.
Come along to hear from Mike Casey, who is saving tens of thousands a year on his all-electric solar-powered cherry orchard, and find out how electrifying Wellington is the smartest, cheapest, and healthiest way to power our lives.

Songwriting: How to Write Your Own Songs The course is ideal for anyone who wants to write better songs - whether you’ve got a few songs under your belt or you’re a complete beginner.
You’ll see exactly how to turn theory into practice and write your best songs yet.
This course includes: -  Practical tips and techniques for songwriting -  Ideas for making your songs stronger, more expressive and more appealing to your audience -  How to overcome writer’s block, be an inspired and prolific songwriter who writes authentic songs -  An opportunity to share your songs with fellow students, bounce off ideas and learn from one another -  Learn how to structure a song effectively -  The pillars of songwriting and how to use them -  How to write better lyrics By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: -  Discover the exact steps to successfully write your own original songs; expanding a song from a verse and chorus, to a complete song while keeping your listeners engaged using transitions and dynamic contrasts between sections -  Come up with ideas, write lyrics, melodies, chord progressions and instrumental grooves that have an emotional impact on you and your audience -  Identify the structure of a great song, including how to combine melody, chords, lyrics and rhythm that create magic for your listeners -  Possess the confidence and skills to find inspiration and get past common creative hurdles and blocks so you can develop an initial spark of creativity into a complete song -  Stay inspired and find your authentic voice as a songwriter.

events.id: Energy Resilience and Affordability Conference-4 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Energy Resilience and Affordability Conference
events.venue: 4 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Ara Ake, in partnership with Community Energy Network and WISE Charitable Trust, is pleased to present the third annual Energy Resilience and Affordability Conference — formerly the Reducing Energy Hardship Conference.
About the conference This two-day event brings together around 200 attendees to explore the state of energy hardship in Aotearoa, highlight key innovations, and share insights from iwi, communities, and organisations leading change on the ground.
The conference provides a unique platform for thought leaders, practitioners, policy makers, and innovators to connect and collaborate on building a more equitable, affordable, and resilient energy system.
2025 Theme: Regional solutions for equitable energy New Zealand’s energy future must reflect the diversity of our people, places, and priorities.
As we face rising climate, infrastructure, and cost-of-living pressures, regional approaches are becoming key to improving energy resilience—our ability to respond to and recover from disruptions—and affordability, particularly in rural and remote communities.

events.description:
We’ll move through all the steps from the starting slipknot to reading patterns and diagrams and making your first crochet projects.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: • Discuss the benefits of crochet for relaxation and alleviation of mood • Read a basic crochet pattern and recognise crochet terminology • Choose yarns and hooks for projects • Use a range of stitches with confidence • Complete at least one project of your choice (granny square, keychain, garden decoration) Suitable for all beginners, both left and right-handers and those who may have struggled to learn to crochet.
Initial materials provided but please bring along any yarn or crochet hooks you would like to work with.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
French - Introductory 2 For those who have done Introductory 1 (16 hours) or have equivalent knowledge (e.g. who may have picked up some basic survival language through travel).
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: • Use basic French in a variety of everyday situations with some confidence (e.g. holidays, travel, at home) • Use the present, the imperative and the near future tenses of regular and some common irregular verbs, in both the affirmative and negative forms • Use prepositions with names of countries, cities and places • Name and locate places in town, including shops • Ask and give directions and ask and understand the time Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: How to be a DJ - An Introduction-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: How to be a DJ - An Introduction
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
How to be a DJ - An Introduction Always wanted to try being a DJ but not sure where to begin?
Experienced and professional DJ Shan (Shannon Chng-Rawiri) will teach you all about the technical aspects, equipment and terminology, as well as the industry in general, and enable you to put together a confident short performance.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Gain an understanding of the work content and career opportunities in this industry Learn the difference between what a DJ is required to deliver in the following situations: Mobile, Club, Radio, Turntablist and Hobby Participate in various practical activities: Slip Cueing and Baby Scratch, basic beat matching and song structures Gain a good understanding of the equipment used and terminology including: - Tables: pitch control - Mixer: crossfader, input faders, EQ, gain, cue system - Needles: back tracking - Slip Mats Learn about Counting Bars and Matching Tempos - The difference between a Bar, Phrases and BPM - Techniques to Count, Hand position and movement etc Confidently present a 5 minute performance in class The course will be held at DJ Shan’s studio at Shop 21, 73 Cuba Street, Wellington.
Bring headphones, a USB with your favourite music and a laptop, if you have one.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.name: Scriptwriting
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Scriptwriting During this course, you will develop and build on your writing skills so you can confidently produce scripted narrative.
We’ll take part in exercises, watch clips and have group discussions.
By the end of the course, you’ll be ready to finish your script, and take the next steps toward bringing it from page to stage (or screen!).
Bring pen and paper.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Analyse film, television, and theatre with a new lens for the way scripted stories work - Develop character arcs and dynamics - Create and build worlds - Write effective dialogue and work with subtext - Develop and implement a writing routine that works for your life - Give and receive constructive feedback on your writing - Have the confidence to put your work out into the world Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Jewellery Making - Lost Wax Cast Rings-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Jewellery Making - Lost Wax Cast Rings
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Jewellery Making - Lost Wax Cast Rings The lost wax process offers a wide range of creative outcomes such as 3D forms and textures, which are not achievable with fabrication soldering techniques.
Included in your course: Explore using a range of jewellery wax types to create 2 practice rings and 1 X main project ring Access to industry-standard casting services where we will send your  wax models to be transformed into brass, bronze and sterling silver rings 2 original practice rings cast in bronze or yellow brass 1 main project ring cast in sterling silver In sessions 1, 2 and 3 you will be guided to sculpt a range of wax ring models, finishing one each session so it is ready for casting.
These first 2 rings are a great opportunity to practice techniques and experiment with shapes, textures and designs before making your main project ring which will be cast in sterling silver!
This course offers beginners a fun introduction to jewellery making, and for those with some jewellery experience, it offers a great way to advance and expand your making techniques to new levels!
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: -          Evolve your jewellery making abilities with new and exciting lost wax methods -          Develop and create unique sculptural ring designs -          Carve hard jeweller’s wax ring master designs to fit a chosen finger size for casting -          Form soft jeweller’s wax master design to fit a chosen finger size for casting -          Combine hard and soft jeweller’s wax to create unique designs ready for casting -          File, sand and polish metal casts into finished jewellery Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.name: The Joy of Improvisation
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
The Joy of Improvisation Improv is theatre without a script and a fun way to build your skills in many areas, including team work, public speaking, storytelling and on-your-feet creative thinking.
This is the perfect place for absolute beginners to get acquainted with the joy and art of improvisation, inspired by the generous creative philosophy of Keith Johnstone.
WIT has been teaching this course in association with the CEC for almost 20 years now.
It uses fun games and structured exercises to teach the foundation skills of improv.

events.id: Pumpkinhead - Sloth 30th Anniversary Tour-Meow, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Pumpkinhead - Sloth 30th Anniversary Tour
events.venue: Meow, Wellington
events.description:
Pumpkinhead celebrate the 30th anniversary of their critically acclaimed album Sloth this year, performing three exclusive never to be repeated reunion shows.
Sloth entered the New Zealand Album Charts on 30 April 1995, peaked at number 28 and stayed in the charts for 4 weeks.
Their single “I Like” made it to number 16 in the Official Top 40 singles chart 10 March 1995.
“Now “Sloth”, Pumpkinhead’s debut album, compresses the quintet’s live energy into a head spinning whirlpool of fierce punky rock, powerful pop, and tempo-hopping Faith No More style metal.
Not for the innocent!” – 4.5 stars – NZ HERALD 1995 “Sloth is the sound of a band that’s already found its feet, the sound of a band that’s played 500 gigs before recording their debut album.

events.id: KORA tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: KORA tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: Eccles Entertainment
Kora are back - and sound bigger, deeper and more electrifying than ever. With a long-awaited new album on the horizon, and a tour to match, the iconic Aotearoa band is set to reawaken the hearts of fans both old and new.
Known as one of the country’s most powerful and dynamic acts fusing elements of roots, reggae, funk, rock, dub, and electronic music into a sonic identity that is entirely their own. Their music is heavy and melodic and grounded in kaupapa Māori, driven by innovation, storytelling, and groove.
Their performances bring together heavy bass, soaring vocals, and raw energy, blending musical mastery with raw power to create an immersive experience. Whether headlining major festivals or packing out venues around Aotearoa, Kora’s ability to move a crowd is unmatched.

events.id: Queen: It’s a Kinda Magic-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Queen: It’s a Kinda Magic
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
To celebrate the anniversary of the British band Queen’s famous song, a tribute act is touring and stopping in Wellington.
Think big sound, big screens, crazy lighting, and outlandish costumes.
Dominic Warren will take the lead performing lead vocals, guitar and piano.
All songs are in Freddie’s original key.
Get ready to mosh to ‘We Will Rock You,’ ‘We Are the Champions,’ ‘Radio Ga Ga,’ ‘I Want to Break Free,’ ‘Somebody to Love,’ ‘Don’t Stop Me Now,’ ‘Another One Bites the Dust,’ ‘A Kind of Magic,’ and of course, ‘Bohemian Rhapsody.’

events.id: Rob Beckett — Giraffe-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Rob Beckett — Giraffe
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Since debuting as a stand-up comic in 2009, British funnyman Rob Beckett has built an impressive career.
From podcasts and radio to hosting, television, and voiceovers, Rob is a versatile comedian.
New Zealand audiences might recognise him as one of the winners of the popular show ‘Taskmaster’, or the long-running ‘8 Out of 10 Cats’.
He has many other UK television shows to his name including ‘Rob & Romesh Vs.’ and ‘Celebs Go Dating’.
Now a father of two, he has focused his lens on the ups and downs of parenting and produces a smash-hit podcast ‘Parenting Hell’.

events.id: Genealogy - Basics of ancestry.com DNA tests-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Genealogy - Basics of ancestry.com DNA tests
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Find out what the size of your match means and the tools available to help you work out possible family relationships.
Also covered during this course are other websites you can upload your results to, how to manage other family member's DNA test results and other tools available when you get a bit more advanced - and just in case you need help in the future, we'll look at some of the places you could get this from.
Some of the courses may require you to login onto the network.
Bring a USB stick and your Ancestry.com login details.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: -  Understand the information provided by Ancestry.com about your DNA matches -  Use the Grouping, ThruLines and Common Ancestors tools on Ancestry.com -  Use the Shared CentiMorgan tool on DNAPainter.com -  Understand where to find other tools -  Understand the options for using other DNA websites -  Understand where to get further help Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.name: Mindful Awareness Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Mindful Awareness – One-Day Workshop This course is free for NZ citizens and residents.
Please enrol online and bring photo ID when attending the workshop.
If you are not a NZ citizen or resident, a fee of $149 applies and you must phone the office on 04 385 8919 to register.
“If we don’t know what we’re doing, how can we do what we want?” A hands-on, one-day workshop blending mindfulness, neuroscience, and self-awareness to help you feel better, relate better, and live with more clarity and purpose.
What you’ll get: Simple tools to soothe stress and calm your system Strategies to respond wisely instead of reacting on autopilot Insight into your feelings, needs and inner patterns Cutting-edge knowledge of the Vagus nerve and how it shapes your wellbeing An intro to Parts Work: understand the different parts of you and how they work together Practical ways to build creativity, clarity and genuine connection Skills to feel stronger in yourself, your relationships and your work life Everyday tools for better health, resilience and emotional balance Real tools.

events.long_description:
A sacred afternoon of cacao & heart sharing, embodied movement, and mutual honouring to heal the wounding and reconnect the masculine and feminine within and between us.
We’ll begin with a mixed-gender cacao heart share circle — a sacred, confidential space for Tāne and Wāhine to be vulnerable, seen, and heard.
Through ecstatic dance, we move and release energy together. A rich tapestry of tribal beats, global rhythms, and soul-stirring melodies.
We’ll close in a powerful honouring circle — women in the centre, men surrounding them with gratitude, then reversing, as we collectively tend to the wounded masculine–feminine connection with love and presence.
When: October 11th 2-5pm
Where: St Peters Village Hall, Paekākāriki
Sliding Scale: $25-50
Tickets are limited!
All are welcome.
LGBTQ+ Friendly
In love

events.description:
The original rhythm section of David Wm Sims and Mac McNeilly further continue to prove why they were and are the best bass & drum combo since Jones and Bonham, anchoring the ship as Captain Yow and first mate Denison navigate the wild seas of their songs.
However, each member is a sum of their parts but combined they are as Albini also once said “the purest melding of the sublime and profane.” Whether you are a longtime disciple of the Jesus Lizard, seeing them when last here in ‘98, or perhaps your fandom is more recent and have only seen videos of their legendary live performances, you will know that these shows are not to be missed.
Yet, when  that band is the Jesus Lizard, everything in your pathetic cultural dystopia suddenly falls  away and the air smells like Heaven… Their seventh studio album, Rack, produced by Paul Allen, and slated for release on September 13 via Ipecac Recordings, features 11  tracks of brisk guitar rock you haven’t heard since… the last time the Jesus Lizard took  over a stage in your town.

The Jesus Lizard.

events.id: Wellington Jazz Festival--Wellington NZ
events.name: Wellington Jazz Festival
events.long_description:
Soul, funk, jazz, fusion, rhythm and blues — it’s a celebration of sound across the city this spring. The annual Wellington Jazz Festival is back. The event packs over 100 gigs into five days in venues around the city. 
The festival features two major international acts making exclusive New Zealand debuts. Wellington will see two-time Grammy Award-winning jazz vocalist and bandleader, Gregory Porter and five-time Grammy Award-winning jazz singer, Samara Joy. Gregory Porter’s unique and timeless sound blends jazz, soul, and gospel. His influences include Bakersfield Southern Gospel and jazz legend Nat King Cole. At just 25 years old, Samara Joy has become a breakout jazz sensation. She’s redefining 21st-century jazz with a rich, mature tone and refined phrasing. 
The treats in the programme continue with Australian First Nations soul singer Bumpy, and a commissioned work by New Zealand/Congolese drummer, composer, and rhythm master  Myele Manzanza. He’ll be performing with international supergroup, lvdf. The Rodger Fox Big Band returns with a tribute to Ray Charles, and the Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra has its inaugural performance with a Duke Ellington arrangement of Tchaikovsky’s The Nutcracker Suite. Many of the hospitality venues in Courtenay Place and its surrounding streets are planning intimate jazz gigs across the festival. Follow the sound of saxophones to find a spot to park up for the night.
events.description:
The annual Wellington Jazz Festival is back.
The event packs over 100 gigs into five days in venues around the city.
The festival features two major international acts making exclusive New Zealand debuts.
Wellington will see two-time Grammy Award-winning jazz vocalist and bandleader, Gregory Porter and five-time Grammy Award-winning jazz singer, Samara Joy.
Gregory Porter’s unique and timeless sound blends jazz, soul, and gospel.

events.id: Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra - The Nutcracker Suite tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra - The Nutcracker Suite tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Witness a defining moment in this country’s jazz scene as the Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra (AoJO) makes its highly anticipated debut at Meow Nui.
Born from a collective vision championed and inspired by jazz legend Rodger Fox, AoJO represents the shared aspirations of the jazz community – honouring our jazz lineage while serving as a platform for its future. This newly formed, and proudly national ensemble brings our country’s jazz talent and legacy into focus.
Led by Musical Director John Rae and Concert Master Oscar Lavën, with Mike Taylor (lead trumpet) and Kaito Walley (lead trombone), this concert features Duke Ellington and Billy Strayhorn’s vibrant reimagining of Tchaikovsky's The Nutcracker Suite. A groundbreaking fusion of classical and jazz, it’s hailed as one of Ellington’s most inventive works. Together Strayhorn and Ellington showcase the familiar themes of Tchaikovsky’s ballet through the expressive power of jazz in orchestral form.
Prepare to be captivated by lush orchestration and melodic innovation as the AoJO takes to the stage for the very first time.

events.id: Yoko–Zuna: A Live Tribute to KAYTRANADA tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Yoko–Zuna: A Live Tribute to KAYTRANADA tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This October, Aotearoa electronic/progressive hip-hop powerhouse Yoko-Zuna will make their long anticipated return to Pōneke, presenting the music of KAYTRANADA in the city's magnificent Meow NUI. Over the past decade Yoko-Zuna have firmly established themselves as one of the country’s most exciting live acts and a favourite on the festival circuit. Just back from a world tour with hip-hop multihyphenate CHAII, the four piece made up of Swap Gomez, J.Y Lee, Kenji Iwamitsu-Holdaway, & Frank Eliesa once again join forces to perform their live tribute to a genre-defying beat wizard.
Louis Kevin Celestin aka KAYTRANADA is a Haitian-Canadian record producer and DJ. He first made waves in 2010 with a steady stream of mixtapes, remixes, and original tracks released under the name Kaytradamus. By 2013, reintroducing himself as KAYTRANADA, he was turning heads across the global music scene. The momentum only grew—by 2014, he landed a deal with the influential label XL Recordings. In 2016, he dropped his debut studio album, 99.9%, which was met with widespread critical acclaim. 2019’s Bubba—a genre-blurring triumph earned him two Grammy Awards, including Best Dance/Electronic Album, solidifying his place as one of the most innovative voices in contemporary music.

events.id: LVDF tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: LVDF tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
“Virtuosos” (The Guardian)
International jazz supergroup LVDF bring their genre-bending, globally informed sound to New Zealand for an exclusive appearance at the Wellington Jazz Festival.
All acclaimed bandleaders in their own right, LVDF is a cross-cultural quartet featuring Myele Manzanza (NZ/UK) on drums, Alex Hitchcock (USA/UK) on saxophone, Michelangelo Scandroglio (ITALY) on double bass and special guest Daniel Hayles (NZ) on piano and synths (stepping in for Maria Chiara Argirò). Their fresh sound fuses jazz with electronic textures, global rhythms and raw improvisation.
With Wellington-raised Myele Manzanza returning from London for this special hometown performance, LVDF will perform his groundbreaking Festival commission Music for a Multi-Polar World. This bold new work explores shifting global narratives through sound and draws on events from Brexit to the conflicts in Gaza, Sudan and Congo. Manzanza reflects “I’ve noticed how much the geopolitical shifts have unsettled and angered me, as well as shifting and widening my views on the world, and giving me some things to be hopeful for amidst change.” The work channels both the uncertainty and hope of a rapidly changing world.
The set will also feature tracks from LVDF’s upcoming self-titled EP - a bold and electric statement from a group as diverse in experience as it is unified in vision.
Only in Wellington - don’t miss the debut of one of modern jazz’s most exciting new ensembles, live at Meow Nui.
Commissioned by Wellington Jazz Festival
This LVDF performance is supported by Help Musicians UK, Embassy of Italy, Wellington & Comites Nuova Zelanda

Their fresh sound fuses jazz with electronic textures, global rhythms and raw improvisation.
With Wellington-raised Myele Manzanza returning from London for this special hometown performance, LVDF will perform his groundbreaking Festival commission Music for a Multi-Polar World.
Manzanza reflects “I’ve noticed how much the geopolitical shifts have unsettled and angered me, as well as shifting and widening my views on the world, and giving me some things to be hopeful for amidst change.” The work channels both the uncertainty and hope of a rapidly changing world.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Harakeke (Flax Weaving) Workshop Gain an introduction to the Māori art of flax weaving in an intensive one-day workshop, suitable for beginners and those with some experience.
By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to: •  Identify commonly-used types of harakeke •  Describe how to harvest and prepare harakeke for use •  Describe the tikanga (the protocol) surrounding the use of harakeke and weaving •  Demonstrate some basic weaving techniques •  Construct and complete a small project Materials provided but please bring a 'bread and butter' knife and 8 spring-loaded clothes pegs.
Tea and coffee provided but please bring your lunch.
[A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend) Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.name: Posture Perfection is Possible!
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Posture Perfection is Possible!
Movement lessons are done on the floor or sitting on a chair and are based on the pioneering work of Israeli physicist and engineer Dr. Moshe Feldenkrais.
By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to: • Identify and reduce muscle tension • Move with more lightness and freedom • Improve your posture • Describe some basic anatomy • Have tools to use at home and at work Bring two blankets (or a mat and a blanket) and wear loose, warm and comfortable clothing.

events.id: Letters Out Loud 2025-70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Letters Out Loud 2025
events.venue: 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
An evening of historical texts brought to life by famous voices. Tickets to this gala fundraising event include a souvenir programme and refreshments.  
Speakers include Ngahiwi Apanui Barr, Una Cruickshank, Tanea Heke, Michele Leggott, David O’Donnell, Karen O’Leary, Trevor Richards, Vaughan Slinn, Jennifer Ward-Lealand,
This will be an evening of poignancy, laughter, and connection with Aotearoa New Zealand's past. 
All profits go to support grants for research at the Alexander Turnbull Library. The Friends of the Turnbull Library (FOTL) offer grants of $20,000 available to scholars whose research involves the use of the collections of the Alexander Turnbull Library.  More information about these grants can be found here: Research Grant (turnbullfriends.org.nz)
Catering from 5.00, readings begin at 6.00, event concludes approx 7.15

events.id: Rodger Fox Big Band with Tony Lindsay tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Rodger Fox Big Band with Tony Lindsay tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The legendary Rodger Fox Big Band has kept the fires burning as the premier big band in Aotearoa for more than 50 years. This Wellington Jazz Festival, they will pay homage to music icon Ray Charles, whose fusion of gospel, rhythm and blues and jazz laid the foundations of soul and forever changed the sound of 20th century popular music.
Bringing the signature vocal intensity of Ray Charles will be special guests GRAMMY award-winning vocalist and former Santana lead signer Tony Lindsay (USA), together with Rodger Fox Big Band powerhouse blues vocalist Erna Ferry, soul sensation, pianist and singer Louis TM, with backing vocals from The Beatgirls.
Celebrate the legacy of one of the most influential singers in history with a powerful big band performance.

events.venue: 4 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
You're invited to New Zealand's Lab Sector Forum - Co:Lab 2025 Brought to you by the Awanui Group CoLab 2025 will bring together industry leaders, healthcare professionals, and experts to share strategies, case studies, and present interesting perspectives on the future of the roll of pathology laboratories in healthcare.
Co:Lab 2025 is delivered across two thought-provoking days with presentations from thought-leaders from both within and outside the sector.
This event is designed to get the lab network together, face-to-face, so all our speakers are delivering presentations in-person.
This year's theme is Pathology in Partnership: Strengthening Collaboration Across Healthcare.
With an increasing need for an interconnected health sector, the role of pathology laboratories extends beyond diagnostics - acting as a vital link between various healthcare disciplines.

events.id: Hutt Valley (Upper Hutt/Lower Hutt) Mathematics Leadership Community 2025-7 Kauri Street Lower Hutt, Wellington 5011-Event Brite
events.name: Hutt Valley (Upper Hutt/Lower Hutt) Mathematics Leadership Community 2025
events.venue: 7 Kauri Street Lower Hutt, Wellington 5011
events.long_description:
Are you the maths lead in your school? Do you feel equipped to lead the roll out of the new mathematics and statistics curriculum? Would you like to be part of a group of like-minded leads?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to:
stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum
build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school
investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics
connect and network with other leaders and teachers.

Testimonials from 2024
“These days have been invaluable in supporting me to lead whole school maths review with our teachers.”

“It has given me more knowledge and confidence when leading my own meetings, knowing I have research and work behind me when I lead.”

“I love the resources and the connections that develop through these meetings.”

“This year the mahi we have done around the curriculum refresh has been instrumental in beginning our school’s development of our localised curriculum.”

Meeting dates
20th March, 9.15am - 2.45pm
12th June, 9.15am - 2.45pm
14th August, 9.15am - 2.45pm
30th October, 9.15am - 2.45pm

What does it cost?
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees)
$100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees)
*Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school*

For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

events.description:
The UpliftEd Conference is an energising and thought-provoking event designed for educators who are passionate about their profession and the future of education in Aotearoa.
Hosted by the Aotearoa Educators' Collective, this conference brings together leading thinkers, researchers, and practitioners to explore what it truly means to uplift and empower teachers.
Expect inspiring keynotes, engaging panel discussions, and opportunities to connect with fellow educators who share your vision for the future of teaching and learning.
Thursday 30 October – Keynote Speakers & Discussions Opening Keynote: Professor Guy Claxton Renowned education thinker Guy Claxton will deliver a one-hour keynote, setting the stage for two days of deep thinking and discussion.
Special Interest Groups – Spaces for educators to connect around shared areas of passion, from Te Tiriti-based education to innovative assessment practices.

events.id: Sir Dave Dobbyn — Selected Songs-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Sir Dave Dobbyn — Selected Songs
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
He’s a treasured musical voice in New Zealand culture. Sir Dave Dobbyn has over 45 years of experience as a singer, songwriter, and recording artist. For one special night, he will be singing in Wellington at The Opera House. Many of his songs have acted as a backdrop to Kiwis’ lives and shaped the sound of the country’s popular music scene. Some of Dave’s songs are so famous that they have become anthems. You’ll get to hear many of them along with rich pickings from his back catalogue. 
Diagnosed with Parkinson’s Disease in 2022, Dave declared it “business as usual” — and continues to inspire with his unmistakable voice and enduring stage presence. Recognised with a Knighthood in 2021 for his services to music, Dave remains one of New Zealand’s most revered cultural figures.
